name: Aakansha Priya

As a frontend dev turned DevOps explorer, loves sharing tech insights, and views on learning & building in public, blogging & building personal brand. Aakansha, a reader and speaker, paints, sings, and loves spontaneous travel. She has spoken at various conferences about DevOps and the human side of tech. Catch her at meetups & conferences!

bio:
I'm a Cloud Developer Advocate with Google. I co-host for the Kubernetes Podcast by Google and the Cloud Careers Podcast.

With a steadfast dedication to innovation, Abdelkoddous continuously explores emerging trends and advancements in the field to deliver cutting-edge solutions.

His innovative approach and technical prowess drive the cutting-edge of cloud technology, transforming complex challenges into streamlined solutions.

bio: Abdullah is a curious person who loves architecture and infrastructure. He is currently working as Cloud Field Engineer at Canonical. He enjoys travelling and playing video games on his free time.

name: Abdulrahim Aljahdali
bio: DevOps & Cloud Engineer

name: Abhimanyu Bajaj

Check out his latest articles here: https://medium.com/@abhimanyubajaj98.”

name: Abhinav Dubey
bio:
I’m a Kubernetes enthusiast with a traveling soul, passionate about open-source software and cloud-native technologies. As a Solution Architect at Devtron Inc., I specialize in managing cloud-native application deployments and actively contribute to the open-source project Devtron (https://github.com/devtron-labs/devtron). My mission is to make Kubernetes adoption as seamless as packing for a weekend getaway, sharing my experiences and insights just as eagerly as I share my travel stories.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I’m thrilled to be a CNCF Ambassador because it gives me the opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals in the community. Being part of CNCF not only opens new doors for collaboration but also allows me to reach a broader audience. This platform helps me share knowledge, raise awareness, and educate more people about the Cloud Native ecosystem and the tools and technologies that power it.

name: Abhishek Behera
bio: I'm a seasoned Cloud Automation Architect specializing in cloud platforms, with deep expertise in CNCF technologies, particularly Kubernetes and cloud-native automation. I have extensive experience in automating cloud infrastructure and have pioneered open-source private cloud solutions. As the COE-Automation lead in my current project, I drive innovation and efficiency across the organization, while fostering a growth-oriented mindset within the team.

name: Abhishek Bvs
bio: I am a software engineer specializing in designing and implementing scalable and resilient software applications, serving thousands of users in real-time using Kubernetes and other CNCF technologies. I am passionate about solving complex computational problems, improving developer experience within the realms of DevOps and Cloud technologies. I enjoy and love solving problems around containers and Kubernetes.I am eager to contribute to the community and share my learnings.

name: Abigail Bangser
bio: Abby is a Principal Engineer at Syntasso delivering Kratix, an open-source cloud-native framework for building internal platforms on Kubernetes. Her keen interest in supporting internal development comes from over a decade of experience in consulting and product delivery roles across platform, site reliability, and quality engineering. Abby is an international keynote speaker, Team Topologies Advocate, and co-host of the #CoffeeOps London meetup. Outside of work, Abby spoils her pup Zino and enjoys playing team sports.

name: Abiodun Akanbi
bio: Highly skilled, seasoned mobile telecommunication expert in Evolved Packet Core and 5G core design/services with great enthusiasm for Telco Cloud. Bagged MSc in Telecommunications and certified in 5G, Kubernetes/Docker, VMware, Openstack, and PMP. Currently designing and deploying next generation cloud-native mobile data core (EPC & 5GC) network functions and services.

name: Achyutha Mithra

I constantly expand my skillset driven by a thirst for knowledge.

name: Adam Czepiel
bio: The career progression from Linux Engineer to DevOps Cloud Engineer involves starting with managing Linux systems using technologies like Nginx, LDAP, Samba and Bash scripting. Transitioning to a Cloud Engineer role includes leveraging cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, working with services such as EC2 and Azure VMs, and utilizing Docker for containerization. Finally, as a DevOps Cloud Engineer, one focuses on automation and CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, Kubernetes, Ansible and Terraform, ensuring efficient and scalable cloud infrastructure. I love DevOps and Kubernetes from day 1

name: Adam Gardner
bio: Adam is part of the Open-Source Program Office (OSPO) at DT where he works as a DevRel focusing on observability and security. SCUBA diving is his passion. Outside work you can find him on, in or under the sea.

name: Adam Rogers
bio: Just a dude who likes tech things and burgers

name: Adam Sawicki

I have been in IT for over 14 years now working with different roles and responsibilities, mostly in banking sector developing, supporting internal clients, vendor applications and platforms. I enjoy moving as much as possible into "as Code" principle.

name: Ader Fu
bio: Ader Fu, a.k.a. Yao-De Fu has extensive experience in DevOps and works at Chunghwa Telecom Co., Ltd. I am an active member of the Cloud Native Taiwan User Group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/cloudnative.tw) and co-organized the Kubernetes Community Day meetup event gathering (https://community.cncf.io/kcd-taiwan/) provides expertise in Kubernetes and CNCF technologies. I am also a member of Kubernetes Special Interest Group (SIG) Docs, and serve as an approver in the open source project cncf/glossary, and as an approver and reviewer in kubernetes/website. I am now fully certified in Kubernetes (CKA, CKAD, CKS, KCNA and KCSA) and am the first Kubetronaut in Taiwan. Favorite technologies include Kubernetes/DevOps/CNCF/APIM, etc.

He has vast exposure in several major domains like SDK, Security, Public Clouds, CI/CD, Backing Services and Observability, all on an architecture predominantly based on open-source and Kubernetes, by adopting the DevOps culture. He is a member of the Kubernetes GitHub organization via regular contributions to the Kubernetes documentation.

name: Aditya Soni
bio:
DevOps & Cloud Engineer, Public Speaker, Tech Mentor, Lead Organizer CNCG Jaipur, OpenSource & Community Contributor, AWS Community Builder, AWS Community Leader, 1 x (AWS, GCP, Azure), 6 x RedHat, CKA, KCNA certified.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It's been more than three years, I am being part of CNCF programs actively contributing via blogs, and public speaking on different open source DevOps/Cloud technologies at virtual and in-person events, I want to expand my learning and contribution with a wide area of peoples and uplift them with like-minded folks I can grow at the same time can share & help with my ideas to build better community bonding & culture.

name: Adrian Damm
bio: As a Principal Cloud Architect, I specialize in guiding cloud transformation projects and training professionals in Kubernetes, Helm, and other cloud-native tools. I focus on helping teams package, deploy, and orchestrate microservices at scale using cutting-edge technologies. I'm passionate about sharing my knowledge and helping others build resilient, scalable systems.

name: Adrian Simion Vlad
bio: Experienced consultant in multiple areas from virtualization to cybersecurity/ cloud and microservices solutions in public/ private and fintech startup environments. 19+ years working as am architect with hands-on expertise 120+ certifications

name: Adriana Villela
bio:
Adriana Villela is a Sr. Developer Advocate at Lightstep. She helps companies achieve reliability greatness through Observability, SRE, & DevOps practices. Before Lightstep, she managed a Platform Engineering team & an Observability Practices team at Tucows. Adriana has worked at various large-scale enterprises, as an individual contributor and leader, including Bank of Montreal, Ceridian, and Accenture. Adriana has a popular technical blog on Medium (https://adri-v.medium.com), is co-host of the On-Call Me Maybe Podcast (oncallmemaybe.com), and is a HashiCorp Ambassador.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having spent a chunk of my time in the last 10 months working with OpenTelemetry, I'm excited to use my ambassadorship to amplify my voice to promote and generate excitement about OpenTelemetry to the tech community at large. At the same time, I love digging into other CNCF projects like Kubernetes and ArgoCD, and I am looking forward to using my voice to help spread knowledge and excitement for those projects as well!

name: Afzal Ansari

He specializes in supporting cloud infrastructure and actively contributes to ArgoCD open-source project. Additionally, he has made significant contributions to various CNCF projects, including Meshery, Keptn, and Jaeger. His dedication to the Keptn project earned him recognition as a Keptn Crew member. He also enjoys creating video content and writing blogs to share his experiences in the cloud-native space with like-minded individuals.

I have also been recognized as an AWS Ambassador for my contributions to the cloud community and honored as an ET Great People Manager. Passionate about collaboration and sharing knowledge, I actively engage with the tech community through Meetups and other initiatives. Additionally, I write on LinkedIn about developer productivity and DevOps. I run a YouTube channel where I discuss Kubernetes and platforms: https://www.youtube.com/@ajitinamdartech.

It also plays a crucial role in improving SLA compliance while optimizing FinOps and security practices.

name: Akrem Grayaa

My expertise extends to tools like Terraform and cloud-native infrastructure management, making me a well-rounded tech expert.

name: Alan Flower
bio:
Alan heads the HCL Cloud Native & AI Labs business and is also the HCL CTO for Cloud Native.  A successful entrepreneur and technologist, Alan is deeply passionate about using technology to support the digital transformation of business and driving the creation of innovative products and services.

Alan has an extensive track record as both a visionary and thought leader. He combines in-depth engineering credibility with real hands-on experience leading global technology organizations. With a track record of bringing over 250 software products to market, Alan has a unique perspective on the application of modern Cloud-enabled services to accelerate market success.

HCL Cloud Native & AI Labs are the HCL Centre of Excellence, helping clients leverage modern technologies and practices to accelerate transformation.

Working closely with HCL ecosystem partners, the Labs showcase the Art-of-the-Possible, and with a track record of over 1,000 engagements, the Labs are uniquely positioned to guide our clients’ complete journey.

The Labs provide engineering assistance to modernize existing applications, or to create innovative new solutions. Deeply collaborative, our Labs also provide education and skills modernization to support the cultural transformation necessary to make the vision of a Cloud Native Enterprise become a reality.

Alan leads HCL corporate participation in leading open-source communities such as the Linux Foundation and the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

He is a Fellow of both the British Computer Society and a Fellow of the Institute of Enterprise and Entrepreneurs.

name: Alan Oliveux
bio: I’m a DevOps engineer who like learn new technologies and run them in production. I also like to help customers to do amazing things.

name: Alberto Bullo
bio: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)/Cloud engineer focusing on Kubernetes and infrastructure automation. My passion for technology and the terminal led me into the world of Kubernetes, cloud-native, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and Linux. I love the everything-as-code GitOps approach, observability & monitoring and exploring new and innovative solutions to solve everyday challenges. The CNCF landscape has been an amazing exploration where there is always new advancements to discover. As a firm believer in the "never stop learning" 🚀 mindset, I'm glad to have this opportunity to be a kubestronaut and enhance my experience in this dynamic field. Excited to be part of this vibrant community!

bio: DevOps engineer. Fueled by coffee. ☕ Passionate about learning and embracing challenges as opportunities for growth. In my free time, I enjoy exploring new technologies, reading, traveling, attending concerts and festivals, and dabbling in photography.

In 2019 naturally I switched to DevOps after I realized that without even knowing I was implementing a variety of DevOps practices in my team. I am currently pursuing Cloud specializations with a main focus on the development lifecycle with Kubernetes, predominantly utilizing CNCF-graduate and other OSS projects like VS Code, Lens, Terraform, Helm, Argo, Istio, Prometheus, Trivy etc. Outside of the digital world I am a philosophy and singing enthusiast, as well as a mental health advocate.

He provides management and technical leadership to engineering and development teams, with a focus on Kubernetes, Cloud, and Security. His expertise also includes DevOps, GitOps, and DevSecOps.

I love discovering each product under the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) and applying them in the best possible scenarios. I love participating in the community! See you around.

He has passion for all things cloud native, he's been around open source for 25 years and recently founded a startup that offers innovative Namespaces-as-a-service for developers. Twitter handle: @bongo

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Because I was before and it was awesome!

First, as a software engineer at Cycle.io which is a LowOps containers as a service platform and then at Bombora (bombora.com) as a Devops Engineer supporting a MLE/DE team. Also, been passionate about being involved in CNCF open source projects as contributor.

Years of experience with Kubernetes, Helm, Prometheus, and Istio allow me to build fault-tolerant solutions on all popular cloud platforms.

bio: Systems administrator (some call it DevOps, SRE, or Platform Engineering) with a focus on Kubernetes. When I’m not working or tinkering in my home lab, you’ll find me at the park training my dog or in a café catching up with colleagues.

name: Alex Stan

I specialise in building scalable and reliable systems with a focus on simplicity, maintainability, and performance. My top three favourite technologies are Kubernetes, Ansible and Terraform and I enjoy automating tasks using Go, Python and Bash. I thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments where innovation and agility take precedence over rigid planning and narrowly defined tasks.

name: Alex Szakaly

Whether working on deployments, tirelessly writing new Kubernetes Operators, or contributing to open-source initiatives, he brings a wealth of experience and a proactive mindset to the table. Last but not least, Alex is passionate about the vibrant community surrounding CNCF.

He is proficient with tools like ArgoCD, Cilium, Kyverno and many more which he uses to enhance Kubernetes. He is passionate about improving developer experience and collaborates closely with developers to optimize workflows and processes. He is dedicated to try new technologies and refining existing setups to ensure highly available, scalable, and secure Kubernetes clusters.

name: Alexander Rainchik

name: Alexander Yamunaque

My working stack is not limited to Kubernetes, other CNCF projects that I am using are: Helm, Argo, Kyverno. I prefer spending free time cycling, hiking or doing other outdoor activities.

name: Alexandre Lopes Fernandes
bio: Azure | Cloud Architect | Kubernetes | DevOps | Security | Infrastructure as Code

name: Alexandru Herisanu
bio: Hi I'm Heri, a Solution Architect working at Booking.com. I focus on application migrations from on-premise systems to the cloud. I have a strong background in tuning distributed systems and streaming applications. I've started my career in university research where I worked on Grid and HPC systems, I then worked on different Enterprise CMS solutions, switched to Site Reliability Engineering and then finally switched to Solution Architecture. Currently I specialize in containerized applications and microservices (Kubernetes, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Istio, Cilium).

name: Alexandru Țopa

name: Alexej Disterhoft

I love exploring and tinkering with these technologies to deepen my expertise in the Kubernetes ecosystem. I’m also deeply interested in cybersecurity and enjoy activities like "upskilling" in controlled environments and competing in security-related Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges. When I’m not working, I could be busy with my family or you’ll find me outdoors, mountain biking, hiking, or running to stay inspired and balanced.

name: Alexis Zamanis
bio: Alexis holds a degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the National Technical University of Athens. He launched his career at Arrikto, an innovative startup specializing in cloud-native storage and MLOps, before joining D ONE as a cloud engineer, where he tackled a variety of challenges, including spearheading the migration of a monolithic application to the cloud. With contributions to CNCF open-source projects like the official Kubernetes Python client, Alexis is deeply passionate about cloud-native technologies, with a particular affinity for Kubernetes.

name: Ali Ok
bio:
Ali is a Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat, where he focuses on developing and contributing to open-source software. He has a strong track record of contributions to various projects, communities, and foundations, and he is currently an active contributor to the Knative project. In addition to his technical contributions, Ali is also deeply committed to mentoring and promoting contributor growth within the CNCF community. He plays an active role in the Google Summer of Code program at CNCF, where he serves as an admin. He is also a frequent speaker on topics such as starting to contribute to open-source software and the projects he is working on.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF Ambassador is an exciting opportunity for me to expand my reach and impact within the community. As someone who is already involved in mentoring and contributor growth activities at CNCF, I'm eager to use the ambassador title to promote CNCF technologies, open-source software, and help interested individuals get started with contributing to CNCF projects. Additionally, being part of a network of other CNCF Ambassadors will allow me to collaborate and share ideas with like-minded individuals who are passionate about the same things. I'm excited to be part of this community and look forward to making a meaningful impact.

name: Ali Samid
bio: I am a passionate Site Reliability Engineer with a strong background in network and system administration. I have extensive experience in automation, infrastructure as code, and scripting with Bash and Python. Enthusiastic about cloud-native technologies, I actively explore and contribute to the CNCF ecosystem. I also participate in tech communities and Meetups, sharing knowledge and best practices around Kubernetes and reliability engineering.

name: Ali Yousefi
bio: I've been an infrastructure engineer for a long time. I've experienced data centers, co-locations, virtualization, public and private clouds, and containerization. As a cloud solution architect, I help my customers with Kubernetes architecture design, review, education, troubleshooting and cloud native development.

name: Alireza Rahmani
bio: Alireza Rahmani is a Red Hat Senior Cloud Success Architect, professor, and CNCF advocate with deep expertise in Kubernetes, Openshift, multi-cloud, and cloud-native technologies. Currently a Doctoral Engineer candidate at Penn State University, he is dedicated to bridging the gap between academia and industry by fostering innovation and collaboration. Through his teaching, research, and thought leadership, Alireza empowers individuals and organizations to excel in the rapidly evolving technology landscape.

name: Alisan Stoll
bio: I am a software engineer captivated by the power and intricate orchestration of Kubernetes, drawn to the ever-evolving growth of the CNCF ecosystem and its vibrant community."

name: Alistair Mackay
bio: Experienced IT professional with a background in development, database administration, cloud and DevOps. Currently working on a platform with 40+ Kubernetes clusters and as a part time mentor to students on the KodeKloud platform.

name: Allen R. Chan
bio: Director of Engineering with foundation in Software and Data engineering. Having co-founded 3 companies, and helped multiple early to hyper growth startups - wearing many, many hats led me to cross-skill in almost the entire value delivery chain: AI/ML, DevSecOps, FinOps, Project and Product Management, and Enterprise Architecture. For the past 15 years, my team and I have built and migrated Customer Data Platforms 4x over end-to-end from ETL to activation/delivery. From on-premise HPCs with C# and MSSQL, to Hybrid cloud with Hadoop, Parquet, Hive, and Impala, to Cloud-hosted Spark and Microservices, and more recently to Cloud Native with Kubernetes and Databricks/Snowflake.

name: Alolita Sharma
bio:
Alolita is an OpenTelemetry GC member, CNCF Observability TAG co-chair and CNCF Governing Board alternate board member from Apple. She leads Apple’s AIML observability practice and contributes to open source and open standards in OpenTelemetry, Unicode, W3C and the Observability TAG.

As a founding member of the CNCF’s End User TAB, Alolita has facilitated participation and contributions by CNCF end user members. She has also promoted end user priorities to the CNCF TOC and Governing Board. Within her rich track record, Alolita has demonstrated a deep commitment to CNCF's goals and initiatives. Alolita brings a wealth of experience from her board leadership roles in the industry. For example, she has served on the boards of the OSI, SFLC.in and Unicode Consortium. Alolita has also provided strong leadership for observability and search engineering at AWS and has managed engineering teams at IBM, PayPal, Twitter, and Wikipedia.

name: Alonso Parasxidis Moreno
bio: I am a Cloud/DevOps/SRE Engineer with deep expertise in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. As an AWS User Group Leader, I actively engage with the community, sharing knowledge on Kubernetes, Helm, ArgoCD, Envoy, Prometheus, Crossplane, and OpenTelemetry. I run meetups focused on AWS and CNCF technologies, helping engineers navigate cloud-native ecosystems.

name: Aloysius Wang
bio: Aloysius is a DevSecOps and Kubernetes expert with extensive experience in SRE, backend architecture, and cybersecurity. Aloysius specializes in integrating security into development workflows, automating CI/CD pipelines, and managing Kubernetes clusters. Aloysius's innovative work includes implementing dynamic environments for automated review workflows, enabling early testing and enhancing code quality. Dedicated to bridging the gap between cutting-edge technology and practical implementation, Aloysius fosters efficiency, adaptability, and secure practices in all projects.

name: Alper Devrim
bio: DevOps Engineer with expertise in modern cloud-native technologies, including Kubernetes, Helm, and Prometheus. Experienced in automating deployments, optimizing infrastructure, and ensuring scalable, reliable, and secure systems. Passionate about CI/CD pipelines, monitoring solutions, and improving operational efficiency.

name: Altan Altundemir
bio: As a dedicated consultant with a profound passion for cloud-native technologies, he brings extensive experience working with a variety of cloud-native products. His expertise spans the implementation and optimization of cloud solutions, enabling businesses to achieve agility and scalability. He is committed to driving innovation and excellence in the cloud-native landscape.

name: Alvin Estrada
bio:
Tech and Community lover with more than 10 years of experience playing with software professionally. Engaged in cloud native since 2017 when he began learning about Kubernetes, it served as his gateway to the world of tech meetups. Since then, he has actively participated in and collaborated with multiple tech communities in Guatemala and across Latin America Actively collaborating with: Cloud Native Latam - CNCF Group Kubernetes Guatemala - CNCF Group Cloud Native Guatemala - CNCF Group Kong Meetup Guatemala TensorFlow User Group Guatemala.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Since I first started learning about tech, the community has played a significant role, and being part of a Cloud Native meetup I've been able to see how it creates great opportunities to meet people, learn from their experiences, get inspired and inspire others! I strongly believe that the community movement can make a difference specially on my region, helping us not just to improve our technical skills but also in how we interact, create and learn together.

name: Aman Pasi
bio: I like to explore the depths of Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies, specializing in tools like Helm, Prometheus, and Istio. I share my knowledge through blogs on LinkedIn(www.linkedin.com/in/amanpasi) & Medium(https://medium.com/@amanpasi) and practical insights to help teams solve real-world cloud-native challenges. My goal is to empower others to harness Kubernetes effectively and drive innovation in the cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Aman Puri

name: Amedeo Palopoli

During this time, he deepened his interest in containerization and deploying cloud-native applications on Kubernetes through research studies that resulted in publications in scientific journals such as ACM and IEEE. Currently, he's part of the Aruba Cloud group to design and support the cloud management platform which is one of the CNCF Kubernetes Service Provider

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Is a great honor to have the opportunity on collaborate and increase the community, I am very excited to be part and advocate in favor of this big community.

name: Amit Ghosh

name: Amol Gaikwad
bio: I am a passionate technologist and cricket enthusiast (the sport, not the insect!), always learning and staying up to date with new technologies. I am flexible and dynamic, ready to adapt to new challenges, and have worked in top companies in the oil and gas and fintech industries.

name: Amos Egonmwan

Passionate about Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies like microservices, service meshes, CI/CD pipelines, container orchestration, serverless architectures, observability, and GitOps, Amos continuously explores innovative trends to deliver cutting-edge solutions to complex IT problems. Amos holds graduate degrees in Applied Mathematics and Numerical Simulation.

name: Amr Muhammed Mahmoud
bio: Enthusiastic DevOps/Platform Engineer dedicated to delivering innovative and scalable solutions that drive organizational growth. With expertise in CI/CD pipeline architecture, Kubernetes management, cloud-native infrastructure, observability, and security integration, I ensure secure and efficient software delivery. I leverage cutting-edge technologies, particularly within the Kubernetes and CNCF ecosystems, to drive operational excellence and foster innovation. Passionate about collaborating with highly skilled teams to lead impactful digital transformation initiatives, bridging the gap between development and operations to achieve efficiency, resilience, and continuous improvement.

name: An Nguyen
bio: I am currently working at Katalon Company, where I am deeply involved in exploring and learning about CNCF technologies. My primary interest lies in Kubernetes (K8s), and I am actively expanding my knowledge in this area. I frequently participate in Meetups and community events related to cloud-native technologies to stay updated with the latest trends and best practices

name: Ana Margarita Medina
bio:
Ana Margarita Medina is a Staff Developer Advocate at Lightstep, where she speaks on all things SRE, DevOps, and Reliability, and is a podcast host for On-Call Me, Maybe (oncallmemaybe.com). She is a self-taught engineer with over 12 years of experience, focusing on cloud infrastructure and reliability in the last few. She is also part of the Kubernetes Release Team (v1.25 - v1.27) and has been advising CNCF's Keptn (keptn.sh) project since 2019. When time permits her, she leads efforts to dispel the stigma surrounding mental health and bring more Black and Latinx folks into tech.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I want to continue giving back to the CNCF community, I see this as another great opportunity to connect with other developers (open source and end users) and learn about their struggles with current tooling to help shape where this industry moves toward. I'm also very excited to empower others to see that they too belong in tech, that there is space for them to work in cloud-native, and become open-source contributors, and for folks to join in and help us grow this community and build responsible tech.

name: Anastasiia Gubska

Through my involvement in the Deaf and Hard of Hearing Working Group (DHHWG), I've contributed to best practices for inclusive, welcoming conferences and worked with the LF/CNCF to enhance accessibility across our ecosystem.

name: Andi Pangeran
bio: An active member in the cloud-native community, Passionate about knowledge sharing, they run local Meetups to help developers and engineers adopt cloud-native practices. With a deep understanding of modern DevOps tools, they focus on improving automation and infrastructure scalability.

I love sharing my knowledge and discussing challenging topics to support others in their development and success.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Ambassadors are a point of reference in the cloud native community and help many initiatives come to life. I want to empower talented individuals to realize their ambitions and help the CNCF to reach a wider community through events, meetups, and mentoring. I want to make a difference by empowering others.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The success of any community depends on the people that actively drive community activities (bringing people together, educating, making them feel comfortable ..) and the members of the community that then want to join, grow and eventually contribute back to that community. I am excited to get the chance to help grow the community with my goal to inspire many others to do the same

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be joining the CNCF Ambassador program. As someone who is deeply passionate about building and promoting fundamental technologies, particularly in the realm of Cloud Native solutions, I feel grateful for the opportunity to deepen my connections with the community and share my knowledge and experience with open-source users around the globe. By being part of this program, I hope to make a broader impact and bring even more value to Linux Foundation and CNCF. Additionally, I am eager to learn more about the needs of users and help them understand how they can effectively use cloud native and container technology to solve their problems.

Recognized for his leadership, mentoring, and commitment to innovation, Kenny consistently delivers reliable and scalable solutions for modern cloud-native applications. He remains dedicated to staying at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies, continuously expanding and deepening his skill set. My expertise lies in architecting and deploying scalable, reliable, and cloud-agnostic infrastructures and applications that adhere to cloud-native principles, as well as building Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs). I strongly leverage GitOps, DevOps best practices, and open-source solutions whenever possible, while maximizing the potential of the cloud. I am dedicated to driving innovation in cloud-native technologies, contributing to the growth of this vibrant community, and expanding my network with fellow enthusiasts!

I look forward to expanding my impact within the community, collaborating with fellow ambassadors, and enjoying the journey of contributing to a thriving ecosystem.

bio: I'm a software engineer with a keen interest in Cloud-native technologies. Always eager to learn, constantly seeking ways to expand my knowledge and stay at the forefront of technological advancements.

name: Artur Propp
bio: I'm a passionate software engineer with a background in industrial engineering. I love building the full stack including the infrastructure for web and mobile apps that scale. To achieve this, I keep on learning and exploring new technology stacks.

name: Arun Avasare
bio: Experienced DevOps professional with a proven track record in the dynamic internet industry. Proficient in orchestrating robust infrastructure solutions and optimizing software delivery pipelines. Skilled in a wide array of cutting-edge technologies, including cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), infrastructure as code (Terraform), CI/CD (GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Harness), configuration management (Ansible), monitoring and logging, code quality (SonarQube), version control (Git, GitHub, Bitbucket), automation scripting (Python, Linux Shell Scripting), service mesh (Istio), and deployment automation (Helm Charts, Harness, Jenkins). My expertise lies in architecting scalable, resilient, and secure cloud-native environments while driving automation initiatives to streamline development workflows. Passionate about leveraging emerging technologies to enhance operational efficiency, accelerate time-to-market, and deliver exceptional user experiences. Let's connect to explore opportunities for collaboration and innovation in the ever-evolving landscape of DevOps and cloud technologies.

name: Arun Gupta
bio: Arun Gupta is vice president and general manager of Open Ecosystem Initiatives at Intel Corporation. He is an open source strategist, advocate, and practitioner for nearly two decades. He has taken companies such as Apple, Amazon, and Sun Microsystems through systemic changes to embrace open source principles, contribute and collaborate effectively. As an elected chair of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) Governing Board, Arun works with CNCF leadership and member companies to grow cloud native ecosystem. He has delivered technical talks in 45+ countries, authored multiple books, and is a Docker Captain, Java Champion, and Java User Group leader. He also founded the Devoxx4Kids chapter in the U.S. and continues to promote technology education among children. Arun holds two patents on using XML and XSL for an efficient generation of test reports. Arun is an avid runner, and is easily accessible at @arungupta on Twitter.

name: Arvind Singh
bio: Hi, I’m Arvind Singh, a seasoned DevOps and SRE professional with over 12 years of experience. I specialize in Kubernetes, cloud technologies, and automation, having worked with companies like Shoreline to streamline incident management and auto-remediation processes. As the founder of ventures like FutureApp and AlertMend.io, I’m passionate about creating solutions that save time and improve operational efficiency. Currently, I’m focused on growing AlertMend.io and exploring business opportunities across Asia in the DevOps and IT services sectors.

name: Aryat Khayretdinov
bio:
Ayrat (Archy) is a CNCF Ambassador, Cloud Native Tech Professor at Mcgill University and Cloud Native Architect at Google Cloud. As a CNCF Ambassador he has an opportunity to educate people and share knowledge about benefits of Cloud Native ecosystem via CNCF and Kubernetes Meetups, workshops or by helping customers to build modern cloud native applications that can run seamlessly on-prem or any cloud provider. Archy is passionate about community, he is a Founder and lead organizer of Canadian CNCF Meetups (Virtual, Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal, Quebec, Waterloo, Halifax) and frequent speaker GDG, CNCF Meetups and CNCF related conferences. He is an organizer of Canadian Kubernetes Community Days (KCDs), Cloud Native Days Canada 2019 and GDG Cloud & AI DevFest 2019.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: To be part of amazing team of Ambassadors provides you opportunity to learn from other experts and meet new friends across the world who is passionate about same technology. Being Ambassador also gives you a life time opportunity to meet and learn with Cloud Native Community at Kubecons. Give back to community by organizing K8s Meetups, KCDs and sharing the knowledge with wider community.

name: Asanka Nissanka
bio: Senior platform Engineer with a respectable career spanning over 10+ years of experience implementing cloud-based platforms and applications in heterogeneous enterprise environments. Certified Kubernetes specialist and a co-creator of the Kubernetes Platform Accelerator at Sourced Group. I am also an AWS-certified professional solutions architect. Blog: https://medium.com/@asankanissanka

name: Ashish Kumar Matapathi
bio: Hello! I’m Ashish Kumar Matapathi,I have a strong passion for cloud technologies and enjoy exploring the latest CNCF tools. Kubernetes is a particular area of interest for me, and I love diving into its complexities.

name: Ashley Mayra
bio:
Ashley is an Event Planner at The Linux Foundation, helping with the fulfillment of sponsorship benefits for Kubecon + CloudNativeCon events.

Ashley has been in the events industry producing and coordinating global meetings and conferences since 2011. She has worked in the private, public and non-profit sectors strongly focused on exhibits and sponsorships. Ashley received her BAA from Central Michigan University.

name: Ashok Kumar Varma
bio: I am Ashok Kumar Varma, an Infrastructure Director with a deep passion for learning and expertise in cloud-native , Infrastructure and Machine Learning technologies. With 20 years of experience in infrastructure management, I had the privilege to work across major telecommunications customers in APAC Region , covering all aspects of infrastructure implementations from design , procurement , Installation to production operations. My experience in deploying and managing scalable, resilient infrastructure allows me to enhance operational efficiency, and driving the adoption of cutting-edge technologies and best practices.

name: Ashok Srirama
bio: Ashok is a Containers Specialist Solutions Architect at AWS with 18+ years of experience in software engineering and distributed systems. He has led multiple cloud migration projects over the past 10+ years and now focuses on helping customers leverage Kubernetes for Gen AI workloads. He specializes in serverless applications, containers, and cloud architecture. Outside work, he enjoys cricket and driving.

name: Ashwin Kumar Naik
bio: Senior Cloud Architect at Google. I possesses a strong understanding of cloud-native principles, DevOps practices, and I have passion for staying at the forefront of cloud technologies.

name: Aswin Thiyagarajan
bio: I'm a Platform Engineer passionate about automating application deployments and streamlining DevOps workflows. I leverage modern tools and best practices to ensure secure, efficient, and scalable software delivery. My focus lies in bridging the gap between code and infrastructure to create high-performing solutions.

name: Atanas Atanasov
bio: I'm a seasoned IT Engineer who fell in love with the DevOps culture several years ago and have been following its principals since then. My experience as Support and Cloud Engineer, SRE, DevOps, Service Design and Solution Architecture guided me through numerous challenges...and I love every one of them. Digging deep into the Kubernetes ecosystem while learning how to write custom resources and enhance different aspects of it, is my vocation now. “The key to following the continuous delivery path is to continually question your own assumptions about what’s possible.” —Jeff Sussna

name: Atif Mehmood Malik
bio:
Competent and highly experienced Cloud Architect with more than 12 years of experience in designing scalable, secure, and performance optimized Cloud infrastructure platforms. Well versed in Cloud Native technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Argo, and Flux. Expertise in designing, deploying, and managing infrastructure for business-critical applications and workloads in AWS, Azure, and OCI.

Led the digital transformation journey across multiple large UAE Federal Government entities and national projects by playing key role as Cloud / Infrastructure Architect.

name: Atil Eren Sensalduz
bio: Atil Sensalduz is an advocate for open-source and cloud-native technologies, with significant experience in Kubernetes and CNCF projects. He consistently seeks to broaden his knowledge and embrace new challenges. Atil's enthusiasm for continuous learning and innovation drives him to push the boundaries of what's possible in the cloud-native space.

name: Attila Akai
bio: With several years of experience in the DevOps field, I bring a wealth of expertise in cloud infrastructure, especially focused on Azure. Proficiently managing CI/CD pipelines, IaC, monitoring solutions, and Kubernetes orchestration across various distributions, I leverage both enterprise and open-source solutions. Currently serving as a DevOps Architect at Alerant Zrt. in Hungary, I have participated in and managed projects across diverse sectors, including finance, government, and telecommunications, both in my current role and in previous positions. My comprehensive skill set enables me to effectively contribute to projects and optimize complex infrastructures, driving operational efficiency and innovation.

name: Atulpriya Sharma
bio:
I'm a tester turned developer advocate. I work on & talk about Cloud native, Kubernetes & DevOps. I also create content - blog posts, Twitter threads - & host Twitter spaces. In addition, I'm one of the organiser of CNCF Hyderabad and strongly believe in collaborative learning and growth. When I am not working, I'm a food & travel blogger & love exploring eateries & going on road trips. You can find me at @TheTechMaharaj on Twitter.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am absolutely stoked to be a CNCF ambassador! Being a part of this community means I get to geek out with a group of like-minded individuals who are passionate about Cloud native technologies, Kubernetes, and DevOps. It's an opportunity to keep learning and growing, while also sharing my knowledge and enthusiasm with people in Hyderabad. I'm excited to dive headfirst into the latest trends and developments, all while having a blast! I can't wait to host fun events, share cool content, and help spread the word about CNCF and related technologies. Overall, this is not just a chance to contribute to a thriving ecosystem, but to also make connections, learn new things, and have a ton of fun along the way!

name: Aung Aung Myo Myint
bio: I'm a Senior Server and Cloud Specialist advocate with linux and cloud-native technologies. I am keep learning Cloud-Native Computing Kubernetes, Prometheus, and other CNCF projects. My expertise lies in linux, AWS Cloud, Redhat Openstack, container orchestration and microservices architecture.

name: Aurélie Vache
bio:
Aurélie is a Developer Advocate at OVHcloud. She is a CNCF Ambassador, Docker Captain, GDE for Cloud & GitPod Hero. Conferences organizer since 2016. She is a technical writer, a book author & reviewer. She is also a sketchnoter and a speaker at international conferences. She is a co-host for the "Tranches de Tech" OVHcloud podcast. She created a new visual way for people to learn and understand Cloud technologies: "Understanding Kubernetes/Istio/Docker in a visual way" in sketchnotes, videos and visual technical books.
Blog: https://dev.to/aurelievache/
Conferences: https://noti.st/aurelievache
Books: https://www.amazon.com/stores/Aur%C3%A9lie-Vache/author/B09WHB5YR6

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I have been a passionate and advocate of Cloud Native, especially CNCF technologies, for many years and I am very happy to be its ambassador. It's an opportunity for me to share and spread knowledge, contribute to native cloud technologies and meet the community.

name: Aurélien Simon
bio:
Aurélien is a cloud and platform engineer with a strong focus on cloud-native technologies. He has hands-on experience across various CNCF projects, both in production environments and in cloud-lab setups, spanning the CNCF landscape.

An enthusiastic advocate for Infrastructure as Code (IAC) and open source, Aurélien is also keenly interested in SRE and DevSecOps practices.

He is committed to driving innovation and supporting the cloud-native ecosystem through active knowledge sharing and collaboration.

name: Austin Marten
bio: A former Marine Corps Military Police officer, I earned my bachelor's degree in Computer Information Systems: Cybersecurity from the University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point. I began my career as an IT Generalist and have advanced to DevSecOps Engineer, working primarily with open-source software and CNCF technologies. I have achieved all five Kubernetes certifications, becoming a certified Kubestronaut. I am passionate about securely deploying and managing cloud-native applications and infrastructures and continuously seek to further progress my skillsets and knowledge.

name: Austin White
bio: Austin is a DevOps and Platform Engineer who specializes in cloud native technologies, development and delivery practices. He strives to uplift both people and processes and, more generally, to leave things better than when he found them.

name: Ayaz Memmedov
bio: I am a DevOps engineer with experience in automating workflows, optimizing infrastructure, and working with CNCF tools. I specialize in Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-native technologies to build scalable, efficient, and reliable systems. I am passionate about solving complex infrastructure challenges and enabling teams to deliver software faster and more securely. I actively participate in Meetups, share knowledge with the community, and continuously explore emerging technologies to stay ahead in the DevOps field

name: Ayesha Sarosh
bio: I'm a senior engineer who loves to play around with Kubernetes, passionate about open-source technology in the public sector. I am interested in integrating open-source solutions with a focus on legal compliance and policy alignment.

name: Aykut Bulgu
bio:
Aykut Bulgu has 15+ years of experience working as a software engineer, consultant, trainer, and technical content architect. He has worked on many enterprise projects—mainly Java—and has expertise in JBoss middleware. He's an expert on Apache Kafka, Apache Camel, Kubernetes/OpenShift, and Strimzi (Kafka on Kubernetes).

He is currently working as a Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat Ansible team. After years with Java, he tries to master and embrace Python and Go as his new languages. Moreover, he helps organizations with technical content development and training via System Craftsman.

name: Aylin Salieva-Trendafilov
bio: I began my journey in the IT field about five years ago, with a primary focus on on-premises infrastructure. Currently, I’m working as a Site Reliability Engineer, driven by a passion for continuous learning and development in the ever-evolving tech landscape. I thrive on tackling new challenges and pushing myself beyond my comfort zone. I'm eager to contribute to larger-scale infrastructure projects and deepen my expertise in cloud-native environments.

name: Ayman Feki
bio: My name is Ayman Feki, and I’m a trainer specializing in DevOps and Kubernetes. I’m passionate about providing hands-on training that empowers individuals to gain practical, real-world skills. My goal is not just to teach but to create a collaborative and enriching learning experience built on open communication and a positive mindset. Whether you're just starting out or advancing your skills, I’m here to help you grow and succeed. Training with me is a shared journey, and I look forward to connecting and making a difference together in the DevOps and Kubernetes community!

name: Ayman Zahran
bio: AWS/Azure/GCP/VMWare/Kubernetes Cloud/DevOps/Platform/SRE Freelancer || AWS Community Builder || AWS Certification SME || 11x AWS || 5x Azure || 4x VMware || Kubestronaut(5x Kubernetes) || 3x Hashicorp

name: Ayoub Ed-Dafali
bio: I am a Senior Cloud Native Engineer, with 6+ years of experience. I love working with Kubernetes, Linux, IaC, Cloud, CI/CD and Python. I am always excited to dive into new innovations, and I love sharing my knowledge with the Open Source community.

name: Aziz Chahkar
bio: As a Cloud Engineer, I thrive on building secure, scalable, and highly automated cloud platforms. My passion lies in creating cloud-native solutions and designing seamless CI/CD workflows that make complex systems feel effortless—“so easy that even a chimpanzee and two trainees could run them!” I focus on leveraging tools like Kubernetes, GitOps, and automation frameworks to ensure both reliability and resilience at scale. When I'm not solving cloud challenges, I love diving into cutting-edge DevOps technologies and continuously sharpening my skills. Outside of work, I enjoy contributing to the community through sharing my insights and connecting with like-minded engineers. #PlatformEngineering #Kubernetes #GitOps #ArgoCD #Crossplane

name: Aziza Hamdani
bio: I'm Aziza Hamdani, a seasoned DevOps/SRE engineer with a knack for mastering the Cloud Native Stack and Public Clouds like AWS and GCP. I'm passionate about automating robust, scalable, and highly available systems using technologies like Kubernetes and the Cloud Native Tooling. When I'm not optimizing cloud infrastructures, you can find me cuddling with my cats or exploring new travel destinations. Let's connect and explore how we can collaborate on exciting projects!

name: Balaji Ravi
bio: With over 13+ years of IT experience, I am a DevOps professional with a solid track record in the Engineering services and Insurance sectors. I am adept at developing robust infrastructure solutions and enhancing software delivery pipelines. My expertise spans a broad range of state-of-the-art technologies, including cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), infrastructure as code (Terraform), CI/CD tools (GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps), configuration management (Ansible), as well as monitoring and logging. I am proficient in code quality tools (SonarQube), version control systems (Git, GitHub, Bitbucket), automation scripting (Linux Shell Scripting), service mesh (Istio), and package management (Helm). I specialize in designing scalable, robust, and secure cloud-native solutions, and I am dedicated to advancing automation to optimize development processes

name: Balasundaram N
bio: I have been in IT over a decade and half now. I am passionate about cutting edge technologies and instrumental in in optimizing workflows, improving system reliability, and automating infrastructure deployment processes in cloudnative space. I have a small contribution to minikube and microk8s add-ons.

name: Balázs Bakai
bio: I am an experienced IT specialist with 17 years of expertise across software development, testing, DevOps, and monitoring. My background is rooted in full-stack Java EE development, where I have built reliable and scalable enterprise systems. I am particularly passionate about Kubernetes and exploring the possibilities offered by the SUSE platform, focusing on creating secure and efficient cloud-native environments.

name: Bangaly Kaba
bio: I am a Senior TechLead/Cloud Architect at Société Générale, with strong background in designing and implementing cloud native solutions. Passionated by kubernetes, prometheus, falco, cilium, argo, istio. In my free time, I like running, biking along the river seine.

name: Baptiste Roux
bio: I'm a senior DevOps engineer specializing in building cloud infrastructures with GitOps principles, using the GCP and Kubernetes ecosystems. Passionate about open-source technologies, I focus on creating resilient, observable, and self-healing systems that scale efficiently.

name: Barisi Kane
bio: Barisi is a Senior Platform Engineer who is fascinated by cloud computing. He enjoys building scalable solutions for thorny problems.

name: Barry Cooks
bio:
Barry is responsible for growing Kubernetes across AWS including Amazon EKS, Amazon EKS Anywhere and RedHat Open Shift.

Barry joined Amazon in 2022 from DigitalOcean, whereas CTO he led the organization through its IPO. A global enterprise technology veteran, Barry brings 25 years of experience across all aspects of technology, from board design, FPGA based hardware, and operating systems, to application microservices and cloud. Over the course of his career, Barry has twice led teams through successful IPOs. His previous experience includes DigitalOcean, VMware, and Sun Microsystems. Barry holds a BS in Computer Science from Purdue University and a MS in Computer Science from the University of Oregon.

name: Bartholomew Farrell
bio:
Passionate, bilingual, creative non-technical community leader who loves being in innovative projects with folks from all over the world and focusing on being inclusive. Leader of CNCF Bilbao Meetup Speaker/Mentor in CNCF Students Co-Organizer KCD Pakistan and KCD Guatemala

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Because I get to do what I love and I love what I do! I love bringing new folks into the CNCF ecosystem so they get to enjoy the amazing experiences and connections I'm so lucky to have as well. Being an ambassador gives me the privilege to highlight the amazing work folks are doing through online/offline events and storytelling.

name: Barun Acharya
bio:
Barun likes hacking on low level stuff and fiddling around developer toolings. He maintains KubeArmor, a CNCF Sandbox project and currently works as a Software Engineer at Accuknox. He loves to talk about Open Source and has been associated with programs like Google Summer of Code and LFX Mentorship. Find his blogs at https://barun.cc

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF Ambassador has heightened my enthusiasm to further promote, educate, and support the cloud-native community. Leveraging my prior experience as a speaker and maintainer, I am now even better positioned to advocate for and strengthen the ecosystem through advocacy and knowledge sharing.

name: Batuhan Apaydın
bio:
Batuhan Apaydın a.k.a. developer-guy has been very active in the Software Supply Chain Security space. He is eager to learn more about it in all aspects because he knows this topic will become one of the utmost critical topics that everybody has to be concerned about. Towards that direction, he won the “Best Sigstore Evangelist” award and wrote a blog post about it to encourage to the next one and took an active role in the first-ever SigstoreCon by being one of the Program Committee members of the event and created a Twitter Community about Software Supply Chain Security and that community is now about 500+ people joined. He is also selected as Docker Captain Program 2023. In addition to that he is also a CDF (Continuous Delivery Foundation) Ambassador 2023. He also tries to be active in Turkey by organizing in-person, and virtual meetups, and workshops. He is the organizer of two important organizations in Turkey named DevOpsTr, CNCF Istanbul Chapter, and Cloud Native Turkiye. He is also one of the organizers of the KCD Turkey. He is also an active contributor to several CNCF projects including Ko, Flux, and Kyverno. He also enjoys writing technical blog posts and wrote 10+ blog posts and all of which are published on important official websites including Kyverno, CD Foundation, Flux, Sigstore, etc. • https://cd.foundation/blog/2022/10/18/tekton-chains/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/10/prove-the-authenticity-of-oci-artifacts/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/08/manage-kyverno-policies-as-ocirepositories/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/11/verify-the-integrity-of-the-helm-charts-stored-as-oci-artifacts-before-reconciling-them-with-flux/ • https://kubesimplify.com/the-secret-gems-behind-building-container-images-enter-buildkit-and-docker-buildx • https://blog.kubesimplify.com/getting-started-with-ko-a-fast-container-image-builder-for-your-go-applications • https://nirmata.com/securing_base_images/ • https://blog.sigstore.dev/how-to-verify-container-images-with-kyverno-using-kms-cosign-and-workload-identity-1e07d2b85061

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: First of all, I'm the first person from Turkey who has been selected as a CNCF Ambassador which is super great for me because I have the energy to spread all my knowledge with other people and I do really like to collaborate with people by organizing in-person, virtual meetups. I thought that I can waste my time and energy by becoming a CNCF Ambassador still continue organizing meetups and sharing knowledge because Turkiye has great potential of using CNCF projects to solve problems.

name: Behrouz Arji
bio: Behrouz is Senior DevOps Engineer with extensive experience in implementing DevSecOps and SRE practices by designing secure and scalable innovative solutions in large-scale distributed systems and cloud computing.

name: Ben Kooijman
bio: I am a cloud engineer doing DevSecOps work as a consultant in the south of Sweden. Apart from being absolutely obsessed with computers I also love running, cooking and playing video games.

name: Ben Somogyi
bio:
Ben is a Senior Staff DevSecOps engineer at Lockheed Martin, where he spearheads the development of innovative cloud-native platform architectures. With over a decade of experience in the Cloud Native landscape, Ben has established himself as a trusted expert in leveraging cutting-edge tools and technologies to drive business results in both commercial and public sectors. Before joining Lockheed Martin, Ben held key roles as a Principal Platform engineer and consultant at various commercial companies, where he refined his expertise in cloud-native technologies and developed a passion for delivering high-impact solutions.

As a Technical Lead at Lockheed Martin, Ben is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining a Kubernetes-based cloud-native platform that empowers all of the company's business areas to deliver exceptional value to a growing customer base. He holds a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Florida and a Master's degree in Computer Science from Colorado State University, providing a strong foundation for his technical expertise.

Outside of work, Ben values spending time with his family, including his wife and two children, in the beautiful state of Colorado. When he's not working, you can find him mountain biking, exploring the outdoors, or enjoying the many recreational activities that Colorado has to offer.

name: Benjamin Boerner
bio: I am a system engineer, installing and maintaining Kubernetes clusters primarily in airgapped environments.

name: Benjamin Calvet
bio: I am an IT Engineer with a background in Linux SysAdmin, I transitioned to (the dark side) software development and became fascinated with tools like Kubernetes and Cloud Native tech. I specialize in implementing containerized architectures using DevOps practices to help businesses accelerate their deliveries. Over time, I've become a true fan of Kubernetes, attending numerous Kubecons and even speaking at DevOpsDays Geneva about its 10-year history. My innate curiosity drives me to constantly learn about new technologies and best practices about them. As a CNCF enthusiast, I really like sharing my knowledge and experiences with others to help them navigate the ever-evolving tech landscape.

name: Benjamin Einaudi
bio: Backend developper, I am quite interrested in any subjects related to containerization, such as development environment setting, continuous delivery, deployment orchestration.

name: Benjamin Muschko
bio:
Benjamin Muschko is a software engineer, consultant, and trainer with more than 20 years of experience in the industry. He specializes in cloud-native application development and transformation, container solutions, DevSecOps, and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery implementations. Ben is an author, a frequent speaker at conferences, and an avid open source advocate. Among his published books are the Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) Study Guide, the Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) Study Guide, and the Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS) Study Guide.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to teach beginners the basics of Kubernetes in a practical and relatable fashion. One way to learn Kubernetes effectively is by following the curriculum of the official Kubernetes certification exams. I will continue to produce hands-on learning resources in the form of written, and interactive media.

name: Benny Hoog
bio: Kubernetes enthousiast, cloud developer, and Linux engineer. Aiming to build better full stack applications to make everyone's life a whole lot easier.

name: Bertrand Bello Fils
bio: I am passionate about open-source technologies, especially cloud-native applications, and I am eager to engage in all aspects that support and mentor newcomers in the field. I am also committed to continuous learning and professional development.

name: Bhavani Indukuri
bio: CNCF. She possesses extensive expertise in optimising Release processes and DevOps methodologies at Zscaler. In her previous role at Servicenow, Bhavani spearheaded a team in migrating infrastructure to Kubernetes, skilfully managing microservice deployments, Kubernetes application backup and monitoring. Recognised as a prominent speaker at conferences, Bhavani is passionate about enlightening audiences on the transformative potential of DevOps and CNCF Projects. Through her involvement with Women in CNCF, she orchestrates workshops focused on CNCF projects and advocates for increased female representation in the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Bill Ren (Ren Xudong)
bio: Bill is Director of Huawei’s Open Source and Developer Department and also serves as Huawei’s Chief Open Source Liaison Officer. In this role, he is for responsible for using open source to build industrial ecosystems, expand industrial spaces, and build a healthy and harmonious industrial environment.

name: Blake Shaver
bio: I am a devops engineer specializing in automation tools in a hybrid environment. I frequently work with Ansible Automation Platform and work to develop pipelines and controls. I am interested in cloud technologies and containers and push myself to learn new tools to implement new solutions. I also hold certifications in Linux, Ansible, AWS, Jenkins and Terraform.

name: Bmk Lakshminarayanan
bio:
Transformation Architect, SECTION6 BMK is an inspiring and passionate DevOps Advocate and Value Stream Architect promoting DevOps, Lean and Value Stream Management principles & practices. He is also a New Zealand ambassador for the Cloud-Native Computing Foundation(CNCF), DevOps Institute and a Board Advisor for the Value Stream Management consortium(VSMC). He hosts the CNCF meetup in Wellington, New Zealand and is co-chair of Cloud-Native Summit A/NZ. He blogs about his experiences and learnings at https://bmk.nz/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: 1. Promoting Open Source and Cloud-Native projects and ecosystem tools in our community. 2. Connecting with experts, maintainers, contributors and other Opensource and cloud-native thought leaders to amplify my learning 3. Use the ambassador program and help in bringing in the best to my community in terms of cloud-native learnings, education and training.

name: Bob Killen
bio: Bob Killen is a Senior Technical Program Manager focusing on improving CNCF project governance processes and finding engaging ways to bring end users and maintainers together. He serves the Kubernetes project as a Steering Committee member and is a recently retired Contributor Experience Special Interest Group chair. Before joining the CNCF, Bob was a program manager at Google's Open Source Programs Office, where he guided and developed strategies for Google's open source projects. Bob has a history of bringing cloud and HPC/AI/ML together and is passionate about Academic Outreach. He is also an outspoken advocate of Open Source, Open Science, and pets of the furry 4-legged variety.

name: Bogdan Sass
bio: Infrastructure engineer with 20+ years of experience in networking, virtualization and storage. Currently spends his time tinkering with Kubernetes, ElasticSearch, and automation technologies (Ansible, Terraform).

name: Bolivar David Llerena Fuenmayor
bio: An experienced tech consultant with over 8 years of expertise in software development, cloud computing, and machine learning. Bolivar has worked with multinationals such as McKinsey & Company, Kyndryl, and IBM, and holds over 400 certifications across AWS, Azure, GCP, and Cisco. He was honored with the José Gualberto Pérez Award for excellence in physics and mathematics and is passionate about continuous learning.

name: Borislav Tonev
bio: I started my career 13 years ago. I have occupied various roles, from server infrastructure engineer and consultant, cloud engineer, to technical leader and manager. I strongly believe in the importance of continuous learning and knowledge sharing and I am a Microsoft Certified Trainer. I am keen on infrastructure automation and configuration management. As a manager of an infrastructure DevOps team, I have got familiar with Kubernetes as one of our main cloud native focus areas. My interests also include Argo, Envoy and Istio.

name: Borko Djurkovic
bio: Borko is a constant learner with passion for all things related to Kubernetes and cloud native technologies. In his free time, he enjoys reading books and running along the beautiful Rideau Canal in Ottawa, Canada.

name: Borlean Ovidiu Dumitru
bio: Networking engineer with a passion for anything related to containers and Kubernetes. Currently working in a DevOps position, with a special interest for IaC and automation in Azure and AWS.

name: Bounouh Fadi
bio: I am Fedi Bounouh, a cloud engineer with expertise in DevOps and cloud-native technologies, including AWS, Google Cloud, and Kubernetes. I hold multiple certifications across CNCF and cloud platforms, specializing in CI/CD automation, containerization, and infrastructure management using tools like Terraform and Kubernetes.

name: Brad Mccoy
bio:
Brad is originally from New Zealand now working in Australia as the Head of Platform Engineering, he has been involved in the DevOps space for a long time now and serves as a board member of the Continuous Delivery Foundation. Brad is a maintainer of the Keptn project and works on the Kubernetes Release team. And is involved in mentoring in GSoC projects. His favorite projects to work on from the CNCF are GitOps, Security and Observability projects. He is helping to organize the KCD Australia and also runs a meetup in Australia.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador to further help and mentor other folks coming into the cloud native space and guide them in the right direction. I'm also excited because I can continue working on the outreach of the CNCF and show organizations how they can contribute and help grow the projects and unlock innovation.

name: Bradley Andersen
bio: Bradley is ex [Gitlab | Upbound | Capital One], a reformed [Perl hacker | TAM], a bridge builder and a glue guy. He enjoys working with others to solve complex problems, and unifying and growing people and processes.

name: Brandt Keller
bio: Passionate about Open Source, mentorship, and community building through engagement with diverse groups and perspectives. Member of TAG Security and multiple CNCF working groups. Currently specializing in cloud native policy and compliance.

name: Brayan Andres Torres Contreras
bio: With 5 years of professional experience, I have leveraged cutting-edge technologies including AWS, Kubernetes, EKS, Docker, Lambda Functions, and open-source frameworks to drive innovation and efficiency. Orchestrated the architectural blueprint and execution strategy for enterprise-level cloud infrastructure, ensuring optimal network topology, storage systems, computational resources, and security frameworks. Championed the development of CI/CD pipelines, resulting in a 70% reduction in time-to-market and eliminating human errors in deployment procedures.Passionate about learning new technologies and using open source to deliver the best architectures.

name: Brendon Caligari
bio: Linux and Kubernetes infrastructure engineer.

name: Brendon Sutaj
bio: Currently, working as a DevOps Engineer with a strong passion for Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) toolings, and cloud-native security. I specialize in designing and maintaining scalable, secure, and highly available cloud-native environments using CNCF technologies. Outside of work, I actively explore new trends in cloud infrastructure and automation.

name: Bret Fisher
bio:
For 25 years, I've built and operated distributed systems and helped over a million people learn dev and ops topics. I'm also a Docker Captain and the creator of the wildly popular Docker & Kubernetes Mastery series on Udemy. I provide DevOps-style consulting, workshops, a popular DevOps Discord server, a container-focused YouTube channel, and a podcast. I basically spend my days helping people and giving high fives.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I think DevOps culture and container tech have changed the IT Pro and Developer world forever! For over eight years, I've been a megaphone for container tech and love teaching cloud native DevOps topics. The CNCF community has been a great experience for me both as a teacher and a learner, and I want to make sure it's great for many years to come.

name: Brian Douglas
bio: Brian Douglas previously founded Open Sauced, a company dedicated to increasing knowledge and insights of open-source communities. In 2024, Open Sauced joined the Linux Foundation, further solidifying Brians commitment to advancing open-source initiatives. With a passion for open source, Brian has consistently supported and mentored new contributors through Open Sauced, empowering developers to excel in the open-source ecosystem.

name: Brienne Alves
bio: Brienne is an Event Planner at The Linux Foundation, managing multiple facets of several events, including the Kubernetes Contributor Summit. Prior to joining The Linux Foundation, Brienne brings over 10 years experience in the events industry managing hundreds of corporate annual technical and educational conferences around the world as well as social events and weddings.

name: Bryan Poon
bio: I’m a DevOps engineer who like learn new technologies, especially Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies.

name: Bryant Yu
bio: A passionated solution builder enjoys turning innovative ideas into real-world solutions; growing PoC cases into Enterprise production environments solving challenging questions. Skilled in hybrid-cloud and AI/ML applications development. Keen interest in new technologies and a Never-Stop learner.

name: Buglioni Thomas
bio: I am a Full Stack DevSecOps engineer at Orange, specializing in Prometheus, Linux, Kubernetes, Python, Terraform, and Ansible. Passionate about continuous learning and improvement, I focus on automating and securing cloud-native infrastructures while implementing robust CI/CD and security practices. I strive to optimize both team performance and system efficiency to deliver scalable and secure solutions.

name: Burak Kazan
bio: As a Telco Consulting Architect, my focus is on delivering secure, automated, and performance/throughput optimized Telco Cloud platform for the CNFs(Containerized Network Function). I prioritize security standards, efficient deployment strategies, and reliable monitoring and logging.My goal is to build robust and efficient and scalable Telco Cloud environments by establishing best practices for Kubernetes, Automation , Monitoring/Logging and Networking Design.

name: Burak Kazan
bio: I am Telco Consulting Architect with a deep passion for CNCF technologies. I specialize in designing secure, scalable Telco Cloud Solutions using my expertise, I help to Telco organizations integrate robust secure practices into the platform delivery for CNFs(Cloud Native Functions) to address scalable, high performance and ensure compliance and monitoring/logging. I am part of EMEA Telco Architect's team, solving complex problems, and adapting to new technologies to deliver innovative and impactful solutions for Telco Cloud requirements.

name: Burak Ovali
bio: Go, Kubernetes and Cats 🐱 :)

name: Burlacu Viorel Vasile
bio: I have worked with cloud and container technologies since 2020 when I wanted to deepen my understanding of applications deployed as microservices, particularly in distributed, scalable environments like Kubernetes. Since 2023, I decided to focus on Cloud and Kubernetes security and have built expertise in the CNAPP space. I am highly driven by the challenge of staying ahead of emerging technologies and finding efficient solutions to complex technical problems. I am also certified as AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate and Certified OpenStack Administrator.

name: Byungjun Kim
bio: I'm a DevOps Engineer. I'm so happy to be Kubestronaut. I love Kubernetes and CNCF projects. I wish CNCF endless development. and I run a tech blog with more than 600,000 total visitors, so please love it a lot. tech blog - https://kingofbackend.tistory.com

name: Bálint József Jánvári
bio: I was bored and I wanted the jacket.

name: Bálint Kaszás
bio: I started as an intern at NTT Data (then still Dimension Data), where I dealt with network and data center virtualization. In addition, I wrote small applications in python and script languages, which helped clients perform various integrations efficiently. I really like to discover and learn new things, which is why I came to Kubernetes, which contains an inexhaustible number of integrations and components.

name: Cahit Yusuf Kafadar
bio: As a passionate consultant specializing in cloud-native technologies, I have a wealth of experience in designing and optimizing modern cloud solutions. My work focuses on empowering organizations to enhance their agility, scalability, and operational efficiency through cutting-edge cloud-native practices. With a strong dedication to innovation, I strive to deliver tailored solutions that align with the unique goals of every business I collaborate with.

name: Cailyn Edwards
bio:
Cailyn is a Senior Infrastructure Security Engineer, with a passion for Kubernetes and the open source world. She is an active contributor to Kubernetes SIG-Security, SIG-CLI and a 2022 Kubernetes Contributor Award recipient. Her current focus is on network, and Kubernetes multi-tenancy security and she gets to spend her working hours contributing up stream. It brings her great joy to spend time with the CNCF community and empower folks to become involved. Outside of work Cailyn can be found running, playing squash, walking her dogs or working in the garden.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am *so* excited to be a CNCF ambassador because this community has been incredibly impactful to my growth in the industry and I want to give back. I cannot wait to help share all the wonderful things happening at CNCF and organize events for members new and old. One of my favourite parts of my job is mentoring, and I look forward to being able to do this in the Cloud Native community! I want to ensure that each new member has the same welcoming and positive experience that I did!

.

name: Calexx Chimanyiwa
bio: I am a seasoned DevOps professional with a robust background in networking, DevOps practices, and cloud computing. Holding a Bachelor of Engineering Honors degree in Electronic Engineering, I have amassed several industry certifications, including all five Kubernetes certifications, HashiCorp Certified Terraform Associate, and various AWS certifications including AWS DevOps professional. My expertise spans across networking, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS and Terraform. Passionate about continuous learning and innovation, I excel in creating efficient, scalable, and secure DevOps pipelines, solving complex challenges, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

name: Calum Murray
bio: I'm a Knative Eventing Maintainer and UX Working Group Lead. I co-founded the University of Toronto Open Source Students, where I help university students contribute to open source projects, such as Knative and CloudEvents.

name: Camila Soares Camara
bio: Camila is a platform engineer with experience in Cloud and DevOps, working with technologies such as kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS and Infrastructure as Code (IaC), always focusing on implementing scalable and secure solutions to improve the end user experience.

name: Carl Stuart
bio: A jack of all trades with a strong and proven background in software development, automation and cloud migration.

name: Carla Gaggini
bio:
Carla has been managing events and communities since 2011. She started with experimental music festivals and eventually ended up in Tech, where she fell in love with its ecosystem. During her career she has produced and run many conferences (yes, also the virtual ones!), meetups, webinars and hackathons. Formerly at Container Solutions managing everything "WTF is Cloud Native" and "Software Circus", she currently buzzes around Cilium and eBPF at Isovalent. She is also one of the organisers of KCD UK, a CNCF and OpenUK Ambassador, and the 2022 CNCF Marketing Committee Chair. Carla drinks way too much tea (mainly green), has an unhealthy obsession for Japan and a big passion for art, music, cinema, philosophy and fashion. Recent blogs: https://blog.container-solutions.com/why-your-event-needs-a-code-of-conduct-and-you-need-to-enforce-it https://blog.container-solutions.com/how-hard-is-it-to-deliver-a-virtual-conference https://blog.container-solutions.com/tech-events-in-the-time-of-covid-19-5-tips-to-survive

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: This is an invaluable opportunity to support the CNCF and the Cloud Native community. I'm incredibly excited to help new joiners and spread more awareness around all the initiatives they can embrace within the CNCF, the various KCDs and the Cloud ecosystem in general.

name: Carlos Santana
bio:
Carlos Santana is a Senior Specialist Solutions Architect at AWS leading Container solutions in the Worldwide Application Modernization GTM team. He is experienced in distributed application architecture, emerging technologies, open source, serverless, gitops, devops. He is a contributor to CNCF projects such as Kubernetes and Knative. Find him on Twitter @csantanapr or his Kubernetes Bookclub https://santana.dev

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to work with the CNCF, and be able to help the CNCF to improve on how it works and get perceive by the community of contributors and consumer of cloud native tech.
