name: Ekrem Onur Gures
bio: DevOps Engineer working with Linux, Kubernetes, Infrastructure Technologies, CI/CD.

name: Elchin Habibov
bio: Seasoned DevOps/Platform Engineer with expertise in Kubernetes/OpenShift and cloud technologies. Specializing in infrastructure automation, Observability , GitOps practices, and CI/CD pipeline development.

name: Eleni Grosdouli
bio: The go-to person for DevOps and Kubernetes Automation, with a passion for networking, security, endpoint management, and endpoint security, Eleni brings a diversity of experiences to her role as a DevOps Consulting Engineer at Cisco Systems. Always eager to learn, she enjoys trying out the newest tech in a home lab and writing blog posts about her experiences. At this point in time, she is an active contributor to the ProjectSveltos. Beyond tech, she is all about sports and recently joined a local Rugby team. Medium: https://medium.com/@eleni.grosdouli

name: Ellery D'Souza
bio: Ellery is a tech enthusiast and backend developer with a strong passion for building innovative solutions. With a strong foundation in computer science, Ellery has worked on various projects, contributing to open-source initiatives. As a curious and dedicated professional, Ellery is continuously exploring new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead of the curve.

name: Elmustapha Htioui
bio: I am DevOps engineer working on different platforms, such as Kubernetes Vanilla distribution. I am migrating some workloads running in virtualization platform to a targeted Kubernetes platform. I am also implementing service and environment pipelines to facilitate code feature deployment in the targeted platform. While doing so, I use Tekton for service Pipeline and ArgoCD for environment Pipeline. I am eager to learn more technolgies related to the Kubernetes ecosystem.

name: Elna Vogel
bio:
Elna is a Senior Event Planner at The Linux Foundation, mainly working on CNCF events, and managing events with Chinese aspects.  

Elna has extensive track records leading cross-functional events globally. Prior to joining the Linux Foundation, Elna produced and managed corporate events for Fortune 500 investment banks in Hong Kong such as State Street, Goldman Sachs and BNY Mellon. Fluent in English, Mandarin and Cantonese, she works effortlessly across all regions, countries and cultures.

name: Elyes (Mohamed) Jabri
bio: a "certified Kubernetes engineer" with a strong background as a Linux sysadmin. I have extensive experience in designing, deploying, and managing scalable containerized applications, expertise also includes cloud technologies, infrastructure automation, and ArgoCD's GitOps best practices.

name: Elyes Jarroudi
bio: am Elyes Jarroudi, a DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on designing and managing scalable, secure infrastructure on AWS and Kubernetes. I specialize in cloud migrations, cost optimization, and implementing monitoring and security best practices to ensure resilient systems. I enjoy sharing my expertise through technical blogs and engaging with the cloud-native community to drive innovation.

name: Emerson Da Silva Chalegre
bio: I have been working with technology for over 20 years, and for the last 9 years I have been working as a DevOps/SRE. I really enjoy working with some tools such as Kubernetes, Terraform, ArgoCD, Backstage. I have a degree in Information Systems.

name: Emil Flatøy Hodneland
bio: I’m passionate about staying up-to-date with industry trends and constantly enhancing my skills!

name: Emily Fox
bio: Emily Fox is a DevOps enthusiast, security unicorn, and advocate for Women in Technology. She promotes the cross-pollination of development and security practices. She has worked in security for over 13 years to drive a cultural change where security is unobstructive, natural, and accessible to everyone. Her technical interests include containerization, least privilege, automation, and promoting women in technology. She holds a BS in Information Systems and an MS in cybersecurity. Serving as chair on the Cloud Native Computing Foundation’s (CNCF) Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and co-chair for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon China 2021, Europe 2022, North America 2022, Europe 2023, and CloudNativeSecurityCon 2023, she is involved in a variety of open source communities and activities.

name: Emin Alemdar
bio:
Emin is working as a Solutions Architect and has undertaken tasks such as producing solutions related to Kubernetes, Cloud technologies and Cloud Native Transformation in general, and transferring best practices about these areas. He is also an AWS Container Hero and shares his experience with the community around these technologies. He is part of the organiser team of the official CNCF Istanbul Community Chapter (https://community.cncf.io/istanbul/). He is also part of the CNCF Glossary Turkish team and helps the local community to understand the Cloud Native terms in their native language. He publishes blog posts from his personal Medium page (https://medium.com/@eminalemdar) and also participates in Open Source and Cloud Native related conferences and delivers talks about these technologies. He is in the organiser team of KCD (Kubernetes Community Days) Istanbul conference.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Community activities have always been my biggest motivation throughout my career. Helping people and learning from the people by participating in community activities is extremely important for me. Cloud Native Community is really one of a kind and being part of this community is really like a dream coming true for me.

name: Emmanuel Mendoza Sosa
bio: Emmanuel is a seasoned DevOps and Site Reliability Engineer with over a decade of experience across finance, retail, media and supply chain industries. He specializes in Cloud, Infrastructure as Code and Kubernetes, with a strong passion for collaborating with development teams to solve and debug complex problems. Emmanuel likes to learn open-source technologies that enhance and contribute to the DevOps ecosystem.

name: Emmanuel Torrado
bio: I'm a regular guy who just loves tech, crypto, series and spend time with family and friends, i enjoy work as much as hanging out with them, father of 2 cats and a dog!

name: Emrah Sifoğlu
bio: My DevOps journey began with the question: "How do you check the logs of a running container on Kubernetes?" That conversation with infra engineer gave me a new perspective which led me to pursue DevOps. Now, I create CI pipelines on GitLab and automate tasks using Ansible. Becoming Kubestronaut is not only an achievement but also the beginning for me to deepen my knowledge.

name: Emídio Neto
bio: Emídio is a Site Reliability Engineer. He holds a Master's degree in Computer Science and has experience in software and infrastructure development, working on the conceptualization, design, and building of scalable solutions and architectures for cloud-native CPaaS/SaaS industry applications. Besides coding, Emídio has experience as a teacher, and he loves diving into local community projects and teaching. Emídio is also the Chapter Lead of the Cloud Native Community Group in RN/Brazil.

name: Enzo Venturi
bio: Linux, Networking and Go

name: Eren Salih Pala
bio: I have been actively working in the IT sector since 2000, beginning my career in the technical field and continuing with enthusiasm in infrastructure, consultancy, and training roles. Over the years, I’ve gained extensive experience in infrastructure management, cloud-native technologies, and Kubernetes, contributing to numerous projects and delivering training sessions for various organizations. My passion lies in embracing innovations, adapting to emerging technologies, and building a professional network. I actively participate in community-driven events and discussions, staying updated on cutting-edge trends in the CNCF ecosystem. For me, technology is more than a profession—it’s a lifelong passion.

name: Eric D Schabell
bio:
Eric is Chronosphere's Director Evangelism. He's renowned in the development community as a speaker, lecturer, author, baseball expert, and CNCF Ambassador. His current role allows him to help the world understand the challenges they are facing with observability. He brings a unique perspective to the stage with a professional life dedicated to sharing his deep expertise of open source technologies and organizations. More on https://speakerhub.com/speaker/eric-d-schabell

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to officially have the title of ambassador as I've been actively promoting a lot of the work they do for over a decade now.

name: Eric Ng
bio: Senior Business Architect in VMware. Over 20 years in IT/Networking. Specialized in DCN, DC Security and Modern Application.

name: Eric Schüler
bio: As a fully certified AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer, my focus is on delivering secure, automated, and optimized applications to the cloud. I prioritize security standards, efficient deployment strategies, and reliable monitoring. I am committed to continuous development and mastering new, relevant technologies like Kubernetes and other cloud-native tools to stay ahead in the field. Sharing knowledge is a passion of mine, and I regularly publish content to inspire and educate others. My goal is to build robust and efficient cloud environments by establishing best practices for software architecture, automation, and pipelines.

name: Erik Kaisler
bio: I'm a passionate tech enthusiast who loves exploring and learning new technologies. With a strong focus on continuous improvement, always seeking ways to enhance my skills and stay ahead in the ever-evolving landscape. The dedication to personal and professional growth drives me to embrace new challenges and innovative solutions.

name: Erin Colvin
bio: Erin is an experienced Event Manager with a specific expertise in Tradeshows and Conferences. She has a passion for strategic event marketing, strong vendor relationships, and delivering exceptional experiences. She earned her Bachelor's degree in Communications and Business at the University of Utah, and began her career in sales and marketing. She managed 20+ tradeshows annually for a CPG company, before moving to the agency side where she mastered her Project Management and Customer Services skills managing experiential marketing campaigns for clients like Amazon Fresh and Kodiak Cakes. She recently received her Master's degree in Strategic Communication and is excited to utilize this knowledge to bring more research, data and strategy into her projects and events.

name: Erlend Leiknes
bio: Hi, I'm Erlend, a security conultant and pentester from mnemonic. I set out to learn Kubernetes from the ground up to effectivly navigate, hack and secure clusters. Now, I can become cluster administrator before lunch.

name: Esra Siegert
bio: I’m a system engineer with several years of work experience. My main focuses are Kubernetes, ArgoCD and Crossplane.

name: Etienne Ehrhardt
bio: After more than ten years of experience in infrastructure and middleware integration in various environments, I've naturally shifted to the cloud native world by more specifically focusing on container platforms. During the last years, I've acquired solid skills in designing and setting up cloud-native oriented architectures relying on various container engines, OpenShift and Kubernetes. The main focus being integrating those complex platforms in on-prem trusted, secured and compliant environments, as well as designing more hybrid setups in AWS and Azure. Those state of the art container platforms bring tremendous agility features to micro services integration, but there are nothing without proper governance and without using the right tools sets depending on a wide range of contexts and use cases. The cloud native world and its vast eco-system is evolving at high pace and today's challenge for many companies is to make sure they're not outrun by this strong wind of change in the digital transformation race. It's furthermore also important to understand all those concepts, the way they interact and their many impacts.

name: Ettore Ciarcia
bio: I work as a Cloud and Kubernetes Engineer. I handle migrations to major cloud providers and design cloud-native architectures, always promoting open-source software and minimizing vendor lock-in. I primarily work with technologies such as Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, Grafana, Velero and Nginx, which allows me to build scalable architectures, optimize costs, and use a declarative approach. Participating in events like KubeCon, KCD Italy, and Linux Day in Benevento every year, both as an attendee and a speaker, has given me the opportunity to meet extraordinary people.

name: Eunmi Kim
bio: I am an engineer working in cloud server operations with a strong interest in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. I am continuously improving my skills to work with related technology stacks in CNCF.

name: Evangelista Tragni
bio:
Kubestronaut and vExpert 2024 KCD Italy Organizer Linux Foundation Authorized Instructor - VMware Cert Instructor - AWS Champion Authorized Instructor

CNCF Member , CNCF Speaker , Linux Day Puglia Speaker, Linux Day Basilicata Speaker, CometoCode member and speaker, AWS Meet up member, AWS Community member , Kubernetes Community Days Italy Organizer, The development of a career and a reputation as a reliable computing professional in both the creative and technical sides of IT, building on my technical knowledge of software, hardware and computing standards. I also aim to obtain a good and professional reputation as a world wide known IT trainer for Kubernetes , AWS, VMware and possibly others such as Google and so on.

Loving also to build knowledge sharing my consideration and my expertise and gaining knowledge from the students.

Hope to see you soon, never stop , keep studying.

name: Evans Amoany
bio: Have a strong passion for automated, highly available, optimized and secured clusters and systems. A DevOps advocate, opensource enthusiast, a Linux/GNU geek who continually studies, researches, and improves in these areas. A trainer and Author by passion.

name: Even Åge Smedshaug
bio: With a masters in Cybernetics and precious little Cloud Native experience, Evens passion for technology and fervor in the face of challenge propels him head first into the Cloud Native and Open Source ecosystem, starting with (according to him) the coolest certification of them all: Kubestronaut.

name: Everton Seiei Arakaki
bio: I am a brazilian Software Engineer working at Rabobank at a team dedicated to Data and Analytics Platform. I contribute to open source from time to time.

name: Eyal Zekaria
bio: Coming from a background of DevOps and SRE, where I operated Kubernetes clusters at scale on different cloud providers, I currently work as a Cloud Architect where I help other companies on their cloud journey. Automation is a topic that's close to my heart, as well as open source software.

name: Fabian Dohmen
bio: I work as a principal consultant in the AWS field and focus on the infrastructure side. My primary stack mostly contains AWS, CNCF projects and the hashicorp products.

name: Fabricio Mariani
bio: Fabricio Mariani is an experienced Cloud Architect and Engineering Team Lead at BSC Analytics, with deep expertise in designing and managing enterprise level infrastructure solutions. As an AWS Ambassador since 2022 and a Kubernetes expert, Fab has guided numerous organizations in optimizing their development and deployment processes through container orchestration. With a strong focus on continuous improvement, he's also mentored and led high-performance DevOps teams, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and automation.

name: Fabrizio Sgura
bio: Committed to innovation and new technologies, strong believer in cloud native and container orchestration. Participating in main events, both as speaker and attendant, actively spreading the CNCF principles and project. My job is my favorite game.

name: Fadi Dasus
bio: Fadi is a cloud security architect with extensive experience architecting and securing cloud technologies. His research and passion have concentrated on implementing zero trust architecture into Kubernetes and cloud environments, aiming to enhance the security posture within the cloud landscape.

name: Faeka Ansari
bio: Faeka dove into the world of cloud-native projects during her student days, and the thrill of it has kept her hooked ever since. Originally drawn in by the technology, she quickly discovered that it was the people in the community who made it truly special

name: Faisal Afzal
bio: As a Solutions Architect specializing in cloud-native technologies, I’m committed to helping organizations leverage the power of Kubernetes, DevOps, and containerization to drive innovation and efficiency. I lead the CNCF Los Angeles chapter, where we host meetups, webinars, and workshops to engage the community in learning and collaboration around cloud-native best practices. With a strong background in cloud migration, automation, and modernization, I strive to connect people with the latest insights in the cloud-native space, encouraging skill growth and knowledge-sharing within an inclusive community. Visit and become a member at https://community.cncf.io/los-angeles/

name: Fangel Emilio Colón Navarro
bio: Hello, I'm Fangel, I live in the Dominican Republic. My first steps using CNCF technologies began in 2020 when the technological world advanced significantly. As of today I have already achieved a lot of knowledge and my wishes are to continue in this wonderful world.

name: Faseela K
bio:
Faseela is a cloud-native developer, maintainer and steering committee member at Istio Service Mesh. She has served as the Program Chair for the Istio Meetups in 2023 including the IstioDays co-located with KubeCon Europe and NorthAmerica. She regularly contributes to the Istio blogs, helping all the latest news about Istio reach users and contributors worldwide.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having done the work of an ambassador for Istio for several years now, I look forward to continuing this work officially now, making use of the support CNCF provides. I would love to provide more support for the women in cloud native community with this new opportunity I am provided with.

name: Fazlur Rahman Khan
bio: I am a software engineer, consultant, and Trainer with more than 20 years of experience in the industry. I specialize in cloud-native application development and transformation, container solutions, DevSecOps, Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery implementations and Kubernetes Administration. I have authored few courses and I am the course maintainer of all the official Kubernetes Administrator, Developer and Security courses at The Linux Foundation. I am excited to teach the nitty-gritty of Kubernetes in a practical and relatable fashion.

name: Felipe Rovai
bio: My passion for IT comes from the adrenaline of having to solve complex issues and learn new technologies from scratch. I specialize in re-architecting cloud environments to not only solve problems but also to significantly reduce costs, enhance security and to make the customer's day-to-day life easier. I deeply value collaborative teamwork where the best ideas, regardless of seniority, always win. With 13 years of experience in IT, 7 of those as a DevOps/SRE, I have deep expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, CI/CD and automation.

name: Felix Notka
bio: I’m Felix, a software developer and DevOps engineer with a strong interest in CNCF technologies. I enjoy tackling challenging problems, learning new technologies, and finding better ways to build and automate systems. Kubernetes and cloud-native solutions are a big part of my work, but I’m always exploring and improving. I also like sharing what I learn through meetups and conferences. Outside of work, I spend time with my Labrador, Fred, and play chess — though mostly for fun rather than skill!

name: Fernando Miranda Francisco
bio: I am a Cloud and DevOps Engineer, passionate about Cloud technologies. I love learning and delving into the most important technologies surrounding the cloud world. I fully believe that the future is the cloud, and I try to be as up to date as possible to face any challenge that comes my way. I have 4 years of experience working with the cloud, both public and private for the Telecommunications industry, working with different clients in the United States, Latin America and Europe, specialized mainly in Kubernetes and Linux, but I also have experience in docker, IP networking, IaC, python, CI/CD, etc. I love sharing knowledge and if I can help someone improve their skills, count on me.

name: Feynman Zhou
bio:
Feynman is a product manager for Microsoft Azure. He is also a maintainer for CNCF ORAS and Notary Project. He is a big fan of open source and has been contributing to multiple CNCF projects over five years. He is a speaker of KubeCon and enjoy technology advocacy. He also hosted several events, such as Kubernetes Community Days China, CNCF Webinar, and cloud native meetups.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I’m super excited to be part of the Cloud Native Ambassadors family. I would like to work with other ambassador peers to learn and share cloud-native technologies.

name: Filip Wardzichowski
bio: Senior Cloud & Network Architect with extensive experience in data center and service provider networking, specializing in cloud-native networking and security. Expertise includes Kubernetes networking (CNI), service meshes, eBPF, SDN, EVPN, and workload segmentation. Strong focus on integrating OpenShift and OpenStack with data center fabrics to build scalable and secure private cloud solutions. An advocate for DevOps and GitOps methodologies, driving automation, declarative infrastructure, and continuous integration in cloud-native environments. Currently part of Cisco’s Cloud Networking Business Unit, contributing to the development of Kubernetes and cloud-native networking solutions.

name: Firasat Hussain Mohammad
bio: With over 3.5 years of experience in container orchestration, deployment automation, and Kubernetes, I have developed a robust expertise in CNCF technologies. My specialties include managing infrastructure as code using Kubernetes, AWS, Terraform, and ArgoCD.

name: Florian Cartron
bio: I'm a Devops Engineer with a deep focus on Kubernetes and Cloud Infrastructure. Passionate about empowering others, I enjoy helping teams adopt scalable, resilient cloud-native solutions and stay at the forefront of cloud innovation.

name: Florian Feldmann
bio: Florian is a DevOps Engineer working fully remote for adconova in the small town of Kamen.

name: Fog Dong
bio:
Fog Dong, a maintainer of KubeVela, and a senior engineer at Alibaba Cloud. She has been actively involved in the open source community, particularly in the cloud native DevOps field. Fog is now responsible for building large scale application workflow for Serverless Application Engine Product in Alibaba, while she's also fully experienced on building cloud native CI/CD platform when worked at Bytedance.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As an Ambassador of CNCF, I am excited to have the opportunity to promote and educate people about cloud-native technologies, which are shaping the future of computing. CNCF has a vibrant community of developers and tech enthusiasts who are passionate about advancing these technologies, and I am thrilled to be a part of this community. Additionally, as an ambassador, I will have the chance to connect with other like-minded individuals and share knowledge and ideas, which will help us all stay up-to-date with the latest developments in this rapidly-evolving field. Overall, I am honored to represent CNCF and am looking forward to contributing to the growth and success of this innovative organization.

name: Francesco Grimaldi
bio: I'm a Team Leader at Desotech, specializing in cloud-native technologies for over 5 years. I've been drawn to the CNCF for a while now, and lately, I've been diving into organizing meetups in Southern Italy, both online and in person, to talk about various CNCF projects. I've also been visiting high schools around here, trying to spark interest in cloud-native tech among young students. Sharing my knowledge and getting others excited about these innovative technologies is what I'm all about!

name: Francesco Vannini
bio: I've always been passionate about Linux, virtualisation and many more tech things throughout my career but I knew I had found my next passion when I came across Kubernetes. I'm just curious to know where this is going to take me next; so much to learn, so little time available. You'll find me at the various Meetups organised around Amsterdam or on LinkedIn!

name: Francis Lance Arzadon
bio: I have extensive experience in IT, with a strong background in leadership and management, where I’ve navigated the challenges of delivering and maintaining IT infrastructure and operations. Recently, I shifted my focus to new areas of the software development lifecycle, particularly in building and delivering stable, secure, and sustainable architectures. I believe Kubernetes is one of the most significant technological advancements of our generation, providing invaluable support to organizations across diverse industries—an inspiration for my Kubestronaut journey.

name: Francisco José Fialho São João Pascoalinho
bio: A software engineer with a focus on Kubernetes, multi-cloud and security. Enthusiastic about DevOps, DevSecOps and Cloud-native approaches. Always learning and exploring the CNCF landscape.

He works primarily within the Azure cloud environment through Infrastructure as Code (IaC) pipelines along with seamless CI/CD application pipelines. With a keen eye for innovation and efficiency, Frank has been involved on several high-impact internal projects, driving significant improvements in deployment speed, reliability, and cost savings through right sizing resources.

name: Frankely Ortiz Catano
bio: Driven by a deep passion for technology's dynamic landscape, Frankely Ortiz Catano finds joy in pushing boundaries and continually venturing into uncharted territories. As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Royal Caribbean Group, Frankely's current focus centers around Kubernetes and the realm of automation.

Proud to join the Kubestronaut community !

name: François Meulenberg
bio: Engineer with a cloud-first mindset. Who always want to learn, improve and adapt. I love to work but I also love my time-off and be outdoors.

name: Frazer Sado

name: Frederico Muñoz
bio:
Frederico started working with GNU and Linux in the mid-90s out of sheer curiosity, a decision that strongly influenced his life. Actively involved in the free software and open source community from early on, he made a path from programming and system administration towards data science, cloud computing and enterprise architecture. In recent years he has been actively involved in projects touching such diverse areas as Quantum computing, IoT, and analytics, and actively participating in the Kubernetes project as part of the Release Team, SIG Contribex, and others. He currently leads the Cloud and Architecture domain at SAS, for the South West & East Europe region. He holds a BA in Archaeology from the University of Lisbon, where he is an MA student and where he also took Physics.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I see being a CNCF Ambassador as a great opportunity to engage with others both in the technical aspects of cloud-native computing and in the many ways that those interested can become active members of the community. Cloud-native technology has largely been developed through open collaboration, and being an Ambassador is taking a step towards more visible participation in building the community - and learning from it.

name: FréDéRic Klein

In my previous roles at Orange and VMware, I led large-scale transformation projects, designed resilient architectures, and automated deployments to drive technical innovation and optimize system performance. I share insights on my blog https://fklein.me and connect with professionals on https://fr.linkedin.com/in/fklein82 . Passionate about learning from the community, I stay engaged with the latest developments in the cloud-native world.

name: Fábio Luciano

Currently, I am researching topics related to Developer Experience, Developer Tools, and other related subjects. My primary experience and passion lie in Solution Architecture, utilizing major vendors (AWS, Azure, and GCP) for Cloud Computing as well as on-premises deployments. I have extensive experience in Containerization and Orchestration of applications (Kubernetes and Docker Swarm), always using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to manage resources. Additionally, I have extensive experience in designing and implementing Continuous Integration, Continuous Validation and Verification, and Continuous Deployment pipelines.

His greatest strength is Kubernetes, which he has worked on since the first major version.

My focus will always be on Kubernetes all tools related to it. Praise to the Lord forever.

name: Gary Tong

name: Gerhard Häring

Giorgi is very actively participating in community He plays role as AWS Community Leader in Tbilisi also Ambassador for CD foundation, CNCF chapter lead also he conducts meetups to grow DevOps/SRE/Platform Engineering awareness in Georgian community.

All about kubernetes and cloud native

bio: I am passionate about Kubernetes and Cloud Native , implementing multi-cloud solutions, prioritizing security, optimizing performance, resilience and costs.

I am passionate about sharing my learnings and best practices with the open-source community, helping individuals and organizations innovate and accelerate during their cloud adoption journey.

Passionate about open source, I firmly believe in the power of the community to move technology forward.

Guy was fortunate enough to experience hands-on the entire evolution of cloud-native computing, from bare-metal servers to VMs and ultimately to Kubernetes. He is passionate about sharing his vast knowledge by writing blogs, speaking at global events, creating video content, and contributing to open-source projects by the CNCF. Guy has been dubbed "The Good Guy" by his peers and members of the community for his persistent desire to help others. It’s no wonder then that his day job at Komodor revolves around helping organizations to adopt K8s and solve the challenges that come with it, while his free time is dedicated to building a local community for Solution Architects and maintaining his educational Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@the_good_guy

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because it allows me to further my mission of sharing knowledge and driving the adoption of cloud-native technologies. As an ambassador, I will have the opportunity to create more resources, collaboration opportunities, and initiatives with the community & end-users to promote adoption and innovation.

I have a community role as Technology Evangelist at KubeSphere and KubeSphere Products.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am in love with community and all things community. I have met so many people since I first joined the CNCF community. It is a great pleasure to contribute to this community with people from all over the world who believe in the same goal. One goal and hundreds of people contributing to this goal. I think my biggest excitement in being an ambassador is making new friends and representing my community in the best way possible. Also, ambassador swags are great :)

bio: I’m a Cloud Devops engineer with 12years of IT experiences. I specialized in cloud platforms(AWS/AZURE), provisioning infrastructure to managing cloud-native application deployments. I've good exposure to Cloud, CI/CD, Security & Observability working on various roles & responsibilities. Certified in AWS, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform & Databricks. Excited to explore the new opportunities as a CNCF ambassador.

name: Harry Lee
bio:
Harry is a DevOps Evangelist and CTO @ Melio AI. He specialises in helping organisations navigate the cloud native landscape and adopt cloud native technologies. Harry runs the Cloud Native Computing Johannesburg Meetup which is part of the CNCF community groups in South Africa. https://www.meetup.com/cloud-native-computing-johannesburg/ https://community.cncf.io/johannesburg/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Harry is excited to be an ambassador as he is able to bring local cloud native enthusiasts together. This creates a platform where everyone can share their experiences embarking on their cloud native journeys. Through frequent knowledge sharing, this advances the entire cloud native community as a whole.

name: Harsh Manvar
bio:
I am a distinguished Docker Captain based in India, recognized for my expertise in containerization and cloud technologies. As a Cloud Innovator Champion, I'm committed to driving innovation and best practices in cloud computing. Additionally, i am a Top Kubernetes answerer worldwide on StackOverflow, demonstrating my dedication to fostering knowledge sharing within the global tech community.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF ambassador is thrilling because it means actively shaping the future of cloud-native technologies, collaborating with industry leaders, and bridging gaps in the tech ecosystem. It's an opportunity to contribute to a global community that's driving innovation and setting standards for modern computing.

name: Harvinder Singh Khalsa
bio: Harvinder Singh Khalsa is Sr. Infrastructure L1 at Publicis Sapient, specializing in designing solutions across Hybrid Multi-Cloud using AWS, Azure and Openstack and a secure end-to-end automation using principals of DevSecOps. With extensive expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, VMware solutions, AI/ML, and Big Data Analytics, he brings innovative solutions to complex infrastructure challenges. A Redhat Certified Architect and a proud Kubestronaut, Harvinder has demonstrated mastery in Kubernetes, container management, and Redhat solutions. His deep understanding of VMware technologies further complements his ability to design, deploy, and optimize enterprise infrastructure. Passionate about continuous learning and exploring the latest technologies, Harvinder is dedicated to driving efficiency, scalability, and performance for modern enterprises.

name: Hasan Alperen Selcuk
bio: I'm a DevOps and Cloud Engineer with a passion for managing Kubernetes clusters, no matter where they're hosted. I love sharing my knowledge through articles and videos about Kubernetes, helping others to understand and master it. ☸️ Let's bring Kubernetes to every corner of the tech world! ☸️

name: Hassim Naseef Mukkanni
bio: Experienced DevSecOps Engineer with over 9 years in the industry, specializing in DevSecOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). Expertise in architecting and implementing CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code, and robust security operations (SecOps). Skilled in financial operations (FinOps), observability best practices, and managing Kubernetes clusters at scale. Proficient in microservices deployments and dedicated to enhancing system reliability and efficiency.

name: Hector Sebastian Mendoza Salazar
bio: I'm an IT Solutions Consultant with a degree in Network Administration, specializing in Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform, DevOps, and API Management.

name: Heechul Kim
bio: As a senior full-stack developer with over 20 years of experience at Samsung SDS, I am passionate about Kubernetes and the cloud native ecosystem. In particular, I am very interested in building and optimizing DevOps environments for generative AI and RAG implementations.

name: Hemanth Gopalakrishna Yerasuri
bio: Telco Cloud Engineer with background in Embedded Systems and Wireless Technologies. Experienced in E2E design and implementation of IMS, 5G network functions on cloud platforms. Learning and exploring Kubernetes’s vast, uncharted territory.

name: Hengyue Li
bio: A DevOps and application operation engineer, responsible for hybrid cloud system architecture maintenance and evolution planning. I have been involved in the cloud native field since 2021, and currently focus on improving the stability of cloud environment infrastructure and application stability. Participate in the operation and maintenance of core systems such as container platform orchestration and scheduling, and have experience in multiple practical projects. I usually like to study open source projects, am passionate about new technologies, and practice the concept of cloud native.

name: Hengzhou Wu
bio: A Cloud Infrastructure Engineer based on AWS and GCP. Provides cloud technical support and solutions, specializing in cloud cost optimization and monitoring. In my spare time, I enjoy learning about techniques and articles related to containers, Kubernetes, and Prometheus.

name: Heni Abida
bio: Cloud Support Engineer and EKS Subject Matter Expert at Amazon Web Services, recognized as the 5th Kubeastronaut in Ireland 🇮🇪. With over six years of experience in managing complex cloud infrastructures, I specialise in helping AWS Enterprise customers to resolve production technical issues, delivering optimised container solutions design, and enhancing scalability for distributed systems.

name: Henrik Blixt
bio:
Henrik leads a Product Management team responsible for the Intuit core platform, where he defines the strategy and direction that has shaped Intuit’s cloud native platform based on CNCF projects like Kubernetes, Envoy, Istio, Prometheus, Argo (and many more!) that’s used by 7000 developers and serving over 100M users.

Being a passionate member of the open source community for almost 30 years, from Linux through OpenStack and Kubernetes, Henrik is currently focused on the Argo project as a core maintainer. He also represents Intuit across other committees, like the CNOE project and the broader Linux Foundation, where he shares experiences and best practices from Intuit’s use of open source, making sure end users are heard and their pain points understood.

He loves engaging with the community and has been a prolific speaker and event program committee member across ArgoCon, GitOpsCon, Kubecon over the years. A native of Sweden, earning his B.Sc in information systems from the University of Gothenburg, he now resides in California with his family.

name: Henrik Gerdes
bio: Cloud Engineer with years of experience in building developer-run infrastructure. My job is to simplify and streamline the software development process, so people can focus on their product. Kubernetes, ArgoCD and SSO are just tools to help with that.

name: Henrik Rexed
bio: Henrik Rexed is a Cloud Native Advocate at Dynatrace with over 15 years of expertise as a Performance Engineer. Passionate about Observability and Performance, he actively contributes to the tech community as an organizer of the WOPR and KCD Austria conferences. Henrik is also the creator of the YouTube channel Is It Observable?, where he shares insights on Kubernetes security, observability, and runtime tools.

name: Henry Laurent Khosasih
bio: I’m passionate about cloud technologies, automation, and CI/CD, with a keen focus on Kubernetes and security. Attending tech meetups is a great way for me to learn from industry experts and stay updated on the latest trends. Outside of work, I love exploring Melbourne on my bike, discovering new areas and enjoying the city’s atmosphere. Playing fingerstyle guitar is another hobby of mine, offering a creative outlet and a way to relax.

name: Hernanta Kusuma Cakrawerdaya
bio: I'm working as a Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps Engineer with expertise in cloud-native technologies. Focuses on develop cloud-native solutions for high-performance computing needs and define standards observability for monitoring, logging and tracing.

name: Hervé Friquet
bio: I’m a technology enthusiast focused on client success. I like to acquire new skills and share knowledge. I’m a Kubernetes fan with passion for Automation and Observability. In my current role as Technical Solution Architect and Delivery Consultant at IBM Technology Expert Labs, I help customers to succeed with IBM Aspera and IBM Instana technologies.

name: Hieu Hoang
bio: Hello everyone, I’m Hieu, with extensive experience in designing and managing cloud-native solutions. I specialize in working across both on-premise and cloud environments, leveraging technologies like Kubernetes and other tools from the CNCF landscape. I’m passionate about automating workflows, optimizing CI/CD pipelines. I also enjoy learning and exploring new technologies to stay updated in the field.

name: Hieu Le Ngoc
bio: I am a DevOps Engineer specializing in Kubernetes and CNCF technologies, with hands-on expertise in container orchestration, infrastructure automation, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure). I focus on building scalable, secure, and reliable systems through DevSecOps practices, Infrastructure as Code with Terraform, and configuration management using Ansible and Python. Experienced in leading teams and automating multi-environment setups, I actively troubleshoot and enhance system reliability while aligning with CNCF best practices.

name: Hikaru Saito
bio: I work as an SRE/Cloud Engineer at AEON Corporation, one of the largest retail companies in Japan. I am committed to transform corporate culture and maximize business value through leveraging Cloud Native technologies. I am passionate about Azure, k8s, Terraform, Vault and Team Topologies.

name: Hiroki Ikeda
bio: With six years of experience in the cybersecurity industry, I specialize in developing in-house products utilizing AWS cloud technologies. I have a strong focus on building serverless systems that ensure high availability and reliability. My expertise lies in creating innovative solutions that enhance security and performance in complex environments.

name: Hirotaka Maeda
bio: I experienced various server/db construction and migration projects as an On-prem Infra engg for 10 years. In Jan 2021, I started self-learning Kubernetes to re-skill and cloud ready engg. I'm currently working on public cloud related project. I would like to continue Cloud Native tech journey with you, thanks!

name: Hiroyuki Hasebe
bio: I am a Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft, specializing in supporting customers with the development of mission-critical systems. My work focuses on leveraging cutting-edge cloud technologies to drive innovation and deliver reliable solutions. Passionate about giving back, I am committed to contributing to the community and sharing knowledge to empower others.

name: Hisham Veeran
bio: I am a tech enthusiast and developer with expertise in architecting cloud-native solutions, automation, and AI. Passionate about creating efficient workflows and scalable infrastructure. My work spans tools such as Kubernetes, FluxCD, Tekton, OPA, Harbor, Cert-Manager, Fluentbit, Prometheus, Carvel, Thanos, and Istio.

name: Hoan Lac
bio: I began my career as an infrastructure administrator, building a strong foundation in IT system management. As I transitioned into a DevOps/SRE role, I focused on automating infrastructure, enhancing system reliability, and embracing cloud-native technologies. My expertise includes working with CNCF projects like Kubernetes, where I apply best practices to optimize and scale cloud-native environments. I am deeply committed to continuously expanding my knowledge and exploring new advancements within the CNCF landscape.

name: Hongtat Tan
bio: HongTat is a Solutions & Software Architect with 15+ years of experience in design and implementation of distributed platforms, system integration and custom implementation. He leads teams in modernizing application and infrastructure, and has successfully transformed large monolithic architecture into containerized microservices architecture on Kubernetes.

name: Honoka Toda
bio: I am a Software Engineer specializing in backend development with expertise in Go, Kubernetes, and AWS services. I am deeply interested in distributed systems and cloud-native technologies, focusing on designing scalable and resilient systems. I strive to contribute to the growth of the cloud-native technology community while inspiring and positively influencing young engineers in Japan. Through these efforts, I hope to elevate Japan’s software engineering industry and strengthen its presence on the global stage.

name: Hoon Jo
bio:
Hoon Jo is a Cloud Native and Cloud Solutions Architect at Megazone soft. He had several presentations on cloud-native technologies in Ubucon Asia, Openinfra Asia, HashiTalks, Openstack & Kubernetes Korea and so on. And he relays valuable information from the global to local community and makes clips to understand easily in Korea. My interests are highly are kubernetes and related cloud native products. I am fully sure cloud-native help to change the world as well as business model efficient way. Here is my channel. - Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/HoonJo/ - Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/HoonJo

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: In my view, Korea is not rapidly catching up with the latest information from worldwide due to the language barrier and other reasons. Thus, I hope I will relay a lot of highly valuable information from cloud-native resources to Korean communities. Plus, if cloud-native resources could be better digested after cooking, I will cook them to bite easily, such as clips. As an ambassador, it pushes me to be more active and be responsible. It is a really exciting journey in 2023 :) hopefully.

name: Hou, Po-Lin
bio: Starting my career as a PHP Developer, I later transitioned into an SRE role through a fortunate opportunity. This transition not only broadened my technical horizon but also sparked a deep interest in exploring scalable systems and operational reliability. Along the way, through both work experience and self-study, I have been exposed to a variety of tools and skills, including CI/CD pipelines, container orchestration, and monitoring systems. I am constantly driven by a passion for cloud computing, cybersecurity, and mastering innovative technologies that push the boundaries of what is possible. My approach is guided by a curiosity for solving complex problems and a commitment to building robust, efficient systems. Feel free to connect with me to discuss technology and share insights on technical challenges!

name: Hrittik Roy
bio:
Hrittik is currently a pre-final undergrad, who has previously worked at various startups helping them scale their content efforts. He loves diving deep into distributed systems and creating articles on them and has spoken at conferences such as Azure Cloud Summit, UbuCon Asia and Kubernetes Community Days - Lagos and Chennai among others! His best days are when he finds ways to create impact in the communities he’s a part of either by code, content, or mentorship! Blogs: https://hrittikhere.github.io/blogs/ Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/hrittikhere Credly: https://credly.com/users/hrittikhere

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being an ambassador will help me continue the work I do and, moreover, it will help me meet new people and discover new opportunities. With the support from CNCF, I also plan to expand the cloud native community in my local region and finally get into video content. I also plan to post a few articles on the CNCF blog (like this: https://www.cncf.io/blog/2023/03/13/how-to-use-kubernetes-events-for-effective-alerting-and-monitoring/) and continue creating content in the form of articles.

name: Huabing Zhao
bio:
Hi, I'm Huabing Zhao, founder of the CNCF open-source project Aeraki Mesh(https://aeraki.net). I'm passionate about Cloud-Native technologies like Microservices, Kubernetes, and Service Mesh. I share my thoughts on Cloud-Native technologies through my blog(https://zhaohuabing.com https://medium.com/@zhaohuabing). When I'm not working, I enjoy watching movies, swimming, hiking, travelling, and skateboarding.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be a CNCF ambassador because it's an opportunity for me to share my passion for Cloud-Native technologies with others who are interested in this space. In the meatime, I have the chance to connect with other experts in this field and learn from them.

name: Huan Wei
bio:
Huan has more than 15 years of work experience, and his current focus is cloud-native edge computing, distributed cloud, and high-performance computing. He is currently working as a Senior Technical Director at HarmonyCloud, a company located in Hangzhou, China, providing leading cloud-native products and solutions for hundreds of enterprise customers, including Kubernetes, PaaS, edge computing, micro service visibility, DevOps, etc. In addition, Huan serves as a Technical Steering Committe member of the CNCF edge computing project KubeEdge. Huan is an open source technology enthusiast and is currently committed to building an open source technology ecosystem in China.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The company I work for, HarmonyCloud, is an influential cloud native tehnology supplier in China and a long-term partner of CNCF. HarmonyCloud has helped many customers around the world complete the transformation of cloud-native technology. At the same time, I am currently working as a TSC member in the CNCF Project KubeEdge community, responsible for leading several SIG teams and working with other TSC members towards the graduation of the KubeEdge project. Over the years, I have also given speeches at conferences organized by CNCF. Therefore, I am familiar with the operation process of CNCF projects and understand the job responsibilities of CNCF ambassadors. If I become an ambassador, I will promote the maturity and promotion of Kubernetes, KubeEdge and more open source projects, and help users around the world to apply these advanced and open source cloud-native tenologies.

name: Hugues Connan
bio: DevOps Engineer and trainer on Kubernetes Application Developer and Admin. I have a keen interest in all things Kubernetes, focus on observability and FinOps. Using automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, GitLab CI or ArgoCD to apply the DevOps best practices and help teams to develop all the environments they need.

name: Hui Tang
bio: I've been a Google Cloud Architect since 2019, delivering comprehensive technical support and tailored GCP solutions. I'm passionate about helping customers modernize their applications, particularly through architecting and implementing Kubernetes solutions on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). I'm also deeply interested in open-source projects and cloud-native innovation.

name: Humble Devassy Chirammal
bio:
Humble, a Staff Engineer/Tech Lead at VMware and a dedicated open source advocate for over 17 years, also serves as a Ceph Ambassador. Since 2016, his pivotal role as a core contributor/maintainer to Kubernetes has been instrumental in its ongoing maintenance and evolution. Notably, he initiated the Kubernetes Bangalore meetup, uniting over 8k+ enthusiasts, and assumed an organizational role in the Cloud Native Bangalore chapter. Expanding his influence, in 2019, Humble spearheaded the creation and management of the Kubernetes Kerala Meetup, actively nurturing the Cloud Native community in the region while leading KCD Kerala 2024. His fervor for mentoring and empowering individuals drives his ongoing commitment. Alongside speaking engagements at various conferences, his impactful blogs on Cloud Native technologies underline his expertise. Furthermore, his authorship of "Mastering KVM Virtualization" solidifies his authoritative stance in the field. https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/graphs/contributors https://kcdkerala.in https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-bangalore/ https://bit.ly/k8sKerala https://bit.ly/k8sBLR https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/container-native-storage-39-enhanced-day-2-management-and-unified-installation-within-openshift-container-platform https://kubernetes.io/blog/2022/09/21/kubernetes-1-25-use-secrets-while-expanding-csi-volumes-on-node-alpha/ https://www.humblec.com/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be a CNCF ambassador because it offers a unique opportunity to actively contribute to the world of cloud-native technologies, which is a dynamic and rapidly evolving field. As an ambassador, I can foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among a diverse group of professionals, ultimately advancing the adoption and understanding of cloud-native practices. It's an inspiring role that allows me to be at the forefront of innovation and connect with experts and enthusiasts in the CNCF ecosystem, all while promoting the growth of these transformative technologies.

name: Hung Fai Leung
bio: Tech lover. Enjoys learning new things. Has a strong interest in databases and platform engineering.

name: Hung Tran
bio: Learner. Sport. Food. Joy

name: Hung-Ying Tai
bio:
I am the maintainer of WasmEdge Runtime and an active mentor in LFX mentorship. I am enthusiastic about sharing how to leverage the WebAssembly technology with the Cloud Native ecosystem, including giving talks at the conference[1] and hosting online tutorials [2]. [1]: https://kccnceu2023.sched.com/event/6c0f559281122a74f5292f3d05b5936e?iframe=no#video_stream [2]: https://coscup.org/2023/zh-TW/session/EFYC8R I am going to have more tutorials and information related to Cloud Native+Wasm on my personal blog (https://hyd.ai). Stay tuned!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: WebAssembly is new for the Cloud Native ecosystem. I’m excited to join the CNCF ambassador community this year to promote the connection between Could Native software and Wasm and bring this knowledge to local communities and university clubs/courses in Taiwan.

name: Husam Ahmed Chaudhary
bio: I am a 18x certified Cloud Engineer with 8 years of experience, specializing in Linux and DevOps. I have extensive expertise in solution architecture, DevOps practices, and security.

name: Husni Alhamdani
bio:
I have been working around infrastructure and platform for more than 5 years, currently, I work as a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE).

I graduated from the LFX mentorship Program in 2022 (Kyverno Project), and in my spare time I do contributions to CNCF Project, so far, I have been contributing to OpenTelemetry, Istio, Cilium, KEDA project.

name: Hyehun Lim
bio: Currently, I'm a Technical Account Manager at AWS for FSI and Edu-tech. As my customers have used lots of K8S projects for their production workload, I have been studying this area for a couple of years to support them. As a Kubestronaut, I still have new things to catch up and explorer even after this. I still have a long way to go.

name: Hyewon Jeong
bio: I work as a Devops Engineer at a CSP company in korea. I'm using Kubernetes as a container orchestration

name: Håkon Solbjørg
bio: Håkon has a background in software development and an interest for DevOps. Automation, CI/CD, reproducible builds and pipelines - anything to make the builds and deploys of applications to go smooth, and when they don't, there is a reproducible build process to debug locally. It all started on linux servers before ascending to the clouds. As a software developer at heart, Håkon sees the deployment pipeline from code to running in production.

name: Ian Board
bio: A passionate SRE with a wealth of experience in various tech roles, Ian loves to gain deep technical understanding of the technology stacks he supports. Recently this has found him focusing on chaos engineering in Kubernetes clusters, to better understand common failure patterns and how best to mitigate against them.

name: Ibrahima Birane Faye
bio: I am a passionate cloud-native enthusiast, deeply fascinated by Kubernetes and the endless possibilities it brings to modern infrastructure. With a strong background in DevOps and a love for solving complex infrastructure challenges, I thrive in the ever-evolving world of cloud-native technologies. Whether it’s automating deployments, optimizing clusters, or contributing to the Kubernetes community, I’m always eager to learn and share knowledge.

name: Iceber Gu
bio:
I love open source and am involved in many CNCF projects such as Containerd, Kubernetes,Kubeedge, WasmCloud & KasmCloud. I also created Clusterpedia and promoted its contribution to the CNCF Sandbox project. I organized KCD Beijing and KCD Shenzhen in China, and have been a speaker at Kubecon and many other events. I maintain my blog at https://icebergu.com/ and when I have time I share my thoughts on technology!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am delighted to be a CNCF Ambassador. I am very grateful to CNCF for recognizing my work in the cloud native community. The influence of being a CNCF Ambassador allows me to better promote cloud-native technologies and the CNCF projects, make it easier to organize cloud-native events, and attract more people to participate in cloud-native construction. I will make more contributions to CNCF as an ambassador!

name: Igor Beliakov
bio: Ex-network engineer (switched my focus to Kubernetes in 2019), one of maintainers of grafana-operator (https://github.com/grafana/grafana-operator/)

name: Igor Eulalio
bio:
Container, Cloud and Kubernetes expert, organizer of KCD Brasil.

Currently main contributor of Falco Talon, a project from the Falco ecosystem, aiming to provide open source automatic threat response for Kubernetes.

name: Igor Grigorov
bio: Software Engineer passionate about microservices architecture and building robust and maintainable solutions. Lately, I've been diving deeper into cloud-native DevOps engineering, sharpening my skills in automation, container orchestration, and modern infrastructure.

name: Igor Ignatev
bio: I am a DevOps/SRE and Cloud Architect passionate about Kubernetes and GitOps. With extensive experience in cloud architecture, I specialize in designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure solutions. My special interest lies in automation and I am committed to developing my skills, expanding my knowledge, and staying current with industry trends and technologies.

name: Igor Nikolovski
bio:
Born and raised in Amsterdam, father from the former Yugoslavia, mother of Dutch descent. Married, father of 2 beautiful daughters.

Around 25 years professional engineer with experience in the fields of Infrastructure, Software Development, Databases, Operations and Customer facing Support roles. I love to keep an eye on the future of tech and be an early adopter/tester of new things. In a nutshell, this is who I am: someone who loves to keep learning, both professionally and personally.

name: Ihor Denyskov
bio: I am a Principal DevOps engineer at Oracle. Scope of my interests includes Clouds, K8s, CI/CD, system design, system architecture and security. I am always looking for opportunities for ongoing learning and professional excellence.

name: Ihor Dvoretskyi
bio:
Ihor is a Senior Developer Advocate at Cloud Native Computing Foundation, focused on Kubernetes-related efforts in the open source community.

He is a Product Manager for Kubernetes, co-leading the Product Management Special Interest Group, focused on enhancing Kubernetes as an open source product. Besides that, he is participating in Kubernetes release process as a features lead for multiple Kubernetes releases.

A Linux user since 2005 with a deep engineering background, Ihor has been responsible for projects tightly bound to the cloud computing space, containerized workloads and Linux systems.

His recent speaking appearances include talks at Kubernetes Leadership and Contributors Summits, OpenStack Summits NA and APAC, OpenSource Summit EU, ContainerDays EU, Google DevFests and other industry-leading events.

name: Ihor Matsapura
bio: I am a Senior DevOps Engineer specializing in cloud computing and automation. I’m passionate about AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform. Holding a master's degree in Computer Engineering, I always seek opportunities to learn something new.

name: Ileriayo Adebiyi
bio:
Ileriayo is a Certified Kubernetes Developer, Administrator, and Security Specialist (CKAD, CKA, CKS) with a passion for people and technology. Co-organizer of the CNCF Lagos community group and KCD Nigeria committed to the growth of Africa. A teacher who takes pleasure in democratizing complex technical concepts. He is the creator of Get Going With Kubernetes, which consists of book reading and a series of workshops to help people learn Kubernetes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The adoption of Cloud Native in Africa has been quite low compared to other regions. Becoming an ambassador provides me the opportunity to champion the adoption, development, and growth of Cloud Native on a bigger scale in Africa.

Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/ileriayo

name: Iliyan Petkov
bio:
I'm a seasoned IT professional with over 20 years of experience designing, building, and scaling high-performance IT infrastructures. As the co-founder of DojoBits, I channel my passion for technology into continuous learning, meeting new people at conferences and community meetups, solving complex IT infrastructure challenges, and sharing my experience through teaching. I also focus on driving efficiency with automation, consulting, and working with cloud-native technologies like Containers and Kubernetes.

Outside work, I enjoy reading, hiking, mountain biking, training martial arts, learning new languages, and working on DIY electronics and home automation projects.

If you want to learn more or get in touch, visit our website: https: //dojobits.io or connect on Linked-in.

name: Ilya Dvorkin
bio: Experienced DevOps engineer with a background in Kubernetes, cloud infrastructure, automation and software development. Passionate about optimizing deployments, enhancing security, and streamlining workflows. Currently exploring MLOps and improving skills in Go and Rust.

name: Ilya Fedotov
bio: I'm a DevOps and Cloud Engineer with more than 15 years of experience in IT.

name: Imran Hossain
bio: I am a passionate DevOps professional dedicated to building scalable, secure, and efficient systems while driving innovation through collaboration. I thrive on solving complex challenges and am committed to continuous learning and growth. I am excited to contribute to the future of technology, embrace cutting-edge advancements, and foster a culture of adaptability and innovation within the tech community.

name: Inwoo Choi
bio: Hello. I'm an engineer with a keen interest in cloud natives. I've been working with Kubernetes for less than a year, but I think I personally achieved to Kubestronaut by approaching it as a play, not a study or work. I encourage anyone reading this to approach Cloud Native technology as a play, not a study or work. CNCF provides a lot of playgrounds for you to play in. Just Enjoy!

name: Irakli Ghvinianidze
bio: Just Ops

name: Iris Dyrmishi
bio: I am a Senior Observability Engineer at Miro with a strong passion for Observability and platform engineering, making these fields the center of my career. I focus on building solutions that make complex systems more transparent and reliable. Observability is more than just a skill for me; it’s a philosophy I enjoy sharing through speaking, writing, and collaborating with others. I’m also one of the organizers of Kubernetes Community Days(KCD) Porto, where I help foster a vibrant, engaged cloud-native community. Medium: https://medium.com/@irisdyrmishi

name: Irvi Firqotul Aini
bio:
Interested in open source, machine learning, compiler, and natural language processing. Exploring language parsing with Rust and R. Part of Shadow of Kubernetes Release Team 1.17 and 1.18. Shadow Chairs of Kubernetes SIGs Docs. Emeritus-Co-Chairs of Kubernetes SIGs Docs. Contributing in Kubernetes, Planout and Ax (Facebook), Google Cloud Platform and Google API (Google), Keras. Programme Committee at Helm Summit 2019. Programme Committee at Grace Hopper 2020. Programme Committee at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon APAC 2020. Programme Committee at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon NA 2020. KubeCon and CloudNativeCon Track Chair for ML & Data EU 2021 NA 2022. Track Host for CPPCon 2022. Mentor At Grace Hopper OSD 2022.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to be a Cloud Native Foundation ambassador because it offers an incredible platform to advocate for state-of-the-art cloud technologies and best practices. Being part of this community allows me to engage with thought leaders, share knowledge, and contribute to shaping the future of cloud computing. Moreover, this role empowers me to bridge the gap between developers, businesses, and the broader public, fostering innovation and growth in the ecosystem.

name: Isaac Mecchi
bio: I am a cloud architect that run container workload orchestrated by kubernetes managed by gitops strategy.

name: Isiaho Harun Mweresa
bio: I am a cloud and devops engineer with expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, IAC among other open source technologies. I'm currently expanding my expertise in the kubernetes ecosystem and focussing on securing container environments and observability.

name: Ismail Doğançay
bio: I am an experienced system engineer at a large and complex company, where I focus on the automated setup of clusters that adhere to best practices and stringent company policies. I specialize in CNCF technologies such as Kubernetes, ArgoCD and Prometheus, and have in-depth knowledge of cloud-native applications and infrastructure. I am passionate about leveraging the latest technologies to build scalable and robust infrastructure.

name: Israel Oña Ordoñez
bio: Isra has around 8 years of experience in the IT world and is the DevOps Lead at Deuna App, where he manages a team focused on automation and cloud orchestration using technologies like Azure, AWS, and Kubernetes. He has solid experience with tools such as Terraform, Docker and ArgoCD, leading scalable and secure implementations. He is passionate about technology and continuously learns new things to stay updated with the latest trends and tools in the DevOps ecosystem.

name: Itay Shakury
bio:
Itay Shakury is VP Open Source at Aqua Security, where he leads engineering and strategy of open source, cloud native, security solutions. Itay has some 20 years of professional experience in various software development, architecture and product management roles. Itay had initiated several local technical communities and events, including the successful CNCF Tel Aviv meetup group.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm honored to be recognized as a CNCF Ambassador, and join this amazing team of worldwide experts. To me, the CNCF is an intersection between two passions of mine - technology and community, which I have been pursuing since early in my career. I'm excited to continue to collaborate with the various technical working groups, events, projects and initiatives that the CNCF ecosystem continuously generates.

name: Ivan Ballatore

Our mission is to simplify complex IT challenges and provide scalable, secure solutions that drive digital transformation. If you’re interested in how our private Kubernetes cloud hosting can boost your IT infrastructure, check us out at www.netbadgers.com. Let’s explore how we can support your growth!

For deeper insights into my projects and perspectives on innovation

name: Jack Kelly

Jack has a passion for nix and supports over 80 packages in nixpkgs, several of which being CNCF projects. With an interest in software delivery and nix it was natural for Jack to develop strong opinions around what constitutes a Secure Software-Supply Chain, and consults on such topics, in addition to facilitating as part of the In-Toto Steering Committee (ITSC).

name: Jackson Ching
bio: I am an IT professional with over 20 years of experience specializing in Linux, digital forensics, and end-to-end solution design for enterprise environments. I have led teams in systems integration and mentored engineers, enhancing operational efficiency through cloud, virtualization, and automation expertise. My strategic approach consistently delivers high-quality, secure infrastructure solutions across diverse industries.
