bio: I started my IT career focusing on composing and running containerised applications on cloud platforms. With a keen interest in FOSS and cloud-native technologies, I specialise in designing softwares which utilise community projects. I am also fascinated by the beauty of automation when I worked on IaC.

name: Jacob Crawford
bio: Im a freelance DevOps engineer with a passion for open-source technologies. I have been building Kubernetes platforms for years using technologies like Cilium, Flux, Rook, Kyverno, Strimzi and many more. I'm always looking for projects where I can use my expertise in Kubernetes as well as learn new technologies from the CNCF family.

name: Jacopo Binosi
bio: I first encountered Linux at university, and from that moment, I never looked back. It was then that I realized Linux would be my lifelong "familiar." I enjoy solving problems and making things work the way I want. This, combined with my passion for Linux, led me to a career as a Systems Engineer after earning my Bachelor's degree in Physics. Time flew by, and I transitioned to the Cloud... and to Neovim (I’ve always been a daily Vim user and a fan of CLI tools in general). Today, I’m deeply into Kubernetes, but I still use Vim, Ubuntu, Debian, Arch, and occasionally work with some legacy infrastructure. Now that I’m a "Kubestronaut," I see this as a fresh starting point, without forgetting the tools that got me here.

name: Jacopo Nardiello
bio:
Founder at SIGHUP, I have been involved with Kubernetes and the CNCF since its inception in 2015. I am passionate about Kubernetes and full lifecycle management of production-grade infrastructures, open standards and currently serving in the advisory board of Linux Foundation Europe.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to continue supporting the CNCF, both as a community of like-minded individuals and as a technological ecosystem. My mission is to encourage organizations to adopt open source projects as a foundation for the evolution of their infrastructure and governance, promoting the use of OSS and Open Standards.

name: Jae Choi
bio: Technology leader passionate about automation with the mindset of "how can we make things better" and "let's get it done" I believe you truely understand the processes and systems if you look in the perspective of each stakeholder so I frequently put my self in the position of developers, security, data engineers, SRE and QA hands on involving writing code. This allows me to stay current and pragmatic when making technical decisions.

name: Jaehwan Suh
bio: Hello, I’m JaeHwan Suh, interested in cloud technologies and CNCF projects. I am currently studying and running the blog linked below: https://woodstock1993.tistory.com/

name: Jaesang Park
bio: Kubernetes Prometheus, Thanos Bash / Power shell

name: Jagadeesan Arumugam
bio: Hi, I am Jaga, Solution Arichitect and having 20+ Years of experience in IT, specialised in Virtualization. I am also certified GCP PCA.

name: Jagoudel Denis
bio: Automation is my credo. A convinced Pythonist. A lover of hacking. And also a big user of Kubernetes, whether onpremise or via cloud providers.

name: Jaime Andres Cubillos Patiño
bio:
Project Experience: Kubernetes, CyberSecurity, Helm, Identities, Istio, Open Policy Agent (OPA), Contaner Network Interface (CNI), KEDA Jaime Cubillos is a highly skilled Subject Matter Expert in Kubernetes, Azure, DevOps, DevSecOps, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and CyberSecurity, with more than 6 years of experience in designing, implementing and automating top-tier Cloud/Devops projects, migration workloads from on-premise to cloud and cloud to kubernetes. Fully Kubernetes Certificate KCNA, CKAD, CKA, KCSA and CKS, as a Kubernetes Adminitrator Jaime continious implement security practices at cluster level and workload level using Static Code Analysis and Dynamic Code Analysis tools, autoescalate techniques to ensure high availability and Disaster Recovery strategies in Kubernetes Clusters.

Jaime enjoy automating the deployment the kubernetes environments through Azure Pipelines and Helm Charts reducing the time to market of the applications and reducing the human error of deployment cross environmentst, with always in mind the importance of optimizing cloud costs to maximize business value applying FinOps Proficient in a wide range of tools such as Azure Devops, GitHub Actions, Docker, Aquasec, Terraform, Microservices, Azure, NGINX, Kube-Cost Plugin, OWASP, Velero. Jaime contribute to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) as Kubernetes expert for the Cloud Native LATAM community group.

Jaime is also the Chapter Organizer and Speaker of the Cloud Native Community Group in Colombia/Cali https://community.cncf.io/events/details/cncf-cali-presents-kubernetes-de-la-nube-a-la-sucursal-del-cielo/ Speaker kubernetes birthday 10 meetup in Bogota - Colombia https://www.linkedin.com/events/kubertenesbirthdaybashbogot7203870103833079808/comments/ My main goal is bring CNCF technologies closer to Spanish-speaking community to adopt cloud native technologies and be kubernetes evangelist.

name: Jairus Christensen
bio: Jairus is a DevOps engineer with expertise in Kubernetes, security engineering, and AWS. He holds a degree in Cybersecurity with a minor in Computer Science from Brigham Young University. Jairus has contributed to open-source projects like OpenSSL and Nginx and maintains a project called ClusterCreator, a tool to run secure Kubernetes on Proxmox. With experience in bare-metal and cloud environments, he specializes in creating secure, scalable systems and enjoys experimenting with his homelab to simulate enterprise IT environments.

name: Jake Pineda
bio: Jake is an Membership Sales Representative at The Linux Foundation, working with the Cloud Native Computing Foundation. He brings experience in technology sales and cloud solutions, with an academic background that includes an Associate degree in Computer Science - Network Technology from Lehigh Carbon Community College, and ongoing studies for a Bachelor's in Information Technology at Western Governors University. Jake is dedicated to enhancing open-source software solutions in cloud native computing and network security.

name: Jakob Weinzettl
bio: Jakob possesses a strong affinity for cybersecurity, having held various roles within four distinct Security Operation Centers (SOCs), including Security Engineer, Incident Responder, Incident Response Manager, TriceratOps Automation Manager, and Acting Head of SOC. Utilizing his expertise in blue teaming and passion for red teaming, Jakob contributes to enhancing the cybersecurity posture of both internal and external organizations. His extensive knowledge is complemented by a range of industry-recognized certifications, including OSCP, OSEP, GCFA, GDAT, GSOM, Kubestronaut (CKA, CKS), and others. Jakob's contributions to open-source initiatives have garnered recognition from SANS Institute, a leading authority in cybersecurity research and training. His Sigma rules were referenced by SANS ICS, while his co-authored open-source project (ATC RE&CT) was featured in the SANS MGT551 course. Jakob brings a unique blend of technical expertise and passion for cybersecurity to his work. With a strong educational background in computer science and cybersecurity, Jakob has developed a deep understanding of complex security systems and threats. His dedication to staying at the forefront of industry trends and advancements has earned him a reputation as a knowledgeable and effective cybersecurity expert. Jakob aspires to achieve a pioneering role as the first hacker-CISO within an S&P 500 organization, leveraging his expertise and passion for advancing cybersecurity best practices.

name: Jakub Krzywda
bio:
I have over a decade of experience in cloud and distributed systems, and hold a PhD in the field.

In the role of Cloud Native Training Manager and Senior Engineer at Elastisys, I am helping organizations adopt cloud native technologies and DevOps practices.

As the Linux Foundation Authorized Instructor, I teach all Kubernetes courses in preparation for CKA, CKAD, and CKS exams.

name: Jakub Scholz
bio: Jakub has a long experience with message-oriented middleware and currently focuses mainly on Apache Kafka and its integration with Kubernetes. He is one of the founders and maintainers of the Strimzi project. Strimzi provides operators and other tools to make running Apache Kafka on Kubernetes as easy as possible. He also likes to talk about anything related to Apache Kafka and Kubernetes.

name: Jakub Sokół
bio: I'm a DevOps engineer with developer background. Started career at Opera browser, currently at monday.com in Observability team. Recently, working a lot with OpenTelemetry - from maintenance of internal instrumentation distribution to overhauling signals collection pipeline using OpenTelemetry Collector

name: James Larrea
bio: I have worked with cloud and container technologies since 2018 when I discovered that life was more than just Linux servers. Since 2022 I decided to focus on Cloud and Kubernetes security and have built expertise in the CNAPP space. I am truly passionate about learning new technologies and troubleshooting complex issues.

name: James Spurin
bio:
With over 25 years of experience, James Spurin is an industry veteran skilled in various technical fields and adept at leading Engineering teams in top-tier Financial Services organisations. He now focuses on creating online courses and Technical Educational Content in areas such as DevOps, Kubernetes, and Cloud Native, incorporating hands-on learning experiences through container-based lab environments and has reached over 100,000 students globally. As a CNCF Ambassador, James actively advocates for Container and Cloud Native knowledge, education, and Kubernetes-based orchestration. His company, DiveInto, champions Cloud Native and consistently shares fresh content on its YouTube channel: https://youtube.com/DiveInto James has also established an inclusive community dedicated to Cloud Native learning, which can be accessed at https://community.diveinto.com

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be a CNCF Ambassador as it aligns perfectly with my passion for creating technical educational content on Cloud Native/Kubernetes whilst also Giving Back, a core-principle of the CNCF. The role supports me in more actively engaging with a diverse global community, enabling me to learn from others whilst also sharing my own knowledge and expertise. As an Ambassador, I will contribute to thought leadership in the cloud native space and hope to provide an instrumental role in fostering a culture of knowledge sharing, learning and innovation. Throughout this journey, I am also eager to support and encourage others in pursuing CNCF Cloud Native certifications - an endeavour I am both passionate about and an advocate for. Overall, being a CNCF Ambassador is a highly rewarding and fulfilling experience that allows me to give back to the community while staying updated on the latest developments in the field.

name: Jan De Laet
bio: I'm a senior Cloud Solutions Architect and team lead with a strong focus on Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies in general. I started my cloud-native journey as a DevOps engineer and quickly grew into the role I am currently in. I'm constantly looking to discover and learn about new technologies and how they can make a positive impact for the customers I'm engaged with.

name: Jan Laudahn

I like to explore new topics, tools, and possibilities and dive into the world of Cloud Native. Especially that there seems to be a solution for everything is one of my favourite parts. And if not, you can simply start to build it.

name: Jan Melén
bio:
Jan Melén is an expert in networking, open-source software, and cloud technologies, with a career spanning over two decades. He is a staunch advocate for Free and Open-Source Software (FOSS) adoption within Ericsson and the broader community he engages with.

Jan has served as a Research Leader for Cloud Research, driving innovations in cloud computing. Since 2019, he has led a team dedicated to CNCF open-source projects, contributing significantly to Ericsson's Kubernetes distribution, and fostering an "upstream-first" culture within the company. He now oversees Ericsson’s open-source contributions and coordinates collaborations with CNCF projects. With his technical expertise and leadership, Jan aims to support CNCF's mission and strengthen the global cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Jan Pipan

He primarily works with Kubernetes clusters on VMware Tanzu, managing and optimizing various workloads by following GitOps best practices. His responsibilities also involve implementing robust and effective backup strategies for Kubernetes environments.

Janakiram contributes to Forbes and The New Stack on cloud native and microservices related articles and research.

name: Janelle Caudill
bio:
Janelle is a detail-oriented individual with a passionate focus on creative collaboration, flawless event execution and five star customer service. She attended Central Michigan University where she received my B.S. in Event Management and Hospitality Services Administration.

Prior to moving to the greater Chicago area in 2019, she spent nine years in Nashville, Tennessee planning and executing multi-day conferences, weddings, corporate outings and trade shows, and has a strong background in food and beverage management. Her last role in Nashville was at the five star Hermitage Hotel where she oversaw all aspects of wedding and conference planning / on-site management, while also playing an active role as the Event Chair on the Board for the Tennessee Wedding and Event Specialist Association (TWESA).

She spent the last 3 1/2 years with a 3rd Party Meeting Planning Company planning CME events for our client partners at Chicago area Hospitals and beyond, where she thrived creating meaningful relationships with clients and bringing their vision to life.

When I'm not tinkering with containers or learning something new, you can find me cheering on the Green Bay Packers and Arsenal.

He is skilled in container orchestration, Infrastructure as Code, and cloud-native development, and is known for his ability to mentor teams and drive containerization strategies that enhance scalability and reliability.

In his free time, he enjoys experimenting with projects in the CNCF Landscape and has been contributing to open-source projects for a decade.

Jenn holds Bachelor of Science degrees in Computer Science and Zoology, and a Master’s degree in Computational Biosciences from Arizona State University.

name: Jeremy Garcia
bio: Jeremy is the VP of technical community and open source at Datadog, where he's responsible for developer advocacy, training, documentation, technical writing, multiple engineering teams, and the open source programs office. An ardent but realistic open source advocate with a pragmatic approach, he is the founder of LinuxQuestions.org, which is one of the largest independent open source communities on the web. An early podcaster, he's currently a presenter on Bad Voltage. He's also on the board of the Linux Fund. Before joining Datadog Jeremy ran a consultancy helping organizations implement open source programs, find viable open source business models, and grow technical communities. He's spoken at a variety of conferences, had a column in Linux Magazine, was an ambassador for Opensource.com, and regularly blogged about the intersection of business and open source. Outside of technology he is an avid runner and foodie, and long time Buffalo Bills fan.

name: Jeremy Tan Shi Yong
bio: Opensource advocate. Kubernetes enthusiast

bio: Consultant, Open Source enthousiast

name: Jerry Lee
bio: Over the years, Jerry Lee has run global IT businesses in cutting-edge technologies, including open source, cloud computing, big data, mobile, and deep-learning. Through the use of his skill sets and his extensive network, he has created synergy and contributed to business and social growth initiatives in not only the Korea market but also the entire Asia-Pacific region.

name: Jesse Meng
bio:
I am a cloud native believer and advocator with over 15 years of experience in cloud computing. I was an early contributor to Kubernetes and led its adoption at eBay for six years. I am currently working as a product and development owner of cloud native FinOps at Tencent Cloud, where I founded the open-source project Crane, which helps users optimize their cloud costs. I am also auther of "The Journey of Kubernetes Production Adoption Success", translator of "Cloud FinOps", and speaker on various cloud native topics including Cloud Native Campus in geektime.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador because I love cloud native and I want to share my passion and knowledge with others. I think cloud native is the future of software development and it can bring many benefits to users, developers, and businesses. I want to help the cloud native community grow and thrive by contributing to open-source projects, writing books and articles, and organizing events. Being an ambassador will give me more opportunities to connect with other cloud native enthusiasts and learn from their experiences. I hope to inspire more people to join the cloud native journey and make a positive impact on the world.

name: Jessica Andersson
bio:
Jessica runs the Gothenburg chapter for CNCF communities and is an active part in Cloud Native Nordics. She's building platforms to improve developer experience and passionate about empowering teams to build great products!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to continue creating an open community for sharing and learning around cloud native technologies and to get a chance to meet other amazing people doing similar work all around the world.

name: Jhansimadhavi Kondepudi
bio: I am a DevOps and Cloud professional with extensive experience in cloud technologies. Currently, I work as a Senior Cloud Engineer at Microsoft. I am passionate about staying ahead of industry trends and continuously improving cloud systems.

name: Jiahao Ji Zhou

name: Jian Sun
bio: jfrog.com

With extensive experience in the design and operation of large-scale high-availability Kubernetes site clusters in production environments. Committed to standardization and programmable automation of cloud and cloud-native infrastructure, active practice devops, CI/CD and platform engineering based on Kubernetes and its ecology.

name: Jim Angel

I'm Jim Angel. I love solving problems and working with incredible people! I'm primarily involved with upstream Kubernetes (SIG-Release and SIG-Docs). Currently working on restarting our local Austin meetup and a Texas KCD. You can follow my latest projects at jimangel.io

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It's awesome to get to know so many great people and work with leading technology that's responsible for changing multiple industries. The community that keeps Kubernetes open and welcome is a special thing, and I hope to maintain such standards myself. I also enjoy helping connect the folks using open source tooling with the resources they need to be successful, and being an ambassador keeps me connected.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I used to be the second Chinese to join the CNCF Ambassador program and then the CNCF Ambassador changed the rules of the game and I thought I should reapply.

I'm continuously driven to learn and adapt to the latest advancements, implementing innovative solutions to meet the demands of an ever-changing technological landscape.

Joanna also oversees legal and policy initiatives, governance, and code of conduct incident response. Prior to joining the Linux Foundation and CNCF, Joanna served as a legal and strategic advisor to open source software foundations, tech standard setting organizations, and a broad range of technology companies.

Outside of technology, Joe is an audiophile, a lego enthusiast, and a practitioner of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

name: Joel G.
bio: I love to develop secure, reliable and scalable services while automating redundant tasks to keep my productivity high. I really enjoy learning new things to keep up with the future and deepen my knowledge to a level where I am able to teach about it.

name: Johann Gyger
bio:
Johann is a passionate software engineer living in Switzerland. He has over 20 years of industry experience working as a developer, architect, trainer, and consultant in various domains and for different customers. Johann is enthusiastic about the cloud-native movement and organizes the Swiss Cloud Native day (https://cloudnativeday.ch) and the Cloud Native Bern Meetup (http://www.cloudnativebern.ch).

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Bringing engineers together at meetups and conferences is a fulfilling and inspirational task. I love to connect with this thriving community on a local and international level. And I would like to raise awareness of environmental sustainability.

name: Johannes Hohlbein
bio: Johannes Hohlbein is a Solution Architect with a strong interest in Cloud Technologies. Apart from that, he is following the development in the world of GitOps and Argo. Most of his projects during his 10+ years experience have been in E-Commerce. Johannes is looking forward to more projects in Kubernetes. He is honoured to be part of the Kubernetes community and being a Kubestronaut.

name: Johannes Kleinlercher
bio: I am an experienced platform engineer (20+ years in complex IT systems) always searching for solutions which could make software delivery and software operations easier. I am a co-organizor of the cloud-native meetup in innsbruck (tyrol). I work with K8s, openshift, argocd, kargo, prometheus, grafana, kyverno, trivy, backstage, k8sgpt, ... and many more other technologies. My passion is also the socio-technical topics around platforms like TeamTopologies and love the book Platform Strategies by Gregor Hohpe.

name: Johannes Wetzel
bio: Reality is fluid and malleable. DevOps Engineer - Kubernetes, Linux, Strimzi Kafka, Cilium, GitOps ..multi-intrested, always learning, with a strong passion for complexity, mutual support and cooperation

name: John A. Rodriguez Ortiz
bio: My name is John A. Rodriguez Ortiz and I am a Platform Engineer in Austin, TX. I specialize in AWS cloud and the path to production. I am skilled in multiple CNCF technologies such as Kubernetes, Flux, Helm, Istio, Harbor and Paketo Buildpacks to name a couple.

name: John Funk
bio: DevOps Engineer - I enjoy working with Kubernetes and its rich ecosystem because it provides a powerful, flexible, and scalable way to manage containerized applications. From deploying workloads with Helm and ArgoCD to optimizing resource allocation and securing clusters, I appreciate the balance between automation and fine-grained control. Kubernetes extensibility, combined with tools like Traefik, GitOps workflows, and cloud-native storage solutions, makes it an exciting and ever-evolving space to work in.

name: John Mccarthy
bio: MidActs Bible believing Platform Engineer from Chattanooga, TN

name: Jokūbas Mordas
bio: I am an experienced IT professional with a passion for DevOps culture. Committed to making an impact through mentoring and empowering those around me. I strive to foster a collaborative and innovative environment where everyone can thrive. Keep Improving!

name: Jon Zeolla
bio:
Jon Zeolla is the founder of Zenable, where they are revolutionizing corporate governance by integrating cloud-native security and compliance with artificial intelligence. Previously he co-founded Seiso where he received the 2021 Start-Up Innovator of the Year Award and currently serves as strategic advisor, guiding key business decisions and company growth.

He is also a CNCF Ambassador, SANS Instructor for SEC540: Cloud Security and DevSecOps Automation, and an active member of CNCF TAG Security.

name: Jonah Kowall
bio: Jonah Kowall, computer scientist and open-source advocate. As a member of the founding team and technical leadership committee for OpenSearch a Linux Foundation project, Maintainer of Jaeger a CNCF graduated project for distributed tracing. Contributor to OpenTelemetry. A technical leader across startups and large enterprises specialized in operations, security, and performance. Led Gartner research on monitoring. Product leadership at AppDynamics, Cisco (post-acquisition), Kentik, Logz.io, Aiven, and is currently the Senior Vice President product and design at Paessler, the monitoring company.

name: Jonas Dale Fredriksen
bio: I am Jonas. I am a cloud engineer with a passion for cloud technology, containerization and security. I tried out Kubernetes and found it fascinating and wanted to master it.

name: Jonas Felix
bio: Jonas started his journey into the world of Open Source in 1998 with a simple Linux CD as a portal to wonder and creativity. Since then he has been active in coding and OS community: namely PowerCoders (empowering refugees), Basler Linux User Group, CCC Basel, elected TYPO3 Expert Advisory Board member, Angular Meetup Organizer etc. Besides coding he built several ventures as entrepreneur but as his heart is with technology, he focusses on his passion of teaching and inspiring for Open Source. As of 2024 he taught close to 1000 engineers during in person courses on Kubernetes and Cloud Native related topics.

name: Jonas Råberg
bio: I’m an experienced engineer, passionate about cloud computing, container-based solutions, Kubernetes, and infrastructure as code (IaC). I strive to build maintainable, robust solutions that can easily adapt to evolving demands through automation and infrastructure as code.

name: Joo Young Kim
bio: Hi, I’m Joo Young Kim. I studied and met my wife in the U.S., worked in South Korea for a few years, and followed my wife to Singapore. Now, I work at Singapore Airlines, mostly working with Cloud technologies with great colleagues. I'm passionate about technology, solving complex problems, and challenging and improving the status quo.

name: Jooho Lee
bio: Jooho Lee is a DevOps Engineer at SI Analytics, where he focus on building and operating infrastructure for AI R&D and model serving platforms. He is passionate about site reliability engineering (SRE), infrastructure as code (IaC), and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.

name: Joohwan Kim
bio: hello. I work as a security engineer, specializing in cloud services and Kubernetes. I have built 3rd-party security solutions based on CNCF's various security platforms and am currently working on the latest trends, DevSecOps and Zero Trust-based solutions.

name: Jordi Sensada Torres
bio: DevOps Engineer with a passion for Kubernetes and any kind of cloud technology since the beginning of my career. Currently employed as a Build Engineer, facilitating and optimizing CI processes.

name: Jorge Andrade
bio: As the Co-Founder of ITM in Guatemala and El Salvador, I am actively engaged in a variety of roles related to open-source technologies, serving as a user, speaker, instructor, contributor, and sponsor. My areas of expertise include Ansible, Kubernetes, and Linux—tools that are essential to my work. I am passionate about contributing to the community, whether it's through delivering training sessions, conducting workshops, or organizing meetups. I am committed to sharing valuable insights, tips, and lessons learned from my experiences to help others excel in this field.

name: Jorge O. Castro
bio: Jorge (@castrojo) is a Developer Relations specialist at the CNCF, with a focus on improving developer experience and communities. Jorge graduated with a degree in Telecommunications from Michigan State University and rode with the 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment for four years. He has contributed to Kubernetes, Ubuntu, Kubeflow, and the Cloud Custodian open source projects. He now resides in Ann Arbor, Michigan with his lovely wife Jill, their son Rafael, and their beagle Oscar. Hobbies and interests include heavy metal, passport renewal, paleontology, gaming, technology, and scouting out the best beers in the world.

name: Jorge Tapicha
bio: With extensive experience as an SRE engineer, I have a deep passion for DevOps, Kubernetes, and CNCF technologies. I have a strong focus on troubleshooting systems and building resilient infrastructure, improving system stability, and preparing organizations for future challenges through innovative chaos engineering methodologies. I specialize in CNCF tools like OpenTofu for managing Infrastructure as Code (IaC), the Argo ecosystem for enhancing deployment flexibility and developer experience, Istio for implementing service mesh architectures, and OpenTelemetry to ensure vendor-neutral observability systems. While these are my favorites, I actively embrace the entire CNCF ecosystem, which I find incredibly fun and a true work of art.

name: Jorge Turrado Ferrero
bio:
I have been working around software development for more than 6 years. Involving development, infrastructure architecture, monitoring, etc. Currently, I work as SRE at SCRM Lidl International Hub. Also, I have been awarded with Microsoft MVP for 4 years in a row and nowadays, I invest the majority of my free time contributing to KEDA. I'm proud about my puppies and my wife, and I use the rest of the time with them.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The program provides a platform for ambassadors to connect and collaborate with other cloud-native enthusiasts and promote the adoption of cloud-native practices. By becoming a CNCF ambassador, one can contribute to the open-source community and help shape the future of cloud-native computing.

name: Jorian Taks
bio: My name is Jorian Taks, a Cloud Native Consultant and DevOps Engineer. My eagerness to learn, enthusiasm and analytical attitude enables me to quickly master new subjects and tools and apply them in any context. I love diving into complex issues and figuring out abstract situations to achieve a practical solution. I am passionated about DevOps practices and building cloud native solutions.

name: Jorin Vermeulen
bio: I'm an IT-enthusiast with a deep passion for Webdevelopment, Cloud Engineering and Kubernetes. From an early age I've explored the intricacies of computers, building skills in programming, PC building, and server management. Over the years I've managed various servers and developed numerous applications and websites. Currently, my professional focus is at DevOps and Cloud Engineering, with the goal of becoming a Kubernetes specialist.

name: Jose Bañuls Campos
bio: I am a Kubernetes infrastructure architect and RedHat engineer. I specialize in crafting and deploying resilient, scalable infrastructure solutions. On a regular basis I use tecnologies like Contour, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid, Nginx Ingress Controller, Pinniped, Falco and Gatekeeper, among others.

name: Jose Flores
bio:
Jose, a seasoned Senior Site Reliability Engineer and DevOps professional, boasts over 15 years of experience in the IT industry, spanning Software Development, Testing, and Operations. He's successfully overseen complex production infrastructures on AWS for large-scale projects across multiple accounts, streamlining software delivery through the implementation of CICD pipelines. Proficient in a wide range of tools, including Jenkins, CircleCI, GitHub Actions, Docker, JFrog Artifactory, Terraform, Microservices, and AWS, Jose is certified in Infrastructure as Code with Terraform and AWS. His adaptability to emerging technologies and dedication to sharing knowledge have made him a Co-organizer for a Cloud Native Community in El Salvador since 2021, an AWS Community Builder since 2023, and the inaugural Cloud Native Ambassador representing El Salvador. Meetup Organizer Cloud Native San Salvador https://community.cncf.io/san-salvador/ Cloud Native Latam https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-latin-america/ KCD Organizer KCD El Salvador 2023 https://community.cncf.io/kcd-el-salvador/ Speaker KCD Guatemala 2023 KCD Colombia 2023 La Hora de Kubernetes

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF Ambassador ignites my passion for bridging the divide between cloud-native innovations and the broader community. I am wholeheartedly dedicated to not only advocating for CNCF technologies and projects but also making sure that the benefits of cloud-native solutions are universally understood and accessible. My aspiration is to cultivate a more inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are valued, knowledge is shared generously, and the full potential of open source is realized. Through organizing meetups, conducting workshops, and engaging directly with the community, I aim to amplify the transformative impact of the cloud-native ecosystem and strengthen the core principles of open collaboration in El Salvador and across LATAM.

name: Jose Javier Acosta Santana
bio: Hi, I'm Jose! I love boosting productivity and automating processes. With a focus on Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, and scalable cloud infrastructure, I excel at driving efficiency at every stage of the software development lifecycle. Remember, learning never stops! 🚀
location: San Cristóbal de la Laguna, Spain

name: Jose Luis Noriega Gutierrez
bio: Jose is a dedicated consultant specializing in cloud technologies. With a deep passion for containerization and orchestration, Jose focuses on helping clients seamlessly transition to and optimize their operations in the cloud. A lifelong learner, he continually seeks to expand his knowledge and stay at the forefront of industry advancements.

name: Joseph Holmes
bio: Experienced IT professional focused on cloud, DevOps, and Site Reliability Engineering. My focus on automating repeatable tasks has not only minimized risk but has also boosted efficiencies across teams, aligning with my Team Leadership skills. I've introduced SRE concepts like SLIs, SLOs, and Error Budgets, ensuring our engineering practices are both robust and reliability-centric.

name: Joseph Ligier
bio: I began my IT career as a Linux SysAdmin specializing in deployment. In 2015, everything changed when I discovered Docker, igniting my passion for containerization. I learned Kubernetes and passed the CKA certification in 2020. Currently, I’m an enthusiast of Cilium CNI, have collaborated on the Cilium certification (CCA) and i created an OpenTofu provider for deploying Cilium in Kubernetes. I'm also a Kubestronaut. My blog: https://medium.com/@littel.jo My credly: https://www.credly.com/users/joseph-ligier

name: Joseph Sandoval
bio: Joseph is the Principal Product Manager at Adobe, leading the Ethos platform team focused on developer experience with cloud-native infrastructure, traffic engineering, and API gateways. His expertise has directly supported thousands of developers in creating scalable and resilient applications. With over a decade of deep involvement in the Kubernetes and cloud-native ecosystems, Joseph currently serves as a Release Manager Associate within SIG-Release and has been a part of six Kubernetes release teams. Beyond his technical contributions, Joseph is dedicated to fostering diversity in tech. He actively mentors individuals from underrepresented groups, guiding them toward successful careers in open-source and technology sectors.

name: Joseph Villarreal Lopez
bio: I'm Cloud, engineer, specializing in Google cloud platform with some experience Kubernetes

name: Josh Gavant
bio:
Josh is passionate about enabling project builders and end users to succeed with cloud computing. He's a solution architect for Red Hat and leader of CNCF's TAG App Delivery and WG Platforms. He also leads the CNCF Chicago community group and other Chicago-area groups. Check out Josh's blog at https://blog.joshgav.com/!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to continue enabling beginners and experts alike to make the most of cloud computing! As an ambassador I'll be even more empowered to educate and support Chicago-area developers in our local communities. I'm looking forward to sharing knowledge myself, but most of all I'm looking forward to enabling people in my communities to share their knowledge with each other!

name: Joshua Leuenberger
bio: I have a background in server virtualization and always used Kubernetes as a control plane for my automation. Moving into an architecture position in Observability I started to specialize in Prometheus. Not much after I started to write several Kubernetes Operatots and developing our platform based fully on Kubernetes. Now I am Business Lead Kubernetes and work tightly with Capsule, Cilium, Kyverno and Crossplane on a daily basis. My main business besides owning the k8s platform is onboarding of new teams into our custom cloud using Crossplane as our daily driver.

name: Joshua Taylor
bio: Experienced Devops Engineer working with Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD, and various cloud deployments throughout AWS, GCP, & Azure. I enjoy working on projects in Go and Rust. Outside of work, I love learning C++ and C# for video game development in Unreal Engine and Unity.

name: Josua Castro
bio: Passionate about technological projects and challenges, I have delved into the world of CNCF through open-source projects and explored new technological areas. I hold certifications in CKA, CKAD, CKS, KCNA, and KCSA.

name: José Marques
bio: DevOps Engineer fascinated by tech and cloud-native solutions! Currently on a mission to create a seamless and painless platform for running and migrating our workloads to Kubernetes. 🚀🧑‍🚀

name: José Ureba Camacho
bio: Driven by a naturally curious mind, I am a cloud-native enthusiast specializing in CNCF technologies, with expertise in Kubernetes, observability, and security. I am dedicated to building secure and scalable cloud-native applications and infrastructure, with a strong commitment to DevOps practices and seamless automation. Beyond technology, I have a deep passion for music, cinema, and literature.

name: Jothimani Radhakrishnan
bio: I am a Platform Engineer with over 9 years of experience, deeply passionate about cloud technologies. My expertise spans across various aspects of cloud engineering, and I proudly identify as a Cloud enthusiast. Alongside my engineering career, I am an active Blogger, where I share insights on DevOps, SRE, and Python development. I also frequently speak at community meetups, including AWS User Groups and CNCF KUL gatherings.

name: João Senerchia
bio: I like to break stuff.
location: São Paulo State of São Paulo, Brazil

name: Joël Traber
bio: With over 20 years of experience in software engineering, I am a motivated and results-oriented team player who enjoys a hands-on approach. I am particularly enthusiastic about distributed systems, especially the Kubernetes orchestration technology. Additionally, I have a strong background in automation with various technologies.

name: Joël Van Der Voort Van Der Kleij
bio: Driven Linux and open source enthusiast. Strong background in operations on the ISP level. Well versed in automation. My latest fixation is container technology and GitOps. In my time off I read books, play computer games and enjoy weightlifting.

name: Juan Carlos Coto Sanchez
bio: It all started about seven years ago when a professor in the first university class I ever took taught us about Linux. I still remember his words: "I should be teaching you other stuff according to the schedule, but instead, I will teach you something that is worth learning." Since then, it's been so much fun that I keep learning and learning. I have worked in a variety of technical roles providing support, technical consultancy, and automation. I have a passion for cloud-native technologies and experience in Kubernetes, containers, IaC, service mesh, cloud, and recently, CNAPP.

name: Juan Carlos Salvador Garcia
bio: I'm a passionate about technology, innovation and always motivated to get new knowledge. I always enjoy researching topics about cloud, architecture, devops, cloud native, Kubernetes and observability. I have the KCNA, KCSA, CKAD,CKA, CKS, AZ-700, AZ-305 certifications.
company: Banco de Crédito del Perú - BCP

name: Juan Felipe Reyes Marlés
bio: I am a Lead DevOps Engineer and Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) specializing in AWS, Azure, Infrastructure as Code, and Kubernetes. I thrive on tackling intricate challenges by crafting and integrating cutting-edge solutions within the CNCF ecosystem. My passion lies in pushing the boundaries of what's possible in cloud-native technologies.

name: Juan González
bio: Lead Platform Engineer for Heimdall, Novo Nordisk's Internal Developer Platform! 🥷🏼 I'm truly passionate about Information Security and Platform Engineering. I specialize in building scalable and secure platforms on top of Kubernetes, Crossplane, and many other CNCF tools. Follow our adventures at https://medium.com/the-heimdall-platform/ When I'm not coding, I enjoy scuba diving and fidgeting with my homelab!

name: Juan Jose Garcia
bio: Humble and grateful engineer. I love to take mate while working :)

name: Juan José Ruiz Romero
bio: I’m a tech enthusiast and a lifelong Nintendo fan with a passion for Kubernetes, distributed systems, and programming. I thrive on solving technical challenges and building innovative solutions in the cloud-native ecosystem, combining robust infrastructure with clean, efficient code. Outside of tech, I enjoy staying active through sports, always striving to maintain a healthy balance between my work and hobbies.

name: Julia Furst Morgado
bio:
Julia Furst Morgado is a Global Technologist - Office of the CTO at Veeam Software. With over five years of experience in the industry, her focus is on simplifying Cloud Native technologies by sharing her expertise and experiences. She is also committed to empowering communities as the organizer of the NY Code & Coffee Meetup and KubeHuddle conference, and by being an AWS Community Builder, a Women Techmakers Ambassador and a Girl Code Ambassador.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I strongly believe in raising awareness about how people can help the CNCF community beyond just coding, and encourage more individuals to get involved in whatever capacity they can. I am excited to produce content, promote cloud native technologies, participate in major events, and connect with global communities.

name: Juliano Costa
bio:
Juliano is a passionate Software Engineer/Developer Advocate with extensive experience in cloud-related technologies. He is specialized in OpenTelemetry and is always working with Kubernetes, Helm, Containers, Jenkins, and other related tools. As one of the maintainers of the CNCF project OpenTelemetry Demo, Juliano has helped to create a distributed system that demonstrates the implementation of OpenTelemetry in a near real-world environment. With a strong belief in the power of community, Juliano co-founded the Cloud Native Linz meetup. He actively participates in the tech community and is always willing to share his knowledge and insights with others. When not working, Juliano likes to spend his time with the family traveling around Austria and sightseeing new places.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I strongly believe in the power of the community and how it can help everyone grow, not just professionally, but as a whole. I'm extremely excited about being able to help growing the CNCF community and raising it awareness wherever I go. I love learning and sharing what I learn. The atmosphere and environment of openness created by CNCF is something that I take with me in every interaction I have. I'm super excited and thankful in becoming a CNCF Ambassador.

name: Julien Sudan
bio: I am Julien Sudan, a Site Reliability Engineer with extensive experience in architecting secure, scalable cloud infrastructures and implementing DevSecOps and SRE practices. Currently working at Exoscale in Switzerland, I excel in using technologies like Kubernetes, and IaC to optimize cloud deployments across environment, whether on premise or in the Cloud. I actively contribute to the cloud-native community by sharing insights through presentations at conferences and wrote articles on different blogs. My technical proficiency and commitment to continuous learning are demonstrated by a comprehensive suite of certifications, including CISSP, Kubestronaut, and several cloud-specific credentials..

name: Julio Tencio Coto
bio: I am a passionate self-learner who began my tech journey as a network engineer before transitioning to Linux system administration, working with both physical and virtual machines. My interest in containers sparked a new passion, leading me to dive deeper into cloud-native technologies. Earning CNCF certification opened up exciting professional opportunities, allowing me to work on the cutting edge of technology and innovation.

name: Junhee Park
bio: Junhee Park is a cloud native leader at Winitech, specializing in emergency reporting systems and disaster safety solutions for public institutions. With experience as a platform architect researcher in San Diego, USA, and Daegu, South Korea, he leverages his expertise as a Cloud Native engineer, focusing on Kubernetes and MSA architecture to design safe and efficient systems. Dedicated to building robust and reliable infrastructures, he actively explores innovative approaches to cloud-native technologies. He also shares his knowledge on his tech blog at devlos.tistory.com, covering topics like Kubernetes, cloud engineering, and modern software architecture.

name: Junichi Miyagawa
bio: I work as an IT infrastructure architect and Scrum Master. I have expertise in AWS, Azure, CloudNativeSecurity, Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code(AWS CDK) and Platform Engineering.

name: Junya Okabe
bio: He is passionate about cloud native technologies, especially Kubernetes, and is a professional in this field. He leads the localization of Kubernetes and CNCF documentation as a localization approver in SIG-Docs and a reviewer for several projects. Additionally, he is an active OSS contributor to Kubernetes and related projects. To encourage more people to join the community, he is part of the organizer team for Kubernetes Upstream Training. (Related blog post: https://kubernetes.io/blog/2024/10/28/k8s-upstream-training-japan-spotlight/ )

name: Junyeong Jang
bio: My name is Junyeong Jang, and I am a developer at BespinGlobal. I am passionate about leveraging Cloud Native technologies and artificial intelligence to create innovative and efficient software solutions. With a focus on continuous improvement, I aim to develop scalable systems that drive both performance and user experience.

name: Junyong Jang
bio: I am a DevOps/SRE engineer specializing in architecting and operating high-performance IT services. With expertise in modern cloud infrastructure and automation technologies, I excel at building and maintaining resilient systems that scale. My focus lies in implementing efficient CI/CD pipelines, optimizing service reliability, and continuously enhancing operational efficiency through sophisticated monitoring and incident response strategies.

name: Juraci Paixao Kröhling
bio:
I'm a software engineer building telemetry tools. I'm active in the OpenTelemetry community and have been one of the Jaeger project maintainers in the past, having also contributed to OpenTracing. I also love to spread knowledge about the tools I work with, having had the pleasure of speaking at KubeCon (EU and NA), OpenSource Summit (EU and NA), FOSDEM, Devoxx, among others. And more recently, I started a side project called Dose de Telemetria, where I create deeply technical content related to observability, monitoring, and telemetry in my native language, Portuguese.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Recognizing that language might be a barrier for people to understand the CNCF ecosystem and projects, I will focus on sharing knowledge in Portuguese. I'm also looking forward to fostering the ecosystem around our observability tooling, with a particular focus on OpenTelemetry but not limited to it.

name: Justin Cormack
bio: Justin is the CTO at Docker. He is passionate about software development, security, and the open source community.

name: Justin Dustzadeh
bio:
Justin Dustzadeh is the Chief Technology Officer at Equinix. In this role, Justin drives the company’s technology vision, strategy and architecture as well as the overall technical innovation and focus on software transformation and engagement within the developer community, including within the Linux Foundation.

Justin is an industry-recognized thought leader on cloud-native technologies and software-defined infrastructure and has a wealth of executive and technical leadership experience, including leadership roles at Uber (where he served as Head of Global Network & Software Platform), Visa, Huawei, Ericsson, AT&T, a technology startup which he co-founded, and two leading service providers in France.

He holds a Ph.D. and M.S. in Computer Science from Télécom Paris, and a B.S. in Theoretical Physics from École Normale Supérieure (Ulm) in Paris.

name: Justin Gilley
bio: I enjoy the continual process of rethinking technology to produce better software. Kubernetes is not just a container orchestration tool; Kubernetes is also a philosophy around how to build software for production. As a person who graduated with a degree in philosophy and later transitioned into tech, I appreciate technologies such as Kubernetes that envision a better future by rethinking the status quo.

name: Justin Lex-Hammarskjöld
bio: Justin is a passionate Cloud/On-Prem Architect with in-depth experience in cloud architecture, cybersecurity, DevOps, and software development. He works as a DevOps consultant based in Stockholm, with a specialization in Kubernetes and other Cloud-Native technologies. Justin is also involved in helping to organize the Cloud-Native Community meetups in Stockholm, and occasionally gives talks. He enjoys the rapid pace that the Cloud-Native community has been building new technologies for the future, and is excited every year to see where Cloud-Native will go next.

name: Justin Neubert
bio: I'm an system engineer, monitoring enthusiast and open source contributor by building own open source platforms. Running own kubernetes clusters was always a thing for me even though I didn't think I would get there when I first discovered containers. Today I build own applications and scale them high available up in Kubernetes.

name: Justin Poort
bio: I’m an passionated DevOps engineer who is currently working as an consultant. My specialty is Kubernetes but I also love working with almost everything that is IaC related.

name: Juwon Ok
bio: Hello, I’m a Technical Architecture with more than 15 years of experience in IT. As a Cloud Architect at Cloud Division, I design a Cloud System using Kubernetes. I’m interested in Site reliability and application design in cloud environments ~~ continuously improving my skills to work with related technology stacks in CNCF.

name: Jérémy Albrecht
bio: I'm Jérémy, a former backend developer who has transitioned into the dynamic world of DevOps Engineering. I weave together Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker, Infrastructure as Code, Ansible and automation to create seamless, efficient solutions.

name: Jérôme Masson
bio: I began my career as a consultant, specializing in helping clients transition to digital platforms. My journey into cloud-native technologies started in 2017 with Docker and Kubernetes, and has since evolved to include open-source software within the CNCF Landscape. As a consultant with expertise in platform engineering projects, I am passionate about sharing my knowledge at conferences such as Devoxx FR, KCD France, and DevFest Nantes.

name: Kacper Lipka
bio: I'm a DevOps Cloud engineer with an interest in machine learning and automating everything I can. I specialize in cloud technologies, Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD and container orchestration. I want to constantly develop and seek new experiences. Discovering CNCF tools allows me to do just that.

name: Kai Fink
bio: I'm a system engineer and software developer, with a main focus on container environments. Currently building the managed K8S product & services @ SVA

name: Kai Genegabus
bio: Simple Cloud engineer. Enjoys Kubernetes.

name: Kaivalya Shah
bio: I am a DevOps consultant who specializes in Kubernetes, GCP, and AWS. I love to automate and codify as much as I can with any tools at hand. As an active member of many cloud communities and conferences, I love to discuss technical ideas and news. If I start talking about football or chess, I can't promise I will stop!

name: Kaiwalya Koparkar
bio:
I am a Computer Engineering student from India. I passionately advocate open source and tech. I am lead of cloud-native community group Nashik. I also run a blog site and youtube channel to educate people and students about CNCF tooling. http://community.cncf.io/nashik/ https://blogs.kaiwalyakoparkar.com/ https://youtube.com/@kaiwalya_koparkar

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador as it will help me reach out to more students and student communities and help them get their first steps into cloud-native. I believe students can bring much more value to the cloud native ecosystem and being a CNCF ambassador will enable me introduce more students to the ecosystem.
company: R. H. Sapat College of Engineering

name: Kaiwen Yang
bio: I am a product manager and have been engaged in the cloud native field for five years. I have a strong passion for cloud native technologies and open source contribution. I am a contributor of Kubernetes(SIG Docs), OpenKruise and KubeWharf. Beside the cloud native technology, my hobbies are marathon running and trail running, and have completed three times of 50km trail running.

name: Kannan N
bio: I’m Kannan, an experienced software engineer and cloud-native enthusiast with over a decade of innovation in the tech industry. My expertise as a DevOps engineer and cloud architect allows me to design and manage scalable, resilient, and efficient digital ecosystems. With a deep mastery of Kubernetes, I’ve helped organizations streamline operations and optimize cloud-native infrastructure. My passion for automation and cloud technologies drives me to constantly improve system performance and ensure high availability.

name: Karen Chu
bio:
Karen Chu is an Apple OSPO PM focused on Swift language community initiatives. Having participated in the cloud native community since 2015, she is a CNCF Ambassador, Helm community manager/maintainer, emeritus Kubernetes Code of Conduct Committee member, meet-up organizer, and conference organizer. She has also worked on The Illustrated Children’s Guide to Kubernetes book series. When she’s not connecting dots in the community, you can find her pursuing photography, cooking, and sipping on chai lattes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having help build this community since 2015, I'm fascinated by how far the ecosystem has come and how much further it can go. I'm extremely excited to see CNCF participate in new spaces and so with my continued work as a CNCF Ambassador, I look forward to helping bridge the gap between the cloud native and Webassembly communities.

name: Karen Kostanyan
bio: I am a DevOps engineer specializing mostly in AWS and everything around Kubernetes, Have an adorable son and a beautiful family. Love swimming and skiing.

name: Karena Angell
bio: Karena Angell is a member of the CNCF Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and was a Technical Lead for the CNCF Technical Advisory Group (TAG) App Delivery. She is also a Senior Principal Technical Product Manager at Red Hat focused on upstream projects, including Kubernetes. She has a broad background within various disciplines including Product Management, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Solution design and management, Marketing, IT Service Management and technical community building. She has also worked extensively within Commercial and Government enterprises. These experiences give her a unique understanding of how to guide strategic efforts to engage community members and drive increased CNCF involvement.

name: Karim Arous
bio: DevSecOps Engineer Location: Paris, France Project Experience: Kubernetes, Argo, Helm, Artifact Hub, Cert-manger, KEDA, External DNS, Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog, Kyverno With a passion for automating and optimizing development and operations, I specialize in implementing cutting-edge DevOps practices and cloud solutions. My expertise includes CI/CD, cloud infrastructure across AWS or Azure and leveraging tools like Docker and Kubernetes for efficient deployment. Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Since the beginning of my career, I always try to share knowledge with teammates or even my friends. Being an ambassador will help me reach more people around the world since sharing is caring. Just remember, together we rise

name: Karim Benmalek
bio: I am a cloud native engineer with 4 years of experience, passionate about CNCF technologies and the Kubernetes ecosystem. I enjoy exploring related projects such as Helm, Argo, Kubeflow, and Crossplane to enhance my skills and knowledge. I focuse on designing scalable and resilient applications, as well as automating infrastructure deployment. My dedication to learning and improving makes me a reliable contributor to any cloud-native development team.

name: Karol Szymanowski
bio: I am a Senior Software Engineer specializing in TypeScript, AWS, and Kubernetes. My work revolves around designing scalable and secure web applications. Passionate about DevSecOps, I thrive on automating processes and I am a strong advocate for "self-driving" infrastructure.

name: Kashi Viswanathan
bio: I have expertise in various cloud and related technologies, including but not limited to Azure, Kubernetes, and Terraform. I work in a Cloud Engineering Team, maintaining a critical pension administration system, ensuring seamless operations with a focus on availability and scalability. Passionate about continuous learning, I am always eager to explore new technologies and further enhance my skills.

name: Kashif Karim
bio: As a DevOps engineer with a passion for cloud-native technologies, I've spent the past few years honing my skills in deploying and managing applications. My recent collaboration with a government organization involved transitioning their applications from Docker Compose to Kubernetes, optimizing their infrastructure for scalability and reliability. Alongside my professional endeavors, I'm committed to mentoring and guiding individuals on the CNCF certification path, helping them navigate the complexities of cloud-native environments with ease. While I don't run Meetups or maintain a personal blog, I'm always eager to share my knowledge and experience with others in the community.

name: Kaslin Fields
bio:
Kaslin Fields is a Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, CNCF Ambassador, and a contributor to Open Source Kubernetes. She is passionate about making Cloud Native technology exciting and fun to learn for everyone from seasoned pros to total newcomers. In addition to her work supporting the development of cloud native technologies as a contributor, she also aims to spread the word about this awesome field by producing talks, videos, blogs, documentation, comics, and more.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The Cloud Native ecosystem is active and growing, which can make it difficult for community members building awesome things to get the support they need. As an ambassador, I am passionate about providing support to folks building their own Cloud Native communities, technologies, and more.

name: Kasper Borg Nissen
bio:
Co-founder of the Nordic meetup alliance, Cloud Native Nordics, where he also organize the Aarhus group, and tries to help the nordic community as much as possible, e.g. setting up KCDs and more. Kasper also serves as Co-Chair for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon EU/NA 2024/2025. He works as a Developer Relations Engineer at Dash0, previously at Lunar where he in the past has shared many experiences with Cloud Native tech at meetups and conferences. Kasper wrote his master thesis, “KubeCloud - A Small Scale Cloud Computing Environment”, on how Universities could leverage small-scale cloud environments built out of Raspberry Pis running Kubernetes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador, because it's a great community of like-minded people. I hope to meet and learn from the other awesome Ambassadors, and help grow the adoption of Cloud Native technologies even more here in the Nordics.

name: Kasun Rathnayaka
bio: Principal Engineer | Cloud Architect | Devops practitioner

name: Kate Qiu
bio:
Kate is an Event Planner at The Linux Foundation, helping with the fulfillment of sponsorship benefits for Kubecon + CloudNativeCon events.

Prior to her role at LF, Kate worked as a Marketing Operations Assistant for China Telecom Americas where she was responsible for their industry conference and tradeshow planning and logistics.

name: Kateryna Firoozi
bio: Kateryna is an SRE/DevOps engineer with a deep passion for security and cloud-native technologies. She holds a Master’s degree in Information Security and brings over 10 years of experience in helping development teams accelerate secure and efficient product development using modern developer platforms.

name: Katie Gamanji
bio:
Katie is a cloud native leader, practitioner, and contributor, currently in a Senior Kubernetes Field Engineer role at Apple and a TOC for CNCF. As a cloud platform engineer, Katie has built the infrastructure for Conde Nast and American Express, gravitating towards cloud-native technologies, principles, and Kubernetes as the focal point. At CNCF (Cloud Native Computing Foundation), she was a Technical Oversight Committee member and led the CNCF End User Community. At present, Katie advises the Keptn startup and holds the Chief of Future Founders Officer (CFFO) position at OpenUK.

Recently, Katie released the Cloud Native Fundamentals course and led the creation of the CNCF KCNA (Kubernetes and Cloud Native Associate) certification. Additionally, Katie is an active keynote public speaker, a #TechWomen100 winner, and a strong advocate for women in STEM.

name: Katie Greenley
bio: Katie joined #teamcloudnative in 2015 as an Event Manager at The Linux Foundation. She was one of the lead producers for CNCF's cornerstone events, KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, and supported CNCF's third-party event engagements. With over 15 years of experience in event and community management and ten years in open source, Katie made a career change in 2022, joining the CNCF team full-time to lead community programs and marketing initiatives within CNCF.

name: Kaung Htet Aung
bio: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer and open source enthusiast working with cloud-native technologies across on-premise and cloud platforms to build reliable systems. Passionate about cloud technologies and infrastructure challenges.

name: Kaur Kallas
bio: I have specialized on Kubernetes and the surrounding open-source technologies. Always prefer to take a cloud-agnostic approach, using operators like building blocks to solve problems with a emphasis on 2nd day operations. Big fan of Pulumi, Crossplane, and Argo projects

name: Keba Stalin Britto J
bio: I am an open-source enthusiast and cloud-native architect with a deep passion for CNCF technologies. I enjoy exploring cutting-edge CNCF tools, and my enthusiasm for Kubernetes runs deep. I specialize in designing scalable, resilient cloud architectures and contributing to open-source projects, all within an architecture predominantly based on open-source and Kubernetes, adopting the DevOps culture.

name: Keith Chan
bio: Keith (Chan Chak Fai) has been in IT industry for more than 20 years. He is born in HK and holds an MBA degree from UK. He started his IT journey from involving in IP stack network to focusing on IT security solution since 1997. He has been helping a lot of Enterprise in Asia Pacific to deploy security solution around the globe. Since 2009, he has also stepped into particularly Open Source Area. He has helped a lot of companies in Greater China for a better open source management and strategy, which covers Government, Banking and Finance, High Tech. He has successfully helped more than 40+ overseas companies to introduce their latest technology in Asia Pacific, as being the General Manager in Greater China. He is now the Director of Strategic Planning of The Linux Foundation APAC, helping The Linux Foundation to promote open source in Greater China.

name: Kemila De Silva
bio:
An experienced DevOps Engineer with a solid background spanning over 5 years, specializing in CNCF (Cloud Native Computing Foundation) technologies. I've excelled in developing and implementing robust infrastructures for seamless application deployment, with a focus on optimizing availability through industry best practices. Additionally, actively contribute to the CNCF community by organizing significant events like KCD Sri Lanka 2022, KCD Sri Lanka 2023, and hosting monthly Kubernetes Sri Lanka live streams on YouTube, fostering knowledge sharing and keeping professionals updated with the latest advancements in cloud-native technologies.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Each ambassador may have their unique reasons for their excitement, but the chance to influence, connect, contribute, and learn often serves as significant driving forces behind their enthusiasm for taking on this role.

name: Kensei Nakada
bio: Kensei Nakada is a software engineer, passionate about CloudNative tech. He's a long-time Kubernetes contributor, mainly focusing on the scheduler as a SIG-Scheduling approver, and has led many major enhancements.

name: Kenta Asamura
bio: Kenta is a Cloud Support Engineer and Subject Matter Expert in container services, specializing in IaC, CI/CD, and container technologies. Leveraging this expertise alongside his background in Software Development Engineering and practical DevOps implementation, he adeptly handles comprehensive solutions from IaC-based infrastructure to continuous container deployment, running containers securely and efficiently. Kenta accelerates organizations' cloud transformation, utilizing cutting-edge technologies. Passionate about education, he has delivered tech presentations at high schools in Dublin, inspiring future technologists.

name: Kenta Goto
bio: I am an ISV/SaaS Solutions Architect at AWS Japan. As our customers have been using Kubernetes projects for their production workloads, I have been learning cloud native technologies for a couple of years to support them. Additionally, I am particularly interested in Platform Engineering.

name: Kenta Tada
bio:
Kenta Tada has worked as a Linux engineer and team lead for various organizations, specializing in Linux kernel tracing technologies and eBPF. He has contributed to the Linux kernel and the BPF Compiler Collection (BCC) to enhance kernel tracing infrastructure. He has also contributed to several CNCF-related projects, including serving as a reviewer for the system validator used in kubeadm preflight checks.

In 2023, he reviewed the Japanese translation of Learning eBPF, published by O'Reilly Japan. In 2024, he became an organizer of Cloud Native Community Japan (CNCJ), fostering open source culture in Japan. Additionally, he served as Co-Chair of KubeDay Japan 2024, playing a key role in shaping the event and promoting cloud-native technologies within the Japanese developer community.

Recognizing the growing importance of eBPF in cloud-native environments, Kenta founded the eBPF Japan Community for engineers across various industries to collaborate, share knowledge, and drive eBPF adoption in Japan.

name: Kerem İzgöl
bio: I graduated from Doğuş University in the Department of Control and Automation Engineering. I have worked in industrial automation and digital marketing companies. In 2017, my book titled “Herkes İçin Tinylab ve Arduino” (Tinylab and Arduino for Everyone) was published by Abaküs Kitap. I am currently working as a DevOps engineer in a software company.

name: Kevin (Zefeng) Wang
bio: Kevin Wang has been an outstanding contributor in the CNCF community since its beginning and is the leader of the cloud native open source team at Huawei. Kevin has contributed critical enhancements to Kubernetes, led the incubation of the KubeEdge, Volcano, Karmada projects in CNCF, actively participated in the TOC, and played a critical role in building and supporting the growth of CNCF technologies and the CNCF community in the globe.

name: Kevin Evans
bio: Kevin Evans is a Senior Technical Specialist at Microsoft, focusing on Azure solutions with over 25 years of experience in the technology sector. He is the founder of the Code to Cloud community, dedicated to advancing cloud-native practices in Western Canada. As a recognized thought leader, Kevin also serves as the chapter lead for the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) in Calgary, Alberta. Where he actively supports the cloud community. Through his expertise in architecture and technical engineering, he is committed to empowering businesses with secure, scalable cloud solutions. Kevin also hosts the Code to Cloud podcast, sharing insights and fostering knowledge sharing across the cloud technology space. Website: codetocloud.io

name: Kevin Tijssen
bio: Kevin Tijssen is a Cloud Native Engineer at Fullstaq, specializing in Kubernetes, Infrastructure-as-Code, pipeline automation, and cloud technologies. With a wealth of experience in Cloud Native and DevOps roles, Kevin brings valuable expertise to Fullstaq. He is dedicated to driving cloud-native transformations and enhancing operational excellence.

name: Khaled Taha
bio: I am a skilled DevOps Engineer with expertise in leveraging advanced technologies to enhance system performance and reliability. I specialize in building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and optimizing cloud and container environments. My strong skills in system administration and automation enable me to simplify workflows and foster effective collaboration, driving efficient development and operations.

name: Khalid Shaheen
bio: open source enthusiast

name: Khanh Tran
bio: Khanh is maintainer of the PipeCD project. He is currently employed at CyberAgent Inc, and responsible for the CI/CD system across the organization. As a member of the productivity development team, he is interested in anything that improves development and operations processes, especially cloud-native topics. He is also an organizer at the Cloud Native Community Hanoi, Vietnam.

name: Khayyam Gojayev
bio: I am a passionate DevOps & SRE Engineer with expertise in Kubernetes, Cloud Security, and CI/CD automation. With a deep focus on CNCF technologies, I specialize in multi-cloud architectures, Kubernetes security (CKS, KCSA), and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible). I actively share insights on containerization, GitLab CI/CD, and cloud-native best practices, helping teams build scalable, resilient, and secure systems.

name: Khine Nyo Thant
bio: I am a DevOps Engineer with a developer background, now focusing on cloud-native technologies, Kubernetes, and cloud architecture. I specialize in building scalable, automated, and resilient infrastructure for modern applications. I am particularly interested in Platform Engineering and continuously explore ways to optimize cloud and Kubernetes environments.

name: Khoi Luu
bio: A techie who has been diving into Kubernetes and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP, and Alibaba for over five years, and a big fan of Open Source and Cloud Native solutions.

name: Khushboo Khatter
bio: Hello! I'm Khushboo Khatter, an IT professional with over 8 years of experience. I have a passion for cloud technologies and enjoy exploring cutting-edge CNCF tools. My enthusiasm for Kubernetes runs deep, and I love diving into its complexities. Let's connect on LinkedIn and explore the exciting world of cloud-native technologies together! Feel free to reach out: www.linkedin.com/in/khushbookhatter

name: Kim Iversen
bio: Bergen based DevOps- and Cloud advisor with a deep passion for technology; from high abstractions such as Kubernetes, all the way down to bits and bytes. I love discussing this stuff as well, so hit me up if you want someone to chat or collaborate with!

name: Kim Sondrup
bio: He is a regular attendee at Cloud Native Aalborg and KCD Denmark and a passionate open-source evangelist. He started his journey as a developer and, later, in 2016, began working with Puppet; with that, he learned and enjoyed what would later be known as GitOps while he also experienced working with lots of Yaml and IaC. After that, he noticed that binary artifact distribution and management were an often overlooked field of expertise. That led him to later greenfield Artifactory for a large enterprise and get involved with everything around it, including its newest biggest user, the company's new Kubernetes clusters. A lot of Kubernetes and Cloud Native later, with some added certifications and today, he is an experienced Cloud Native professional and recognised Kubestronaut.

name: Kimi Huang
bio:
Kimi Huang, a Site Reliability Engineer and Cloud Solution Architect with a strong interest in Kubernetes and Public Cloud Technologies.

He is passionate about using cloud-native tools such as Kubernetes, Argo, Helm, Prometheus, and Istio in his daily life. Kimi enjoys making things as automated as possible via Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) concept. He also loves to share how to build a Robust, Scalable, Secured, and Highly Available system in the Public Cloud.

name: Kimihiko Abe
bio: I am conducting research and development on data processing infrastructure leveraging Kubernetes and accelerators such as GPUs and FPGAs.Additionally, I am working on Layer 3 network verification technologies utilizing container-based routing technologies.

name: Kinga F.
bio: Kinga is a Security Engineer specializing in cloud and Kubernetes security, with a strong passion for securing code, workloads, and cloud-native infrastructures. She focuses on implementing secure development practices, protecting containerised environments, and enhancing overall cloud security posture.

name: Kiran Kumar Reddy
bio: DevOps enthusiast with focus on improving the processes and keeping the applications up and running in the production.

name: Kirill Andrienko
bio: Former Microsoft-stack infrastructure (Hyper-V, AD) teamlead eventually turned to the dark side, heard a lil bit of K8s and Linux with security on the first place, prone a bit to over-engineering: 20+ years of IT-experience total - so seen some shings, you know.

name: Kirill Mazurov
bio: Throughout my career as a DevOps/Systems engineer and DBA, I have worked in outsourcing, banking, telecommunications, and gamedev sectors. I have extensive experience in building, migrating, and supporting Microservices and Big Data environments (both on-premises and in the cloud), primarily using Kubernetes, as well as implementing DevOps practices. If you believe I can add value to your company or project, feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn!

name: Kishore Gopalan
bio:
Kishore Gopalan is a seasoned DevSecOps professional with extensive experience in leveraging open-source technologies to build secure, scalable, and efficient solutions.

He holds a strong background in Kubernetes, cloud architecture, and designing robust microservice infrastructures. His expertise spans the entire DevSecOps lifecycle, emphasizing seamless integration of security into development and operational workflows. Passionate about the ever-evolving landscape of cloud-native technologies, he actively follows CNCF developments and project graduations, staying at the forefront of industry advancements.

name: Kisung Yi
bio: Hi, my name is Kisung, and I am a Technical Support Engineer at Datadog. With a deep passion for containerization and Kubernetes technologies, I specialize in helping organizations navigate and succeed in their cloud journeys. I bring extensive experience in CNCF technologies and am dedicated to providing support and guidance to those facing challenges in the cloud. My goal is to empower others to achieve success and innovation in their cloud initiatives.

name: Kohei Ota
bio:
Kohei Ota is a Senior Field Engineer at Apple. He is a CNCF Ambassador and contributes to Kubernetes SIG Docs as the Japanese localization owner in the CNCF communities. He also organizes Docker Meetup Tokyo and CloudNative Days Tokyo; some of the biggest "container/cloud native" communities and conferences in Japan.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I've been involved with local cloud native community based in Japan. Unfortunately not many folks from Japan have tightened relationship with international community. I'm excited to be part of organizers of both sides and would love to help local experts become part of the international community!

name: Koki Jean-David
bio: I am KOKI Jean-David, a DevOps and Cloud specialist with over seven years of experience, passionate about knowledge sharing, algorithms, mathematics, quantum physics, and computer science. Throughout my career, I have led teams and deepened my expertise in container orchestration, containerized environment security, cloud computing, and CI/CD processes. I actively contribute to the cloud-native community and share my insights on my GitLab repositories and on LinkedIn.

name: Kolawole Olowoporoku
bio: I work as a SRE with SEKAI (swiss based startup) prior to joining SEKAI I worked as a Solution Architect with AWS where I worked with startups on several ways of building on AWS. I spend most of my time working across containers, but my philosophy revolves more about buidling cheaply and reliably. I have written several blogs which revolves around this in some way such as, https://thenewstack.io/how-to-run-databases-in-kubernetes/ https://medium.com/@kollzey69/balancing-innovation-and-cost-in-the-cloud-era-rethinking-best-practices-and-the-role-of-3264677ff726 https://techcabal.com/2024/07/29/strategic-tech-choices-a-cost-centric-philosophy-for-ctos/

name: Konstantin
bio: DevOps/SRE professional with over 7 years of experience in Tech

name: Konstantinos Stavropoulos
bio:
I have been working with Containers & other Cloud Native technologies since 2020. I am passionate about Infrastructure-As-Code, Policy-As-Code and actually everything-as-code, as I believe that it helps humans, teams and organizations to operate fast and securely.

At work, I like automating as much as possible -following GitOps practices-, ensuring Supply Chain Security from CI/CD pipelines and IaC to Kubernetes clusters and Containers, and setting up observability tools and alerts. Outside of tech I enjoy hiking, literature, 3D printing, playing the guitar, and being part of Open Source communities - contributing anywhere I can.

name: Koray Oksay
bio: He works at Kubermatic as a Kubernetes Consultant and Trainer to help companies with their cloud-native journey. Before that, he worked for startup and enterprise companies in the advertising, banking, and telecom industries as SysAdmin, Application Admin, DevOps Engineer, and SRE for more than 20 years.

name: Kostiantyn Skraga
