I prioritize security and compliance, integrating best practices into every stage of the infrastructure lifecycle. I specialize in AWS and Azure platforms, focusing on automating deployments and scaling infrastructure to meet the demands of high-traffic environments. My approach is centered on infrastructure as code, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD), ensuring that we can iterate quickly and efficiently while maintaining the highest standards of reliability and security

name: Miguel Angel Vila Huallpa
bio: Graduated in Network Administration, due to unusual circumstances, I ended up working as a developer and sysadmin. Since 2019, I have been working with container technologies. I enjoy automating processes with various tools and configuring monitoring of various platforms and applications.

name: Mihiran Nallamilli
bio: I am an upbeat DevOps Engineer who is eager to work on cutting-edge, creative projects. I have an avid curiosity about solving problems, and I work best in settings that promote teamwork and the creation of innovative solutions. I am committed to promoting efficiency and scalability in contemporary engineering techniques and am passionate about Automation, Cloud Technologies, Kubernetes, Containers, and R&D. I'm constantly looking for ways to contribute to significant developments in DevOps since I'm always excited to be at the forefront of innovative technology.

name: Mikael Johansson Länsberg
bio: Mikael is a Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a passion for Kubernetes, Go (Golang), and OpenStack. He spends a lot of time on the "welding and plumbing" of cloud platforms, crafting robust and resilient systems. Mikael is also the co-organizer of the Gothenburg CNCF meetup.

name: Mike Bowen
bio: Tech Fellow, Senior Principal Engineer, and technology leader responsible for cloud-native technical and solutions architecture. Designs, develops, and maintains the enterprise Kubernetes-based cloud-native platform at BlackRock. Runs the BlackRock Open Source Program Office (OSPO).

name: Mike Smith
bio: Results-oriented DevOps Engineer with a strong foundation in automation and GitOps. Possessing a relentless drive for continuous improvement and a disciplined approach to problem-solving, I excel at building and maintaining reliable, scalable systems. Proven ability to lead and mentor teams while delivering impactful results. In my free time, I write at https://smig.tech

name: Miley Fu
bio:
Miley has extensive experience in DevRel and has worked on the WasmEdge project for over 3 years from its very start. She implements strategies to nurture developer communities, explores content marketing, and engages with devs on the WasmEdge repo to maintain an active/ responsive presence on GitHub. She hosts tech meetups and conferences online and in-person, including OpenSource Fairs, WebAssembly Meetups and Rust language meetups and conferences. Check out the videos of WasmEdge's most recent meetups in Silicon Valley and Singapore: https://github.com/second-state/meetups

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be a CNCF ambassador because I am passionate about running cloud-native technologies workshops and communities and contributing to the ecosystem's growth. Working closely with a supportive community enables me to learn from the experiences of others and share valuable insights. Moreover, being an ambassador provides an excellent platform for WasmEdge to engage with other projects and stay up-to-date on the latest cloud-native advancements. I can not wait to connect with other ambassadors

name: Min Khant Zaw
bio: Open Source Enthusiast and experienced Linux System Administrator specialized in open-source technologies, dedicated to delivering efficient and secure services to the finance and telecom sectors. Focusing on architecting resilient microservices across multiple cloud providers using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and leveraging CNCF's open-source technologies.

name: Ming-Cheng Chuang
bio: I am a cloud-native learner with a strong interest in the Kubernetes ecosystem. I aim to keep exploring this field, learning more and gaining skills in new technologies.

name: Mingqing Li
bio: I have over ten years of experience in operations and maintenance, focusing on cloud computing, microservice architecture, and automation, with a particular emphasis on cloud-native technology. I am skilled at transforming complex business requirements into efficient and reliable architectures, using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to ensure system scalability and high availability. In my spare time, I contribute to open-source projects by adding features and fixing bugs. I also maintain my own development toolkit, https://grpc-kit.com, to simplify project development and delivery. I am committed to continuous learning and innovation to stay at the cutting edge of technology and create value for teams and enterprises.

name: Mingyu Kim
bio: I’m a Cloud Engineer who is a big fan of Honey Butter Chips :) I am currently focused on K8s, IaC, OTel, and Cloud Security!

name: Minsoo Park
bio: My name is Minsoo Park, and I work as a DevOps engineer. I have a strong interest in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. I am focused on optimizing infrastructure and automation to build scalable systems across various cloud environments. I am continually striving for personal growth in my technical skills.

name: Mitchell Murphy
bio: I am a Kubernetes Engineer and Cloud Native Developer specializing in secure distributed systems for military and defense applications. I design and enforce enterprise-scale security policies while leveraging technologies like Cilium, ArgoCD, and FluxCD for GitOps to build scalable, resilient architectures with real-time observability. I leverage ArgoCD for automated deployment across a fleet of clusters, enhanced by Cilium Cluster Mesh for secure multi-cluster connectivity. ArgoCD's SSO integration with Keycloak enables granular RBAC controls, ensuring teams access only their designated workloads (restrict cluster, namespace and verbs). My proficiency in Golang allows me to develop custom tools and operators to further enhance the Kubernetes ecosystem!

name: Márk Sági-Kazár
bio:
Márk is a SWE/SRE from Hungary with years of experience in various Cloud Native technologies as well as contributing to and maintaining Open Source Software. He is one of the core maintainers of Dex, a Cloud Native identity federation solution and a number of Go libraries (Viper being the most prominent among them). Márk also organizes several tech meetups in Hungary (Go Budapest, Kubernetes and Cloud Native Budapest, Microservices Budapest) and regularly appears as a speaker in the region at meetups, workshops, conferences and podcasts. You can occasionally find him posting to his blog (https://sagikazarmark.hu/), but chances are his GitHub profile is more interesting. In his free time, Márk likes riding a bicycle, reading books, but his favorite hobby for more than 20 years has been Hungarian folk dance.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I always liked learning/building new technologies and then sharing the knowledge with others. By working on various Open Source projects for more than a decade I also learned to appreciate the opportunity to learn from people coming from different backgrounds. By being an ambassador I hope that I'll have more opportunities to connect with people, learn from them and maybe share some of my knowledge as well.

I authored multiple books about Kubernetes over the years with the intention to help learners skill up on Kubernetes and find a new career path. I'm proud and excited to be a CNCF ambassador! Being an ambassador allows me to connect more with the community. I would love to share knowledge and learn, and I hope to help others learn about cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes and how Kubernetes serves as the backbone in the age of AI. I will continue to create engaging educational content to help people navigate the complexities of Kubernetes adoption more effectively. I am sharing tech educational content on my YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@CloudMelonVis and on my blog: https://cvisiona.com. And last but not least my favorite Github : https://github.com/cloudmelon, I'm happy to connect!

He is a Release Manager for Kubernetes and has been the Kubernetes 1.21 Release Team Lead. Nabarun has been an active member of 8 releases since 2019. He is an emeritus member of the Kubernetes Code of Conduct Committee. Nabarun continuously mentors newcomers in the community through various means. He has been featured multiple times in the Times of India and other publications for his work in the Kubernetes and Python communities. Nabarun has spoken at multiple KubeCon events in the past, as well as other CloudNative-focused conferences like Kubernetes Community Days.

bio:

In his role, he oversees the development of intellectual property (IP), collaboration with modernization partners, and introduction of new services within the domain of application modernization. The practice led by Naresh takes a prominent role in spearheading application transformation initiatives across diverse industries and service lines. It places particular emphasis on four fundamental pillars of application modernization: Open Source, Agile/DevOps, Legacy modernization, and Cloud.

Over the course of his 29-year career, Naresh has occupied various roles that have encompassed IT services delivery, program management, enterprise architecture, as well as incubating and fostering multiple specialized groups.

Naresh holds a B Tech in Metallurgical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology (BHU) Varanasi, India.

name: Nate Waddington
bio:
Nate is the CNCF's Head of Mentorship and Documentation. He leads the TechDocs team, which includes a group of writers, designers, and web developers. Together, they deliver high-quality documentation that supports the cloud-native ecosystem. Nate and the TechDocs team help CNCF projects organize and write documentation, ensuring clarity, consistency, and accessibility.

Beyond his work in documentation, Nate also oversees the CNCF mentorship programs. Working with the TAG Contributor Strategy Mentoring Working Group, he helps CNCF projects prepare for mentorship programs such as LFX Mentorship, Google Summer of Code, and Outreachy. He also administers CNCF's participation in the LFX Mentorship program, working with the Linux Foundation to foster the growth and development of new contributors.

Before joining CNCF, Nate worked as a Senior Creative Technologist at AKQA, where he helped build, install, and support interactive installations for retail spaces, conferences, and other events. His diverse background includes technical writing, systems administration, and embedded software development roles.

My technical expertise spans across multiple CNCF projects, including Prometheus, Envoy, and Helm. I regularly share my insights and experiences on my blog at www.tanzu.eu, where I explore emerging trends and innovative solutions in the cloud-native ecosystem. Passionate about continuous learning and collaboration, I am excited to contribute to the community as a CNCF Ambassador.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be an Ambassador because it allows me to actively contribute to the growth and development of the cloud-native ecosystem, which I am truly passionate about. This role provides a unique platform to engage with a diverse and talented community, enabling the exchange of knowledge and ideas that drive innovation. Furthermore, being an Ambassador presents the opportunity to mentor and inspire others while learning from the collective experiences of fellow professionals. It is an honor to serve as a bridge between the CNCF and the broader community, fostering collaboration and mutual support.

She has also been featured in Business Insider as one the ‘top 21 developers transforming Silicon Valley’.

Her work focuses on managing cloud resources efficiently as part of the platform engineering team at Grafana Labs and as a co-chair of the CNCF Environmental Sustainability TAG's Green Reviews Working Group.

name: Nimesh Pandeya
bio: Nimesh is a Platform Engineer with over a decade of experience in platform engineering, cloud technologies, and DevSecOps. Specializing in Kubernetes, cloud-native architectures, and Infrastructure as Code, Nimesh has been a key driver of innovation, efficiency, and capability development in various organizations. Nimesh is also a US Army Veteran. Nimesh has deep expertise in security and scalability, Nimesh is passionate about leveraging open-source technologies to build robust, secure, and scalable solutions.

name: Nina Polshakova
bio: Nina is a principal software engineer working on multi-cluster Istio solutions and API Gateways at Solo.io. She has been on the release team for Kubernetes v1.27-v1.31, in roles including the Enhancements team lead and the Release Notes lead. Previously Nina worked at Shape Security preventing malicious automation attacks 🤖.

name: Niranjan Desai
bio: I am a professional DevOps engineer with a strong foundation in Linux, having previously excelled as a cloud engineer and platform engineer. My expertise lies in Kubernetes, where I have extensive experience managing both self-hosted and managed environments.

name: Nitinkumar Ambulgekar
bio: Experienced IT professional with over 14 years of experience in Telecom and networking domain. Over few years I have been involved with baremetal and public cloud based Kubernetes solutions for different cloud native telco and networking applications. I am a technology enthusiast and love to learn new technologies in cloud, networking, cloud native security and DevOps domain. I have also explored other CNCF projects such as Istio, Prometheus, Grafana, Keycloak, cert-manager, etc for building internal platforms for design teams to build robust solutions.

name: Nitish Kumar
bio: Nitish has served as a Linux Foundation Mentee under the Kubernetes Release Engineering Team, where he built a Go library that is used by the Kubernetes project internally. Being passionate about Open Source, he has also contributed to various other projects including Kyverno, Okteto, etcd etc. Nitish has given various talks in the past around cloud-native, DevOps, and Security, one of which he led a panel discussion at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America, 2023 in Chicago. He has also been featured on one of the Veam Podcast Show.

name: Nomeswaran Veligaram
bio: I am a Senior Software Engineer with expertise in Kubernetes and its ecosystem, complemented by strong development skills in Java and Go. I specialize in cloud-native technologies, container orchestration, and building scalable, resilient systems.

name: Nuno Do Carmo
bio:
Known as the Corsair and a massive Windows fan in the Cloud Native community, he set his mission to help running the amazing Cloud Native projects on WSL2 and create "technologically inclusive" blogs at https://wsl.dev. He's also a Tech Writer for SUSE where he contributes to the man OpenSource projects, such as Kubewarden, Epinio, Elemental, Rancher Desktop. His principal traits are that he has 4 cats at home (read: a lot of patience) and provides Swiss chocolate during events (read: community oriented)

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The most important point and motivation is the community! To be able to meet persons from different backgrounds and still share a same passion for Cloud Native ecosystem. And as a "rare" Windows fan in Cloud Native, one of my personal goals is to bring more docs/blogs/talks in running projects on WSL2 and make it even more inclusive for the million of Windows users around the world.

name: Nurudeen Kamilu
bio: Nurudeen Kamiliu is a Senior Systems Engineer specializing in IT infrastructure and platform engineering. He focuses on Kubernetes, AWS, and DevSecOps, designing and maintaining scalable, secure cloud-native applications. Passionate about automation and "self-driving" infrastructure, Nurudeen actively engages with the CNCF community, sharing his expertise through LinkedIn posts and meetups. Proficient in top cloud-native tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, Prometheus, Helm, ArgoCD, Istio, Grafana, and FluxCD, he continuously explores new frontiers in DevOps and cloud technologies. Connect with him on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nurudeen-kamilu/).

name: Oktay Savdi
bio: With over 12 years in the IT sector and nearly 25 certifications, I am a Senior Kubernetes Engineer at Greentube, specializing in hybrid cloud environments. My expertise lies in managing Kubernetes clusters both on-premise and across various cloud providers. I have a strong background in containerization and automation, employing tools like Terraform, Ansible, and GitOps. Passionate about "Everything-as-Code" and "No Touch Production," I ensure seamless deployment and maintenance of cloud resources. I actively participate in CNCF meetups, sharing my insights on Kubernetes, GitOps, and Hybrid Cloud strategies.

name: Olaf Schönwald
bio: I’m a DevOps engineer with a strong focus on Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. I specialize in tools like ArgoCD and Helm, enabling teams to build scalable and reliable systems. On my blog, https://blog.schoenwald.aero, I share insights and experiences to inspire innovation in the DevOps community.

name: Olawale Olaleye
bio: Olawale is a Sr. Cloud Support Engineer at AWS, serving as a subject matter expert in container services and a technical domain authority for multiple services. With diverse experience in managing enterprise-scale cloud infrastructure and security, proficient in Kubernetes, Prometheus, Kyverno, GitOps, he specializes in efficiently running container technologies and actively supports organizations in cloud migrations and modernizations. A member of Containers security focus area, certified public speaker, tech writer, and DevOps/DevSecOps specialist, Olawale is passionate about integrating security practices into the software development lifecycle and continuously improving agile practices. You can find my writings here: https://medium.com/@whaleberry

name: Ole Mathias Heggem
bio: Experienced DevOps Engineer. With a passion for exploring new technologies and taking on challenges. He is solution oriented, analytical and a positive resource who works hard to find good and new solutions. Not afraid to break things.

name: Oleg Franko
bio: I'm a System and DevOps Engineer, passionate about the ethical values and freedom of Open Source Software, upholding its origins and independence, especially in the GNU/Linux and Kubernetes ecosystem.

name: Oleg Lipovchenko
bio: With over 15 years of experience working with Linux, I have built a strong foundation in DevOps practices, infrastructure as code, and containerization. My expertise includes managing Kubernetes clusters in both on-prem and cloud environments, and I am currently focused on OpenShift as a Platform Engineer, helping teams to containerize their applications. I am a supporter of Linux, open-source technologies, and the CNCF Kubernetes ecosystem, always exploring new tools and innovations.

name: Oleg Nenashev
bio:
Oleg is a developer tools hacker, community builder and DevRel consultant. He's passionate open source software, open ecosystems and open hardware advocate. Oleg is a core maintainer Jenkins project where he writes code, mentors contributors and organizes community events. He is a CNCF and CDF ambassador, Testcontainers Champion and a former Jenkins Board member and CDF TOC Chair. Oleg has a PhD degree in electronics design and volunteers in the Free and Open Source Silicon Foundation, and in a number of Ukrainian support and Russian anti-war organizations.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: CNCF is a driver behind many open source initiatives and industry-wide projects in the areas of observability, software delivery and virtualization. For years I’ve been a user and contributor of many projects, and also advocated for CNCF projects and best practices in my talks. It is an honor to join the CNCF Ambassadors. There are many great folks there, and I am happy to join the team. Looking forward to participating more!

Sessionize profile: https://sessionize.com/onenashev/

name: Oleh Kubai
bio: Software Engineer with 5 years of experience. Had experience with managing on-premise K8S clusters as well as the AWS EKS

name: Oleksandr Anosov
bio: I'm a software engineer with a strong background in backend development, cloud-native technologies, and performance optimization. With experience in C++, Python, Go, and Rust, I’ve worked on data-intensive applications, cloud infrastructure, and FinOps solutions. As an active member of the Ukrainian Rust community, I’m passionate about functional programming, Kubernetes, and cost-efficient cloud computing. Holding multiple Kubernetes and AWS certifications, I continuously explore new technologies to build scalable and resilient systems.

name: Oleksandr Vashchenko
bio: Senior DevOps/Platform engineer with experience in implementation and supporting Linux, AWS, Kubernetes, and CI/CD environments in financial, telecommunication, PLM, and more domains. Adept in troubleshooting different environments using a wide knowledge of CI/CD, cloud infrastructures, and networking tools to deliver efficient and reliable solutions.

name: Oliver Bähler
bio: Solutions Engineer. Kubernetes Runtime/Multi-Tenancy Enthusiast. Project Capsule Maintainer.

name: Oliver Fletcher
bio:
Oliver has close to two decades of experience as a systems engineer, software engineer, and technology consultant, both in leadership roles and as a practicing technologist.

His passion for Platform Engineering and helping organizations adopt Platform as a Product has seen him dedicate time to help drive initiatives with the CNCF's TAG for App Delivery.

name: Oliwer Borysewicz
bio: I am a Google Cloud Engineer passionate about Kubernetes and cloud automation. In my current role at Devoteam, I help clients adopt SRE practices, automate Terraform IaC and Cloud Build CI/CD pipelines, and address complex challenges in GKE, DevOps, DevSecOps, and MLOps. My fascination with Kubernetes extends beyond containerized applications – I'm excited about its potential for automating Data and Machine Learning pipelines like Cloud Composer or Kubeflow. Highly motivated to continuously expand my Kubernetes, DevSecOps & AI/ML knowledge, I believe my skills will be a valuable asset to the Kubestronaut community.

name: Oluebube Princess Egbuna
bio: Oluebube Princess, also Bube is a Devrel Engineer and an advocate for cloud-native technologies. She co-leads the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) Abuja Chapter and is currently the Docs sub-lead for the Kubernetes v1.31 release. Her expertise lies in container orchestration with Kubernetes and technologies around orchestration.

name: Oluwafemi Hamid-Oke
bio: I am a DevSecOps consultant that specialize in deploying and maintaining Kubernetes at enterprise scale while also exploring the integration of machine learning operations (MLOps) into secure DevOps practices.

name: Oluwafemi Osho
bio: I'm a cloud engineer with a huge interested in the Open Source ecosystem, and exploring CNCF projects.

name: Omkar Shailendra Rane
bio: I’m a Senior Site Reliability Engineer specializing in Kubernetes and modern cloud-native technologies. I focus on building scalable, reliable infrastructure and enhancing automation for engineering teams. Passionate about system reliability and efficiency, I enjoy solving complex challenges and continuously learning new advancements in the Kubernetes ecosystem.

name: Omri Siri
bio: As a seasoned DevOps professional with over 10 years of experience, I am passionate about technology and have a deep understanding of people, tools and how to make them work togethe.I Started developing In C at the age of 14, and 27 years later still deep into technology.

name: Ong Wei Jie
bio: I am an engineer at a Singapore-based IT solutions provider, and when I'm not solving tech problems, I'm either potting balls in cue sports or achieving a high KDA ratio in PC gaming.

name: Onur Rıdvanoğlu
bio: Hey there! I'm Onur and I'm an SRE at Logo Yazılım with a big passion for all things tech. I love diving into Kubernetes, Docker, and the whole cloud-native world. Whether it's building, maintaining, or fine-tuning infrastructure, I’m all in. I'm always excited to learn new things and bring fresh ideas to the table, making sure everything runs smoothly and efficiently.

name: Orlin Vasilev
bio:
Orlin Vasilev aka Orlix is a Principal Technology Advocate at SUSE. Also running the communities and maintainer for Project Harbor. CNCF Ambassador and driving the biggest Meetup Group ~1700 members in Bulgaria. Multiple times KubeCon CfP review board member and co-chair. SysAdmin/Dev/SRE/System engineering roles for over 15 years! Located in Bulgaria, Europe! Father of two - a fantastic girl and a boy! Passionate snowboarder, DIY and semi-professional BBQ Pitmaster and baker!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being ambassador makes your part of the most fantastic crowd in the Tech World these days. As Ambassador v1 allowed me to drive the meetup and many other local activities with universities and helping put people in general with Cloud Native technologies.

name: Oskar Marthinussen
bio: I’m an Infrastructure Engineer with two years of experience at an IT consulting company. Together with a few colleagues, we have started a platform team delivering Red Hat OpenShift to multiple critical infrastructure companies in Norway. I’m an active member of the Norwegian open source community and regularly attend various Red Hat meetups, including the Mad Roadshow in Oslo, which focuses on OpenShift.

name: Osman Yildiz
bio: Seasoned professional with a rich background in Software Development and proven expertise in DevOps practices. Equipped with a comprehensive skill set and a passion for driving innovation through technology, I bring a wealth of experience to the table. As a Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS), and Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD), I possess a deep understanding of container orchestration and management. My proficiency extends to CI/CD pipelines, where I excel in utilizing tools such as Jenkins, Gitlab, ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, and Azure DevOps to automate and optimize software delivery processes. With a relentless drive for excellence and a commitment to continuous improvement, I thrive in dynamic environments where collaboration and innovation are paramount. I am eager to leverage my skills and expertise to contribute to challenging projects and drive transformative change.

name: Oumar Ballo
bio: I am a DevSecOps engineer who has a passion for cloud native technologies with a strong interest in security. Among those I use on a daily basis: Kubernetes, ClusterAPI, Cilium, FluxCD, Helm, Kyverno, Cert-Manager, External Secrets Operator combined with HashiCorp Vault.

name: Oumarou Kabore
bio: I'm a DevOps and cloud engineer passionate about containers and cloud-native technologies. With extensive experience in designing and managing scalable infrastructure, I specialize in tools like Kubernetes, Helm, ArgoCD, and Terraform. I enjoy building cloud infrastructure by integrating DevOps culture with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and CI/CD tools to enable automation, consistency, and reliability. Security remains a top priority in my approach, ensuring best practices are followed.

name: Oğuz Halit Sak
bio:
Hello,

My name is Oğuz Halit Sak. I have professional experience in Cloud, Platform, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) roles, specializing in Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD pipelines, cloud and cloud security across AWS, GCP, and Azure. I am dedicated to helping clients optimize their operations in the cloud through containerization and orchestration technologies. I am a lifelong learner passionate about staying at the forefront of industry advancements and actively contribute to the tech community by providing training at various events focused on cloud-native technologies. You can connect with me on LinkedIn

˙˳𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓊝𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃𓂃˙˳⋆

name: Pablo Fredrikson
bio:
Professional Nerd, SRE and Content Creator. Love advocating for Open-Source and container technologies. Runs a YouTube channel where he shares and teaches the technologies and good practices he uses every day as an SRE at Bitso.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I love teaching and helping people to become better engineers. I love everything open source and what it stands for, knowledge must be shared and everyone should have the opportunity to become better at their jobs.

name: Paco Bernabe
bio: I started my career as a Linux system administrator. I have been into automation, long before Infra as Code was a thing. I saw Openstack and Kubernetes as an opportunity to take bigger steps in my career. Afterwards, Azure crossed my way too; and I have been doing projects at different clients with those technologies since then. After a long time working from home, because of the Covid pandemic, I have realized even more of the importance of meeting people face to face, and I have been attending more and more meetups since a few years ago. Last year (in 2024), I joined the team that organizes the Dutch Cloud Native Day and the Kubernetes Community Day in The Netherlands (I hope to see you at KCD Utrecht'25).

name: Paige Cruz
bio:
Paige Cruz is passionate about cultivating sustainable on-call practices and believes that open source instrumentation has a bright future. She isn’t afraid to admit that distributed traces are her favorite 😛 and will talk to anyone about adopting OpenTelemetry. After retiring from SRE she brought her zest for bringing people their aha moment with observability to Chronosphere where she works as a Senior Developer Advocate. Read her blog posts over on https://chronosphere.io/learn/category/blog/ or her personal blog at https://www.paigerduty.com/. Off-the-clock you can find her scouring fiber apprenticing at a local sustainable yarn mill or watching trash TV.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Excited to be an ambassador to demystify observability concepts and practices for all levels of technologists. Looking to grow the OpenTelemetry community from end-users to contributors and maintainers while sparking collaboration across company boundaries.

name: Paige O'Connor
bio: Paige is the Executive Administrator at Cloud Native Computing Foundation. She supports Priyanka Sharma, ED, and is the organizational backbone to the entire team. Her experience spans over 7 years in operations and administration. As a recent transplant to San Francisco from the mid-west, she enjoys traveling, wine tasting and trying new restaurants in the Bay Area.

name: Pankaj Pote
bio: As a Senior Manager with CitiusTech, I specialize in DevOps and QA Automation, leveraging experience of collaborating with esteemed clients like 3M Healthcare now known as Solventum, DaVita etc... My expertise spans building secure, efficient pipelines and integrating advanced automation practices. Driven by a passion for DevOps and a keen interest in Kubernetes, I am dedicated to fostering innovation in pipeline security and cloud-native technologies to deliver robust, scalable solutions.

name: Panus Janyapanich
bio: Cloud Solution Architect, DevOps Engineering and Kubernetes enthusiast

name: Paolo Patierno
bio:
I am a Senior Principal Software Engineer working at Red Hat on messaging and data streaming technologies. One of these is Strimzi, a CNCF project for running Apache Kafka on Kubernetes in a cloud native manner using operators. I am also a committer on a number of IoT related projects and interested in observability and metrics – as a side project I look at how Formula 1 telemetry can be analysed with the technologies I work with every day. I am based in Napoli, where I am the lead organiser of the local CNCF Meetup.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I feel that I am one of the lucky people who love their job because it's also their passion. Taking this passion to the community by sharing my knowledge about open source technologies is something which excites me. To be a CNCF Ambassador takes this love to the next level, being even more engaged within the cloud native space.

name: Pasquale Russiello
bio: I'm a Solutions Architect at Wiz, focusing on helping customers deploy their cloud-native workloads securely across EMEA. With a strong passion for Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies, I’m constantly learning and expanding my knowledge to stay at the forefront of the evolving cloud security landscape.

name: Patrick Easters
bio: I'm on the field engineering team at Grafana Labs and have been working with Kubernetes since the 1.1 days. I'm always trying to keep up with the best practices for cloud native infrastructure and enjoy helping others do the same. When I'm not busy tinkering in my lab, I'm probably building something in the garage, trying a new pizza recipe, or stepping on snacks dropped by my kids.

name: Patrick Eichler
bio: I'm Patrick, a freelancer who specializes in site reliability engineering and Kubernetes. Through reading IT books, IT-Bloqs, and autodidactic studies, I constantly broaden my horizon with state-of-the-art expert knowledge and modern technical skills, which I not only use in my daily work and personal projects, but also blog about and teach to other people.

name: Patrick Honing
bio: DevOps Engineer for Greater

name: Patrick Kohler
bio: I have a strong background in IT and network security, with years of experience securing infrastructures. In my new role in the Kubernetes ecosystem, I am excited to apply my expertise in networking and security to cloud-native environments. In my free time, I enjoy experimenting in my homelab, exploring new technologies, and continuously expanding my skill set.

name: Patryk Wieczorek
bio: I am passionate about IT and I run the most dedicated study group and stream daily how I study at 5 AM at https://www.youtube.com/@thefiveamstudy

name: Paul Balogh
bio:
Paul is a Software Architect and Developer Advocate. In his many roles, he has encouraged developers and testers alike to "shift left," bringing reliability testing earlier in the software development process. As a software engineer/architect for over 20 years in varying languages, he now focuses more on the Go programming language. Active in the community, he organizes the St. Louis chapter of Cloud Native Community Groups and the StLGo Meetup group.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As a technologist, I became enamored with cloud-native technologies as soon as I was exposed. Events like KubeCon only supercharged my excitement for the overall CNCF project landscape. As a CNCF Ambassador, I'm hoping my enthusiasm for all things cloud-native will spread to those I meet at local events. I feel this platform will allow me to become more engaged as an advocate for CNCF projects, helping the community to gain more knowledge of opportunities and to encourage more active roles in open source contributions.

name: Paul Becker
bio: Too early. Need caffeine. Doing DevOps and Linux stuff.

name: Paul Daubin
bio: 31 yo Parisian tech enthusiast with a newfound passion for Kubernetes. I've been working with it and in computer science in general for one year, after working and studying in other fields. I'm doing consulting gigs, and using kubernetes daily, trying to master it (as much as possible). I've yet to publish articles, but that might come !

name: Paul Jones
bio: Paul is a Principal Engineer at Jetstack Consult, helping teams adopt and mature Kubernetes platforms and leveraging CNCF projects to compose bespoke solutions.

name: Paul Yu
bio: Paul Yu is a Senior Cloud Native Advocate at Microsoft focusing on cloud-native technologies and the Kubernetes landscape. Paul has over a decade of industry experience and held various roles including software engineer and solution architect. He is passionate about promoting cloud-native and sustainable solutions to help organizations optimize processes and workflows. You can find some of his content on https://paulyu.dev

name: Paula Kennedy
bio: Paula is part of the organising committee for Kubernetes Community Days UK, DevOpsDays London, FastFlowConf, and the London Platform User Group. In her day job, Paula is Co-Founder and Chief Operating Officer of Syntasso. She is passionate about community, diversity and inclusion, enjoys speaking at events like KubeCon and also cohosted the first Platform Engineering colocated day at KubeCon Paris. In her spare time, Paula enjoys walking her dog and attempting to run half-marathons.

name: Pawel Piotrowski
bio: Solutions Architect focused on Software Defined Datacenter and various K8s implementations. Virtualvillage.cloud blog author

name: Pawel Wajdziak
bio: 🚀 Kubestronaut | Open Source Advocate | Cloud Architect | DevOps Engineer 🌍 A technologist at heart, I thrive at the intersection of cloud-native solutions, DevOps, and open-source innovation. With a deep passion for Kubernetes, automation, and scalable architectures, I help organizations build resilient, efficient, and secure cloud environments. 🔹 Expertise in: Cloud Architecture, DevOps, CI/CD, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Helm) 🔹 Passionate about: Open-source methodologies, automation, and creating self-service developer platforms 🔹 Philosophy: Solve complex problems, embrace new challenges, and continuously learn When I'm not architecting scalable systems, you'll find me exploring nature, embracing new adventures, and advocating for open collaboration in the tech community. Let's connect and shape the future of cloud-native technologies!

name: Paweł Swędzikiewicz
bio: DevOps Engineer with a strong inclination to automate everything. Interested in CNCF technology and GitOps. Mainly working with Kubernetes.

name: Pedro Célestin
bio: I’m a seasoned IT professional with over a decade of experience in mission-critical environments. I excel in designing, deploying and sustaining dependable infrastructure solutions, drawn upon cloud-native technologies such as Kubernetes, Prometheus, Thanos, Istio and Argo. I always seek to keep systems architecture tightly aligned with business goals, and for such I make wide use of service level objectives crafted upon observability data. I strongly believe that great architectures enable great digital products that impact peoples lives.

name: Pedro Victor Lourenço Fragola.
bio: I am currently serving as the Kubernetes Competency Lead within the Engineering Support team at Canonical, where my primary focus is helping customers resolve issues and bugs related to Canonical/Ubuntu Cloud products. Also I have knowledge of OpenStack and virtualization technologies.

name: Pekka Luostarinen
bio: I am a passionate and trusted Cloud Architect specializing in designing and implementing scalable solutions in the cloud. Focusing in Azure related services including AKS.

name: Pepijn Oomen
bio: With 40+ years experience in the ICT field, Pepijn has been recognised by IBM as an OS/2 Warp Engineer and a Lotus Notes Principal Engineer, by RedHat as a Certified Engineer (RHCE) and a Certified Specialist in OpenShift and more recently by the Linux Foundation as a Kubestronaut. He is a long time user of containers and Kubernetes and has previously been providing on-site trainings for RedHat OpenShift. As a Platform Engineer, Pepijn works with a focus on security, reliability and automation for complex infrastructures.

name: Percy Ángel José Escalante Barriga
bio: I’m an engineer passionate about cloud-native technologies and infrastructure as code (IaC), specializing in Kubernetes, AWS, and Terraform. I focus on building scalable, automated solutions and enjoy sharing insights on GitOps and DevSecOps. My interests also extend to other IT fields, including Data Engineering and Data Science.

name: Pete Wall
bio: I am a software engineer who lives in Minnesota with my family. I really enjoy running workloads on Kubernetes and have been working with it for many years. I work at Grafana Labs, where I specialize on monitoring Kubernetes clusters and the workloads running within them.

name: Peter Adeosun
bio: I am a Cybersecurity Professional with over three years of extensive experience in network, cloud, data, and machine learning platforms. I work closely with platform and delivery teams to secure and enhance technology solutions.

name: Peter Barczi
bio: K8s | AWS | Linux | servers | infrastructure Following the above listed "key" skills ,I'm currently working as Sr. DevOps Engineer / TechLead within my company. We build our cloud offering with focus on confidential computing. So I'm in daily touch with managing physical servers, clouds, operating Linux OSs and Kubernetes clusters at scale. Furthermore I act also as Internal Linux Trainer.

name: Peter Dada
bio:
👋 Hello! I'm a passionate Kubestronaut navigating the exciting world of cloud-native technologies, driven by a deep enthusiasm for continuous learning and emerging tech. As a CNCF enthusiast, I'm on a mission to help organizations harness the power of containerization and orchestration for building scalable, resilient, and efficient applications.

My focus lies in Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, and scalable cloud infrastructure, always pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the cloud-native space. I'm dedicated to advancing cloud-native best practices and fostering innovation in the field. Let's collaborate and drive the future of cloud computing forward! 🚀

name: Peter Dongo
bio: I am a seasoned IT professional with over 15 years of industry experience. Initially, I began my career as a Developer, a role I fulfilled for a decade before transitioning to DevOps, where I have since become an expert DevOps Architect. My primary focus is on Azure cloud environments and managing Rancher Kubernetes clusters.

name: Peter Michal Rusnak
bio: I am Peter Michal Rusnak 24-year-old DevOps Engineer with a passion for Linux, cloud-native architecture, and cutting-edge cloud technologies. Specializing in Kubernetes with focus on enhancing observability within containerized environments, leveraging monitoring and logging tools to ensure reliability and performance.

name: Peter Stolz
bio: I studied CyberSecurity and work in Security and DevOps. I use a lot of Falco, argo and NATS. I like playing CTFs and learning about cool projects to host in my homelab.

name: Petr Černohouz
bio: DevOps Engineer specializing in Kubernetes cluster management and high-performance CI/CD pipeline design. Experienced in optimizing software delivery across cloud and on-prem environments. Passionate about automating workflows and sharing knowledge through Docker and Kubernetes training.

name: Petro Diachenko
bio: I am from Ukraine, I like to learn different technologies and foreign languages. I can speak, read and write five languages. I like technology and often study and research open source technologies on my own way. I have a new willing to get new certifications in other tech-stages and directions . I love different start-ups and love to participate in something new. My hobby in Stack are Kubernetes infrastructure, Hashicorp Stack, I am a regular use Linux in all spheres of life
company: I am freelancer and I like it,

name: Phanindra Sangers
bio: Hello, I’m Phanindra Sangers, passionate about cloud technologies and always eager to explore the inner workings of various tools. I have a strong interest in Kubernetes and other DevOps-related technologies, constantly seeking to deepen my understanding of how they function behind the scenes. Hit me up for any collaborations!

name: Phanis Parpas
bio: Phanis is a Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft, specializing in Application and Innovation. With a keen focus on cloud solutions, he works closely with Microsoft partners to provide deep technical support, fostering strong relationships and designing new solutions based on Microsoft's cloud platform. His role involves architecting service delivery engagements to accelerate partner solution builds, migrations, and modernizations, contributing to customer success. Phanis expertise in cloud architecture and innovation is instrumental in driving new solutions and practices to the forefront of the industry, ensuring partners and customers alike benefit from the latest in cloud technology and services.

name: Phil Estes
bio:
Phil is a Principal Engineer for Amazon Web Services (AWS), focused on core container technologies that power AWS container compute offerings. Phil is currently an active contributor and maintainer for containerd, a graduated CNCF project, and participates in the Open Container Initiative (OCI) as the member of the Technical Oversight Board (TOB). Phil enjoys helping others understand and implement container and cloud native concepts and speaks worldwide at industry conferences and meetups on behalf of AWS and his open source roles.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be a CNCF ambassador for the express purpose of helping others understand the world of containers and, specifically, the core container runtime technology and standards that enable and power that world. Having been involved in the CNCF since nearly its beginning, I know that it can be an overwhelming place for newcomers at it has grown, and as an ambassador, I'm happy to play a part in helping people understand and navigate the projects and work of the CNCF.

name: Phil Huang
bio:
I am an active member of the Cloud Native Taiwan User Group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/cloudnative.tw) at Taiwan with extensive experience and skills. I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and experiences, irregularly organizing Meetup events (https://community.cncf.io/kcd-taiwan/) to provide professional expertise on Kubernetes and CNCF technologies. In addition, I also run my own blog, where I share practical information and experiences related to Kubernetes and container technologies. Please feel free to visit my blog at https://blog.pichuang.com.tw

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because I believe in the program's value and the chance to connect with like-minded individuals. It's rewarding to represent the program's values and contribute to the community's awareness and adoption of the technology.

Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/pichuang

name: Philip Schmid
bio: My journey in Information Technology began as a traditional network and Linux system engineer. In 2015, I was introduced to the groundbreaking concept of containers, which sparked a new direction in my career. Over the years, I have honed my skills with various container technologies, including Docker Compose, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes. By 2020, I decided to fully embrace the future of IT by shifting my focus to Kubernetes, Container Networking, and Cloud Native tooling. This transition has allowed me to dive deep into the evolving landscape of modern infrastructure, where I continue to explore and innovate.

He is passionate about Kubernetes and its open-source ecosystem.

Project Experience: Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Crossplane, OpenTelemetry Languages: English, Polish

Prabhakaran is passionate about staying at the forefront of cloud technology trends, regularly engaging in industry conferences, and dedicating significant time to continuous learning.

A Masters of Computer Science Student at Banaras Hindu University. Passionate about Cybersecurity, DevOps and Cloud Computing. An active open-source contributor, contributed towards several open-source projects. Previously, contributed to in-toto as a GSoC contributor.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a part of cloud native community, gaining new skills and qualities. Gathering more knowledge from other community members. Motivating and guiding my community members towards cloud native.

name: Pramoda Kumar Jena
bio: I work as a Support Escalation Engineer at Microsoft, focusing on Kubernetes and container-related services, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Container Registry (ACR), Azure Container Instance (ACI)and Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO). I bring extensive experience in cloud technologies and services, coupled with a strong background in Linux system administration and enterprise infrastructure support from my previous roles at AstraZeneca, IBM, and HCL.

name: Pramodh Kumar M
bio: As a seasoned DevSecOps Consultant with over five years of hands-on experience, I specialize in implementing and optimizing solutions that encompass a range of cloud services and platforms, including GitHub Enterprise, Azure DevOps, LaunchDarkly, Octopus Deploy, SonarQube, JFrog Platform, Atlassian Stack, as well as HashiCorp Terraform and Vault. My expertise is focused on delivering customized solutions that maximize value for clients, drawing on a comprehensive knowledge of DevSecOps best practices.

name: Pranesh Venkatraman
bio: I’m a Cloud Security Engineer at Apple, passionate about creating secure and scalable solutions to help drive innovation in the cloud.

name: Pranshu Srivastava
bio: Pranshu is a Kubernetes SIG Instrumentation co-chair, a NodeJS emeritus, and a Senior Software Engineer at Red Hat. He has embraced Open Source throughout the years as a mentee, and a mentor, for various code programs. He enjoys helping the cloud ecosystem by building critical APIs, tools, and driving impactful discussions in the Observability space.

name: Praseeda Sathaye
bio: Praseeda Sathaye is a Principal Specialist Solution Architect for App Modernization and Containers at Amazon Web Services, based in the Bay Area, California. She specializes in accelerating cloud-native adoption, modernizing platform infrastructure, and architecting microservices using Kubernetes, GitOps, and service mesh. Praseeda has published highly acclaimed workshops and blogs on Amazon EKS, Karpenter, and Istio-on-EKS, which have been widely praised for their educational value. She is an active contributor to the open-source community, having helped add Amazon EKS usecase to Istio documentation. Praseeda is an engaging presenter at major conferences like Grace Hopper, KubeCon and GitopsCon for her ability to make complex topics relatable. With over 25 years of experience in leading, designing, and architecting software products across various domains, Praseeda is an inspirational role model who empowers women and minority groups in the tech industry through her teaching, mentoring, presenting, contributing, and evangelizing efforts.

name: Prashant Lakhera
bio: I'm an expert in Cloud and DevOps. I hold many technical certifications that show my deep understanding of AWS Cloud, DevOps, Kubernetes, Python and Shell Automation, and Linux system administration, along with problem- solving skills like debugging, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.

name: Prashanth Manohar
bio: I have been a Kubernetes enthusiast all my career; K8s have been a pillar for my growth professionally. Currently working as Engineering Manager in Sony India, handling various pillars in DevOps/SRE areas for Playstation. Passionate about keeping up with the latest trends in IaC, GitOps, observability tooling, containerization, and cloud-native tools. Anchoring to built platform/community for next-gen DevOps engineers to propel foundational in-depthness to add more value in cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Pratul Singh
bio:
I am a DevOps engineer working with HPE. I have in total 6 years of experiance. I have a deep inclination towards learning and working on container based technologies. Right now I am trying to learn golang which will help me in customizing kubernetes.

I love to interact with technology savy people. I am looking forward to join the CNCF community and become a part of building new things while working with like minded people and some of the sharpest brains in todays industry.

name: Preben Solheim
bio: Preben is a Cloud and DevOps Engineer working with Kubernetes, Terraform, and AWS.

name: Preet Pal
bio: Cloud Engineer at Cisco

name: Premkumar Selvaraj
bio: Premkumar Selvaraj is a Senior Enterprise DevOps Engineer at Elekta with a strong passion for continuous learning and admire problem solving. He is committed to enhancing his expertise in software development and driving efficiency throughout the SDLC. He advocates for automation through self-service pipelines, empowering stakeholders to navigate technical challenges while improving overall efficiency. Specialized in Azure, Cloud Infrastructure provisioning, management & monitoring, DevSecOps, Microservices architecture, GitOps, and Cybersecurity.

name: Pritesh Bhavsar
bio: I am a Software Engineer with over 3 years of experience, specializing in Kubernetes, AWS, and cloud-native technologies. Passionate about automation and infrastructure as code. While I actively engage in the cloud-native community

name: Prithvi Raj
bio:
Prithvi Raj is working as a Community Manager & Developer Advocate at Mirantis and is leading the community efforts for the Open Source Program Office at Mirantis including the k0s project, k0smortron, and the other OSS projects Mirantis is contributing to. He previously led the LitmusChaos project community, the CNCF incubating project based on Cloud-Native Chaos Engineering, and has helped scale a community of 3000+ folks from scratch. He is also a CNCF Ambassador and has closely worked with the CNCF community to run LFX Mentorship programs and helped build a Chaos Engineering community in the CNCF ecosystem. He has worked on global events, conferences, and meetups such as Chaos Carnival, Kubernetes Community Days Bengaluru & Chennai, CNCF Kubernetes Chaos Engineering Meetups, and more to help grow various communities in the DevOps ecosystem. He started his journey in 2020 at MayaData and has been passionately helping build the Chaos Engineering community since, being part of ChaosNative and previously Harness.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to represent the k0s as a CNCF ambassador and to also work with fellow ambassadors in helping curate more resources, events, and opportunities for the broader community. As an ambassador, I hope to take forward the cloud-native values amongst various folks keen on joining the ecosystem. I also look forward to learning a lot on this journey from my fellow ambassadors.

name: Priyanka Saggu
bio: Priyanka Saggu is a Kubernetes Integration Engineer at SUSE. She has made significant contributions to the Kubernetes project via Special Interest Groups – Release, ContribEx, Testing and CLI. She's the Release Lead for Kubernetes v1.29 release cycle, and is the Emeritus Advisor for the upcoming Kubernetes v1.31 release cycle. Priyanka is also the Technical Lead for the Kubernetes SIG - Contributor Experience (ContribEx) and a GitHub Admin for the Kubernetes project's GitHub organizations. In the past, she has held leadership roles such as Release Lead Shadow for v1.27 and v1.26, Enhancement Lead for v1.25, and has been part of the Release Team since v1.23. She actively mentors new contributors and coordinates the Meet Our Contributor - APAC initiative under SIG ContribEx to promote the achievements of active contributors.

name: Priyanka Sharma
bio: Priyanka is the Executive Director of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) which serves as the vendor-neutral home for 100+ of the fastest-growing open source projects, including Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Envoy. She is also a co-creator of the Inclusive Naming Initiative whose mission is to promote and facilitate replacing harmful and exclusionary language in information technology. She was a founding team member of the OpenTracing standard and has contributed to other open source projects such as Jaeger, Vitess, and GitLab. Priyanka is a long time champion of and advisor to startups in cutting-edge technology spaces and serves as an Advisor at HeavyBit Industries, an accelerator and fund for developer and enterprise companies.

name: Pubudu Perera
bio: I’m a seasoned Engineer who has worn many hats over the years as a DevOps, SRE, Platform Engineer and a Developer. I love all things Kubernetes and currently exploring other tools within the CNCF landscape.

name: Puja Abbassi
bio:
Puja Abbassi is the Vice President of Product at Giant Swarm, building a managed cloud native developer platform based on Kubernetes. In Kubernetes he focuses on extending Kubernetes with custom resources and controllers. With many years of Kubernetes experience and having been in the beta batch of CKAs, he enjoys solving problems and helping people in the community, mainly within SIG Contributor Experience. He used to also be a contributor to the CIS Kubernetes Benchmarks. I blog at https://www.giantswarm.io/blog/author/puja-abbassi and sometimes on the CNCF or other community blogs.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As a CNCF ambassador, I'm passionate about bringing cloud native technologies to more developers and their organisations around the globe. Especially, as the community is growing both from a project perspective as well as on the end user side, I'm excited to bring the two closer together and see how we can enable end user organisations to build cloud native platforms using CNCF projects.

Sessionize Profile: https://sessionize.com/puja

name: Puru Tuladhar
bio: Puru is a lifelong tech enthusiast and aspiring minimalist with over 10 years of experience in building cloud infrastructure. He is the author of the 'CKS Handbook' and enjoys writing books, blogs, and contributing to open-source projects. A certified AWS professional, Puru is passionate about sharing knowledge and simplifying complex topics. You can learn more about him at www.purutuladhar.com.

name: Purushotham K S
bio: I work as a Site Reliability Engineer at Adobe, I'm passionate about Cloud Native ecosystem & enjoy working on distributed systems.

name: Qing Hao
bio:
Qing Hao is a senior software engineer at Red Hat. She loves open source and sharing, she is a maintainer of Open Cluster Management and enjoys writing blogs to share new developments in the community. She has been involved in numerous open source activities over the past few years, including being a speaker at KubeCon, a mentor for OSPP and GSoC many times. She has hosted many open source meetups in Xi’an as early as 2015, and she is now one of the organizers of KCD.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am passionate about open source and sharing, and becoming an ambassador would provide me with more opportunities and motivation to do what I love. I’ve witnessed the CNCF project’s remarkable growth in recent years, and now, with the rise of AI, it’s thriving more than ever. As an ambassador, I look forward to helping more people and projects benefit from open source, which is one of the most exciting aspects of this role.

name: Quentin Marszalek
bio: I would define myself as a tech enthusiastic. As far as I remember, I always wanted to work in computer science. I started working last year and I'm very proud to be part of the Kubestronaut program. Kubernetes is such a good technology and there is so much more to learn so I won't stop learning !

name: R M Vinay

I have successfully migrated applications to a modern OpenShift/Kubernetes environment, demonstrating our commitment to innovation and operational excellence. By leveraging Helm and Helm Charts, we've established robust, agile development processes that drive the continuous evolution of enterprise solutions.

Freelance cloud architect, OSS addict, huge fan of k8s, cilium, argocd and friends. I speak regularly about cloud tech, security and OSS projects I use or implement for my clients. I run several meetups in my city Docker, CNCF Lyon, DevSecCon France, co-organize conferences (KCDFRANCE) and involved regularly as conference MC and member of CFP committee , more importantly I’m a happy husband and dad

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I’m freaking excited to join the ambassador community.To meet new friends, help growing communities, sharing the skills I’ve learned and give back to the CNCF community. Being an ambassador will allow me to what i love the most, mentoring, i can’t wait to jump in !

I’m person who is open to any new technologies and strives to learn something new every day, as it contributes to my personal and professional development. I like to move myself out of my comfort zone, continuously seeking challenges that push my boundaries and foster growth. In my free time I enjoy being with my family, reading books, hiking and swimming

I’ve had the chance to explore this technology in some fascinating and challenging fields like Financial Services and Insurance. Oh, and I also have my own blog where I love to share my DevOps experiences. Feel free to check it out: https://rafaelnatali.wixsite.com/rmn-technology!

I work with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Rancher and Jenkins to ensure scalability, security and performance of systems. My skills in automation, monitoring and resource optimisation contribute to efficient infrastructure management and faster service delivery.

name: Raghavendra Kamath Kantavar
bio: I'm a DevOps engineer with a strong focus on automation and continuous improvement. I bring a collaborative approach to problem-solving and am dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions. My commitment to staying current with the latest technologies ensures I can provide effective and innovative solutions.

name: Rahees Khan
bio: I am a DevOps Engineer professional specializing in Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) projects, including Kubernetes, Prometheus, ArgoCD, Istio, Flux, Fluentd and Helm. With expertise in Docker, Ansible, Terraform, Python, and Bash scripting, I optimize workflows and ensure system reliability in modern DevOps environments.

name: Rahul Jadhav
bio:
An avid coder, a systems engineer working on solutions involving security and performance optimizations of cloud-native technologies. He runs a Kubernetes Cloud Native Security Bangalore Meetup and has been working closely with IETF Standards working groups. Taken several projects from conception to market and is an active maintainer for CNCF Sandbox project, "KubeArmor" and the lead author for IoT simulation framework "Whitefield". He co founded Accuknox where they are enabling runtime, zero-trust security by leveraging Linux-LSM/eBPF based security for k8s and containerized/cloud-native workloads.​

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Connecting to community and engaging at events, meeting new people, talking about cloud native technologies is something that I cherish. It is always great to be an ambassador of the community whose motto and modus operandi is something that I believe in. One specific goal that I would like to achieve is to establish a security focussed community locally by understanding activities that were undertaken at CNCF wide initiatives.

name: Rahul K Shettigar
bio: Passionate about cloud-native technologies. I follow a hands-on approach: build it, break it, then rebuild it even better.

name: Rahul Kumar

I primarily use CNCF open source technologies to develop and design robust platforms and solutions for production. For example, I created a multiregional enterprise MLOps platform that is used daily by thousands of data scientists and involves scaling Spark on Kubernetes. Additionally, I guide clients on best practices in the Kubernetes stack.

I specialize in designing scalable infrastructures and optimizing CI/CD pipelines, with a proven track record of enhancing system reliability and efficiency. Through innovative solutions, I have achieved significant cost savings and performance improvements. I like working with GitOps.

My work revolves around designing, building, and scaling cloud-native solutions with a focus on reliability and efficiency. These days, my primary tool stack includes Istio, Kubernetes, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC), which I leverage to drive service mesh innovation, cloud automation, and scalable platform solutions.

name: Rainer Hermanns
bio: As a freelance cloud architect and cloud-native enthusiast with over 25 years of experience in the software industry, I leverage my background as a developer to bridge the gap between business, developers and operators. This unique perspective allows me to fully understand their needs and deliver exceptional value to my clients. I am truly passionate about creating platforms that developers not only embrace but also appreciate and actively support. My deep expertise in cloud-native applications and public cloud solutions informs my mentoring and consulting approach, ensuring that clients receive tailored, high-performance environments and platforms that meet their specific requirements.

name: Rainui Ly
bio: Engineer, cloud-native computing enthusiast, open-source advocate, fan of KubeCon+CloudNativeCon. Speciality in security, software development and DevOps/Platform practices. The best process is the learning one.

name: Raj Babu Das
bio: Raj is an accomplished Staff Software Engineer at Harness with over 5+ of experience, making significant strides at a leading Unicorn Startup. His journey in the tech industry is marked by a series of noteworthy contributions. Additionally, Raj plays a crucial role as a current maintainer of LitmusChaos, underlining his deep commitment to open-source projects. Raj's contributions also extend to other CNCF projects, where he is an active contributor to Prometheus, Kyverno and SigNoz. Balancing roles as a developer by day and SRE by night, he is passionate about building resilient systems and fervently advocates for cloud-native best practices. Raj has shared his expertise at various international conferences, including KubeCon, engaging with the global tech community.

name: Raja Navunan Muthukalai
bio: A highly motivated and passionate Senior Java Developer with 17+ years of experience in building distributed large-scale web, batch, and streaming applications using microservices and event-driven architectures.

name: Raja Ravindra Kathi
bio: I am Ravindra. For past few years, I've worked as developer's favourite engineer, well as a DevOps engineer; building cloud native solutions for humans, warehouses and robots. I bring in a decent expertise of open source software solutions along with a high bar of enthusiasm and energy to the table. I love exploring new technologies and how they matter to business. Working in startups, I finally learnt to meditate in chaos. They give me the adrenaline that I will ever need. Thanks for stopping by, keep hustling!

name: Rajeev Ranjan Sinha
bio: My name is Rajeev Sinha and technology excites me. I have close to 18 years of IT experience in various domains - Linux/Unix/Clusters/ Storage /Backup/ Kubernetes/ CI-CD / Monitoring - splunk/ Prometheus/grafana…etc. CNCF technologies- kubernetes / Prometheus

name: Rajesh Ramu

I am passionate about the cloud and the endless possibilities it offers for building complex, innovative systems. I love discovering each product under the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) and applying them in the best possible scenarios. Happy to be part of Kubestronaut program.

bio: I specialise in AWS Container Services like EKS, ECS etc. and passionate about cloud-native technologies. It’s been more than 5+ years since I started my journey with Kubernetes and there is no stopping since then. I love to troubleshoot the issues related to Kubernetes and associated technologies like Helm, Terraform, Argo CD etc.

name: Raluca Bica
bio: Enthusiastic Kubernetes explorer with a keen interest in the cloud-native landscape. I've been working with Kubernetes technologies for over 4 years and I am eager to dive into new challenges!

name: Ramamurthy Krishnamurthy
bio: Ramamurthy is a DevOps and Cloud Specialist with over 15 years of experience, currently leading Cloud & DevSecOps as a Specialist Infrastructure at Publicis Sapient. With a strong background in digital transformation, He provides technical leadership to engineering and development teams, focusing on Kubernetes, cloud, security and DevOps methodolgy. Passionate about building resilient, scalable systems, Ramamurthy actively shares his knowledge through mentorship, public speaking, and technical leadership. He plays a pivotal role in standardizing DevOps and security practices, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and security across global teams. With extensive hands-on experience in Kubernetes, Helm, Prometheus, and Istio, he specializes in designing and implementing fault-tolerant, scalable solutions across all major cloud platforms. He is dedicated to helping teams package, deploy, and orchestrate microservices at scale, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance reliability, security, and performance

name: Ramanuj Dad
bio: I’m a technology professional with extensive experience in cloud-native technologies, Linux system administration, and infrastructure automation. My expertise spans Kubernetes, Terraform, and Linux-based virtualization tools like KVM and QEMU. I specialize in creating reusable Terraform modules for efficient infrastructure management and automating complex workflows using Ansible and Python. My Ansible expertise includes automating Linux VM management, Kubernetes cluster operations, and implementing robust security configurations. I also have hands-on experience with SRE responsibilities, such as ensuring reliability, scalability, and efficient operations for cloud-native systems. Passionate about learning, I’ve built a large-scale home lab with multi-cluster Kubernetes setups and CNCF projects to deepen my understanding of cloud-native solutions. I enjoy sharing knowledge through mentoring, technical discussions, and contributing to the growth of sysadmin, DevOps, and platform engineering teams.

name: Ramesh Kumar
bio:
I'm Ramesh Kumar, a dedicated advocate and mentor in the dynamic realm of cloud-native technologies. With a genuine passion for empowering others and a commitment to fostering meaningful connections, my journey is not just about the technology, but about the profound impact I make on the lives of those around me.

At the forefront of my endeavors are the CNCF/Kubernetes meetups I lead in Sacramento and Penang. These gatherings are not just about technical learning, they are about building a community where individuals find support, encouragement, and a strong sense of belonging. I aim to foster collaboration and knowledge sharing, especially caring for the newbies navigating the landscape. Through my patient guidance and steadfast support, I help over 500+ students and professionals navigate the complexities of Kubernetes certifications, empowering them to achieve their goals and pursue their passions.

My specialties lie in mentoring, teaching, training, and collaborating, and I take pride in my ability to inspire and guide others in their learning journey. I love encouraging and inspiring others to reach for their dreams and embrace new opportunities using CNCF Technologies. Whether guiding a career transition or championing initiatives using CNCF technologies, my compassionate approach has a lasting impact on all who encounter me.

Join me on my mission to build a more inclusive and supportive tech community with the help of CNCF. Let's create a future where collaboration thrives, knowledge is freely shared, and everyone is supported and empowered on their journey to success.

name: Ramiro Alvarez Fernandez
bio: Ramiro is a Senior DevOps Engineer with extensive experience in cloud infrastructure, and engineering leadership with solid experience in technologies such as Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, MongoDB. Ramiro's day-to-day involves managing Kubernetes clusters, orchestrating CI/CD pipelines, and overseeing Elasticsearch and MongoDB environments, all while pushing the limits of AWS, GCP, and Azure. Ramiro is deeply passionate about Cloud FinOps, Observability, and optimizing cloud resource efficiency. Ramiro actively contribute to the cloud native community by sharing insights through presentations at conferences and wrote articles on different sites.

name: Ramkumar Nagaraj
bio: I am working in Adobe Systems Pvt Ltd as a Senior Cloud Engineer with total 18 years experience in IT industry. Strive in learing and adapting new technologies as per the industry trend in my projects. Kickstarted as Unix administrator and over the period of time enriched working experience in multiple portfolios like configuration management tools (puppet, ansible) and landed in containerisation plus orchestration. Progressing to explore more on AI and ML so i can implement those learnings in my projects.

name: Ramya D
bio: Just a K8s lover. By profession I’m a Cloud Support Engineer at Amazon and an EKS SME exploring the world of open source!

name: Randy Weeren

He emphasizes designing scalable cloud architectures, optimizing DevOps processes, and ensuring a robust security infrastructure. He thrives in a culture of collaboration and innovation, contributing to organizational success.

name: Raoul Niyo
bio: I am an experienced DevOps/SRE. I have worked on multiple projects using Kubernetes and other CNCF technologies such as argoCD, Trivy, Cilium, Harbor, Calico, and FluxCD. I am an avid learner of anything related to cloud computing, configuration management, CI/CD, Programming, and Linux. In my spare time, I routinely play with other CNCF Products on service mesh(Istio, Linkerd), Kubernetes cluster management at scale(ClusterAPI), and any other tools in the CNCF landscape that catches my curiosity.

name: Raphael Ben Habereder

name: Raphaël Pinson
bio:
Raphaël Pinson is a seasoned Solutions Architect with over 15 years of experience in the tech industry. He specializes in Kubernetes, Terraform, and Cilium, and currently works at Isovalent. Raphaël is passionate about bridging the gap between DevOps and Cloud Native communities, and he's excited to represent CNCF as a co-organizer of the Swiss Romandie (Lausanne chapter) CNCF meetup and regular speaker at industry events. Raphaël has contributed to various CNCF projects. His public work can be found at https://polywork.com/raphink.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to become a CNCF ambassador because it allows me to expand my impact and bring Cloud Native technology to a wider audience. By representing CNCF and bridging the gap between Cloud Native and other communities, I hope to further advance our industry's growth and adoption. It's an honor to be part of a community of talented and passionate advocates who are driving innovation and making a difference in the tech world.

name: Raquel Fabiani Touoyem
bio: Cloud-Native & Security Architect | 11+ Years Crafting Secure, Resilient, Scalable and cost effective Solutions for Global Enterprises. Results-oriented Cloud and Security Architect with over 11 years of experience in designing, implementing, and securing advanced systems for global organizations. Specializing in cloud-native technologies, I bring deep expertise in Kubernetes security, Falco, Cilium, and service mesh to drive modernization, scalability, and security across complex environments. Proficient in cloud transformation and modernization strategies, I excel at building secure, scalable architectures leveraging Zero Trust principles and defense-in-depth methodologies. My hands-on approach to integrating innovative tools like Kubernetes-native security solutions ensures comprehensive protection and operational efficiency. A collaborative leader, I thrive in fast-paced, deadline-driven settings, mastering cloud native technologies which are essential to protect today critical applications. With exceptional communication and presentation skills, I effectively bridge the gap between business requirements and cutting-edge technical solutions.

name: Rashendra Gunawardena
bio: Rashendra, who has been working as a Principal Software Engineer at NAB in Melbourne Australia, is a cloud enthusiastic and a technology influencer. A professional in the industry with 14 years of experience across finance, aviation and auto mobile IT industry. He spend his free time contributing to AWS certifications as a SME and writing blogs.

name: Rasmus Steiniche
bio: Focus on Cloud Native Data and Machine Learning. Organizer at Cloud Native Nordics and Cloud Native Aarhus. Speaker at more than 40 events a year, e.g. industrial events (OT), Mini MBA in AI, CNCF events, private company events.

name: Raul Sanchez Reyes
bio: I am a dynamic software developer and DevOps engineer with deep expertise in Azure and AWS, showcasing my commitment to excellence in building resilient, high-performing cloud architectures. I specialize in crafting scalable, secure solutions tailored to meet client needs, leveraging the latest in cloud and DevOps technology. Driven by curiosity and innovation, I’m passionate about creating impactful, transformative solutions that elevate the tech landscape.

name: Ravichandra Cheeti
bio: I am an experienced DevOps engineer specializing in managing multi-cloud environments, with a primary focus on containerized workloads in both managed and self-hosted Kubernetes clusters. I am passionate about designing and architecting scalable, robust cloud and Kubernetes infrastructures.

name: Ravipati Murali Krishna
bio: Senior DevOps Engineer at Dish Network Technologies India, specializing in cloud infrastructure and automation. With expertise in AWS and Azure, I work with a variety of DevOps tools, including Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, Dynatrace, Logz, Github, Gitlab to streamline deployments and enhance system reliability. Focused on automating and optimizing CI/CD pipelines, I specialize in building scalable, resilient, and secure cloud-native solutions. I excel in designing high-availability architectures and implementing best practices for DevOps, ensuring seamless deployments and operational efficiency in dynamic environments.

name: Rayaguru Satyanarayan Dash
bio: Meet Rayaguru, a seasoned database expert with over 18 years of hands-on experience across a spectrum of database technologies, for clients seeking migration, design, and performance tuning solutions. He has empowered numerous clients to optimize their systems, ensuring seamless operations and enhanced efficiency. With a passion for unravelling complexities and a track record of delivering impactful solutions, Rayaguru continues to be a driving force in the realm of database consultancy.

name: Regina Voloshin
bio:
I am an OSS Tech Lead at Codefresh by Octopus Deploy, an ArgoCD maintainer and involved with the Argo community. I am also a speaker at CNCF events (GitOpsCon, ArgoCon, KubeDay Israel). I also actively encourage and inspire others to contribute to CNCF projects and to speak at conferences.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I love being part of and collaborating with the cloud-native OSS community. In addition to the great benefit of using OSS, I strongly believe that adopting the methodology used to write, maintain and release OSS widely benefits any organization. CNCF makes cloud-native OSS accessible to everyone, and I am excited to take part in fostering the CNCF ecosystem and increasing the OSS adoption.

name: Remy Mollandin
