I enjoy working on scalable and fault-tolerant infrastructure, ensuring high availability and security in cloud-native environments. I am always excited about tackling complex challenges related to containers, automation, and compliance in modern DevOps workflows. My interests also extend to cloud security, where I focus on implementing best practices to safeguard distributed systems. I am always eager to contribute to the open-source community, exchange knowledge, and collaborate on innovative solutions.

name: Shubhasis Mathur
bio: Shubhasis Mathur is a seasoned Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft with over 16 years of experience in designing and implementing cloud solutions. He has played a pivotal role in organizing CNCF Delhi meetups at Microsoft’s Noida office and has delivered numerous seminars on cloud technologies. Shubhasis specializes in Azure, Kubernetes, and other CNCF technologies, and is recognized for his expertise in leveraging the Cloud Adoption Framework and Well-Architected Framework principles. He is also an active blogger, sharing insights on cloud architecture and best practices. Connect with him on LinkedIn(https://www.linkedin.com/in/shubhasis-mathur-14997064/).

name: Shujauddin Mazhar Mohammad
bio: I am a seasoned Cloud DevOps engineer and I have been in IT for over 13 years now working with multiple state government/other clients from healthcare and financial domains. I specialize in designing and managing scalable solutions across both public and private clouds. My expertise encompasses CI/CD pipelines, container orchestration with Kubernetes, infrastructure/application deployment automation using GitOps principles, implementation and integration of latest tools and technologies. Adhering to the "as code" principle, I ensure all configurations are version-controlled and reproducible, enhancing consistency and collaboration. With a strong emphasis on security, I ensure robust and efficient deployment processes that safeguard our systems while driving innovation and operational excellence via automation. I love open source technologies, CNCF projects and with a peaked interest in AI/ML, you'll find me exploring the latest tech and trends in the industry. I believe there is always some room to improve and I keep pushing my limits everyday.

name: Shukri Ali
bio: Shukri is a platform engineer with experience building and managing fully integrated Kubernetes platform in production. She works with a wide range of CNCF tools, focusing on automation, reliability, and enabling developers. Shukri co-leads an internal Kubernetes community, runs CKA training, and is passionate about continuous learning and sharing knowledge with other engineers.

name: Shunsuke Yoshikawa
bio: I have several years of experience as an engineer in the Cloud Native domain, primarily focusing on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). My expertise lies in the design, construction, and operation of cloud infrastructure. I am also a member of the organizing team for the Platform Engineering Meetup community in Japan.
slack_id: Display Name: Shunsuke Yoshikawa, Member ID: U07B475FLFM

name: Shyam Kumar
bio: Project Experience: Helm, Kubernetes, Container Network Interface (CNI), Argo, cert-manager, Calico AWS Cloud Architect / DevOps specialist with over 9 years of work experience, I am passionate about designing, developing, and deploying scalable and reliable cloud solutions using AWS. Currently, I work at Deloitte Digital, where I consult with clients from various industries and domains to help them run their applications and infrastructure to the cloud, and implement DevOps best practices and tools. Previously, I worked as a consultant for AWS Professional Services and a senior infrastructure consultant for Thoughtworks, where I gained valuable experience in cloud architecture, automation, configuration management, and security.My mission is to leverage my expertise to deliver innovative and impactful cloud solutions that meet the needs and expectations of my clients and stakeholders. I am thrilled to serve as a CNCF ambassador as it presents an exceptional chance to play an active role in shaping the landscape of cloud-native technologies, a realm characterised by its dynamic and fast-paced nature. In this capacity, I aim to cultivate cooperation and facilitate the exchange of insights within a diverse community of industry experts, thereby propelling the adoption and comprehension of cloud-native methodologies. This role is not only invigorating but also allows me to spearhead innovation and engage with fellow enthusiasts and authorities within the CNCF network, all while advocating for the expansion of these groundbreaking technologies

name: Sidarte Rangadamalou
bio: I am Sidarte Rangadamalou, a Cloud Operations Engineer at Capgemini. I hold numerous certifications, including Kubernetes, AWS Practitioner, Azure Administrator, Terraform Associate, and Prometheus Associate. I am passionate about learning new things and constantly seek to expand my knowledge in multi-cloud environments and AI. In my free time, I enjoy traveling and have a deep love for making and listening to music. My ultimate goal is to achieve multi-cloud certification and expertise in AI.

name: Sidibe Sangbé
bio: As a DevOps Engineer I am passionate about New Technologies and Automation. I have a thirst for knowledge, I am curious and I like to face new challenges. For me "Once you get to the top of the mountain, you have to keep climbing".

name: Sidney Alexandre Pagel
bio: Sou um apaixonado por tecnologia, entusiasta do software livre e das alternativas abertas. Tenho 20 anos de experiência em infra estrutura on-premises e ultimamente tenho focado em me especializar em tecnologias voltadas para nuvem.

name: Silas Bechet
bio: I am a DevOps Engineer passionate about cloud technologies, working extensively with GCP and AWS. Whenever possible, I adopt cloud-agnostic solutions to ensure flexibility and innovation in my projects.

name: Simen Krantz Knudsen
bio: Simen works as a developer and technical architect in a platform team, with a focus on Kubernetes, Ansible/AWX, Hashicorp Terraform and Azure. As a Kubestronaut, Simen is looking forward to be a more active part of the CNCF community.

name: Simen Røstvik
bio: Simen is half Cloud Engineer, half Platform Engineer, full on bodger. I enjoy making things work in ways they necessarily weren't supposed to, this sometimes makes it into written words on different blogging platforms. Professionally I create Cloud Native platforms, with the customers HCL based IaC tool of choice, running Kubernetes managed by Flux and Helm. After hours I contribute to Open Source projects like LinuxServer.io and engage in Norwegian communities involving programming and tech.

name: Simeon Poot-Worrell
bio: Hoi, I'm Simeon, a platform engineer (Gopher) from the Netherlands with a passion for leveraging the power of Kubernetes to simplify complex processes and enhance the overall reliability and performance of applications. My focus areas encompass security, automation, and observability, ensuring that each cluster is robust, efficient, and transparent. In my journey, I am excited to contribute to and grow within the vibrant Kubernetes community, driving forward the future of cloud-native development.

name: Simon Forster
bio:
Simon Forster is a cloud native technology architect and engineer based in London. Simon has extensive experience working in heavily regulated financial institutions on the design, delivery and security of critical cloud native applications. He has a specific focus on ensuring cloud native technologies deliver against business goals. As co-chair of the CNCF Cartografos Group, Simon developed and co-authored the CNCF Cloud Native Maturity Model and the CNCF children’s book “Admiral Bash’s Island Adventure”. He has contributed to both the Business Value Subcommittee and Financial Services User Group.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As a longtime member of the cloud native community, I’m excited to evangelise its mission. I look forward to mentoring and training members of the community, no matter the technical skill set, to better understand why cloud native serves digital innovation and meets business goals. I strongly believe that every person in the community can help drive cloud native forward and am excited to help achieve this goal.

name: Simon Hess
bio: With a background in electrical engineering, I have extensive experience in communication technologies and embedded systems, where I integrated machine learning techniques into various projects. This interdisciplinary work deepened my interest in AI technologies and modern distributed systems. Recognizing the convergence of these fields within the cloud-native ecosystem, I transitioned into this area to leverage my diverse expertise. In the cloud-native field, I apply my background to develop scalable, efficient, and intelligent solutions that bridge hardware and software domains.

name: Simon Ngang
bio: I started my DevOps and cloud-native journey back in 2018 and have become skilled in Kubernetes and Infrastructure as Code. Prior to my current experience as a DevOps and Cloud Consultant, I used to be a lecturer, teaching cloud-native technologies and data-driven applications design. I keep mentoring and helping many people in their DevOps and Cloud journey.

name: Simon Quatresols
bio: Simon is an experienced software and systems engineer who is grateful for the opportunity to work with Kubernetes and other CNCF projects every day. His key areas of interest include automation, site reliability and observability. He regularly attends local technology-related meetups, such as the CNCF Meetup Linz, and invests time daily to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the open-source and cloud-native ecosystems.

name: Simon Reddy Kommareddy
bio: Simon Reddy Kommareddy is a Senior Specialist at Netcompany with over a decade of experience in the IT and cloud engineering industry. Specializing in DevOps, Kubernetes, and cloud solutions (AWS, Azure), Simon has a proven track record of designing and managing secure, scalable infrastructures for Kubernetes applications. He excels in using tools like Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and optimizing CI/CD pipelines to ensure seamless software releases. Simon’s expertise spans cloud platforms, container orchestration, full-stack development, and Salesforce CRM, with a strong foundation in programming languages such as C# .NET, Java, and ReactJS. Simon brings a comprehensive approach to solving complex cloud and infrastructure challenges, holding a Master’s degree and multiple certifications in IT and Cloud Technology. He has demonstrated leadership in coordinating multi-disciplinary teams to deliver secure, reliable, and efficient cloud solutions while maintaining high standards of software quality and operational excellence.

name: Simone Bruzzese
bio: I work as a Cloud and Kubernetes Engineer, specializing in infrastructure. I help companies in their cloud journeys, enabling them to adopt open-source technologies and modern approaches such as Infrastructure as Code and GitOps. I am an everyday user (and lover) of CNCF technologies, like Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, Cert-Manager, Nginx, and many more. Every year I attend local events, as KCD Italy, to connect with the amazing people from the Community.

name: Sivakumar Viyalan
bio: Experienced Software Development Specialist with 14 years of expertise in designing, developing, and maintaining applications across diverse technologies, including C++, Python, Oracle SQL, Linux, and Shell Scripting. Proficient in cloud computing with expertise in AWS and Google Cloud Platform, alongside hands-on experience with Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for container orchestration. Skilled in leveraging Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to optimize deployments and infrastructure management. Passionate about Kubernetes since 2021, which inspired me to earn the Kubernetes certifications, further deepening my knowledge and expertise in container orchestration and cloud-native technologies.

name: Sivakumar Viyalan
bio: Experienced Software Development Specialist with 14 years of expertise in designing, developing, and maintaining applications across diverse technologies, including C++, Python, Oracle SQL, Linux, and Shell Scripting. Proficient in cloud computing with expertise in AWS and Google Cloud Platform, alongside hands-on experience with Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for container orchestration. Skilled in leveraging Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to optimize deployments and infrastructure management. Passionate about Kubernetes since 2021, which inspired me to earn the Kubernetes certifications, further deepening my knowledge and expertise in container orchestration and cloud-native technologies.

name: Sjouke De Vries
bio: I’m interested in Kubernetes, IaC, Argo CD, and all things that are cloud-native in general. I have a MSc in Computing Science Distributed Systems and Software Engineering, and am looking to contribute to open-source projects and collaborate on freelance projects.

name: Sneha Kangralkar
bio: Working as a Cloud Engineer in the Australian Telco industry, my experience spans across 4G/5G transport network solutions & the DevOps of an OpenStack & Kubernetes based private cloud, hosting the 4G/5G core network. I love collaborating across teams & vendors to implement cutting-edge cloud-native technologies & I thrive in the Kubernetes world. Hosting 4G/5G core on bare-metal Kubernetes across varied cloud technologies is my current passion project.

name: Sofonias Mengistu
bio: I'm Sofonias, a dedicated DevOps Engineer with 14 years of hands-on IT experience, 5 of which specialize in cloud-native technologies. I hold certifications like KCSA KCNA, CKA, CKAD, and CKS, demonstrating my expertise in cloud and container orchestration. I have successfully led numerous cloud-native projects, excelling in implementing, managing, and securing Kubernetes environments. Beyond my current role at Gebeya.INC, I actively share my knowledge through meetups and webinars, showcasing my passion for CNCF technologies. Currently, I focus on Kubernetes engineering for a Safaricom project at Gebeya.INC

name: Soojin Lee
bio: Hello. I'm Soojin Lee, a Cloud Architect and GKE Engineer at Megazone Soft. Through my experience as a Google Workspace engineer, I have been providing support and technical advice on governance (such as Cloud ID), which has led me to become interested in Keycloak and related cloud-native systems. I enjoy sharing my knowledge and experiences with Kubernetes through my blog and by actively participating in the community. I'm also one of tech ambassadors for Naver Cloud and co-host of Pangyo user meetups in the Naver Cloud User Community. - My blog: lifeoncloud.kr - Naver Cloud User Community: https://www.meetup.com/navercloud-user-community/

name: Soto Sugita
bio: I am a cloud infrastructure architect who loves Kubernetes. I help customers use cloud and Kubernetes.

name: Sourabh Sharma
bio:
Sourabh Sharma is a Senior Engineering Manager specializing in Cloud, DevSecOps, and Platform Engineering, based out of Dubai, UAE. A highly skilled and passionate engineering leader, he brings hands-on expertise in multi and hybrid cloud environments, with deep experience in automating infrastructure through "Everything as Code" practices. Sourabh has successfully led cloud transformations and implemented secure, scalable DevSecOps pipelines across Azure, AWS, and GCP, ensuring seamless product deployment while upholding the highest standards of security and compliance. With a proven track record of optimizing cloud architectures, enhancing resilience, and driving high availability for mission-critical systems, Sourabh delivers innovative and efficient cloud solutions.

His experience spans multiple industries, including Finance, Banking, E-commerce, Retail, Travel & Hospitality, and Telecom. He thrives in leading and empowering diverse teams to deliver cutting-edge, secure cloud solutions while ensuring operational excellence through automation, security, and monitoring practices.

name: Sourav Bera
bio: • Solution Architect at Microsoft, specialized in AKS and GKE. • Linux Certified. • Community Speaker, Judge, and Mentor. • Organizes and speaks at CNCG Chapter (Delhi, Gurugram, Noida), Azure Developer Community, and Microsoft Reactor Program. • Expert in Managed Kubernetes Services. • Researcher and Hackathon Advocate: https://www.linkedin.com/in/zeo-shark/details/publications/ • Active on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/zeo-shark/

name: Spoorthi Palakshaiah
bio: Spoorthi is a DevOps Engineer with a strong background in building scalable, resilient, and secure cloud-native infrastructure. Her expertise spans Kubernetes, Helm, AWS, Terraform, observability, automation, and CI/CD pipelines. Passionate about leveraging the power of data and cloud to create innovative and impactful products and services that solve real-world problems.

name: Sreejith Anujan
bio: Sreejith has been involved with Free and Opensource Software (FOSS) since 2001 in the Kerala region of India. Started working with Kubernetes from 2015 on OpenShift 3 version from Red Hat, helping enterprises choose the right containerized solutions for their mission-critical workloads - both as a technical and salesperson. Currently, Sreejith serves as the organizer of the Cloud Native Kerala chapter. Sreejith was one of the organizers of the first-ever KCD and DevOpsDays event in Kerala that attracted more than 550+ attendees in 2024. Sreejith currently focuses on designing and delivering workshops and tailored training to strategic customers of Red Hat across APAC. https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-kerala/ https://kcdkerala.in/ https://devopsdayskerala.in/

name: Sreenivas Chokkarapu
bio: I am a certified Kubernetes expert, having achieved all CNCF Kubernetes certifications (CKA, CKS, CKAD, KCNA, and KCSA), with extensive experience in cloud-native technologies, automation, and security. With over 11 years in DevOps and SRE, I specialize in Kubernetes, Terraform, GitOps (ArgoCD), CI/CD (GitHub Actions), and cloud security across GCP and AWS. I focus on optimizing infrastructure, implementing security best practices, and automating deployments to improve system reliability. I stay up to date with the latest CNCF trends through meetups and technical content.

name: Sreenivasa Rao Vadalasetty
bio: Sreenivas is a cloud consultant with 20+ years of experience in IT, specialized in Cloud Architecture, Microservices, and DevSecOps. Prior to this, he was a senior consultant with AWS Professional Services. He has helped Fortune 500 companies realize their business outcomes in their cloud migration journey and led large scale IT projects at global level. He enjoys exploring the latest developments in IT and identifying business enablers.

name: Srikanth Pathipati
bio: A technology enthusiast with a strong focus on cloud-native technologies. I specialize in Kubernetes, containerization, and infrastructure automation within the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Stan Hoe
bio:
Stan Hoe is a Solution Architect based in the APJ region, specializing in Cloud Native Security. As one of the first in the world and the first in Singapore to attain the prestigious title of Kubestronaut, Stan brings unparalleled expertise to the field and is dedicated to educating organizations and communities about the importance of cloud native security, serving as a vocal advocate for robust practices. Some of the cloud native security tools that Stan specializes in include Trivy, Kube-Bench, Kube-Hunter, Tracee, Starboard, and Chainbench.

Stan is also an active participant and speaker at prominent CNCF and cybersecurity events, including ISC2 Secure Singapore, KubeDay Singapore 2023, StandCon 2023, and K8SUG Meetups, where he covered an array of cloud native security topics such as: • Combatting the Unknowns with Aqua Tracee & eBPF • Cloud Native: The Security Awakens • Zero-day RCE Vulnerability Spring4Shell: What does it mean in Cloud Native? • Understand the 3 Essential Pillars of Cloud Native Security He holds a plethora of professional certifications across cybersecurity, cloud, and cloud native domains, including the 5 cloud native certifications, CISSP, CCSP, CSSLP, CCSK, CCZT, CEH, and more. His published paper, which received the Best Paper Award at IEEE SOLI 2021, can be accessed at: "ASIST: Automated Strategic Partners Ranking and Recommendation System Using NLP and Security Intelligence," 2021 IEEE International Conference on Service Operations and Logistics, and Informatics (SOLI), 2021 (https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9672369).

name: Stanislav Kolenkin
bio: I have been working in the IT industry for 16+ years and has enormous hands-on and managerial experience with the most innovative DevOps projects using Kubernetes,  OpenStack, AWS, GCP, and Bare-Metal tech stacks. My professional achievements are numerous certificates, including SEI Software Architecture Professional Certificate, Kubernetes, AWS, GCP Certifications, and many others. Along with his outstanding architect skills and vast industry knowledge, I am proficient in critical problem-solving and excels in dealing with non-standard production issues.

name: Stathis Kapaniaris
bio: My name is Stathis Kapaniaris and I am a Software and Cloud Engineer, originally coming from Greece and based in Vienna, Austria. My everyday working life is around Kubernetes eco-system and various other CNCF-projects. I visit frequently CNCF hosted events, such as Kubecon and KCD. Aside from professional usage, I also use Kubernetes in private, home made projects and publish tutorials about them in https://devs-in-the-cloud.medium.com/

name: Stefan Luteijn
bio: I graduated in history and aspirations to be come a teacher. When this dream did not come to be, I found a new love in IT and open source projects. Kubernetes and everything around it quickly turned my job into a hobby. I'm currently working as a cloud engineer consultant to help customers onboard to the kubernetes platform.

name: Stefan Möhrle
bio: Stefan is the co-founder and DevOps consultant at corewire GmbH, specializing in Kubernetes, AWS, and CI/CD pipelines. With a strong focus on DevOps, DevSecOps, and developer experience, he helps teams optimize their workflows through hands-on training and consulting. Stefan is also an active member of the DevOps community, maintainer of the keycloak-provider for crossplane and takes part in organizing the DevOps Meetup Freiburg.
location: Freiburg im Breisgau, Baden Württemberg, Germany

name: Stefan Peer
bio: System Engineer, passionate about Kubernetes and the CNCF ecosystem, with a strong focus on infrastructure automation.

name: Steffen Petersen
bio: Steffen is an experienced DevOps consultant specializing in cloud-native technologies and Kubernetes. He has worked with, and are proficient in, all layers of the stack, ranging from low-level networking all the way to optimizing observability of running workloads. Besides his day-to-day tasks of helping customers with various issues, another part of his job consists of running courses where he teaches cloud-native technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Helm and ArgoCD.

name: Stephan Kühne
bio: Stephan is a SystemEngineer and Teamlead mainly focused on technologies from VMware and opensource communities. Starting in 2009, he dealt with bare metal server but worked his way through the entire stack up into the cloud native domain. He is doing Meetups, writing techincall blogs and simply loves to play with new technology.

name: Steven Eichberg
bio: I've been working as a DevOps Engineer/SRE for about two years now. I like learning new things and challenging myself.

name: Steven Trescinski
bio: DevOps minded, Cloud focused Open Source enthusiast with a deep and growing passion for Linux, Containers, Orchestrators, Microservices and Chaos Engineering. Always on the lookout for new technologies that help drive automation for both development and operational teams.

name: Ståle Dagfinrud
bio: Linux/Network/Security/Cloud/Container geek

name: Stéphane Este-Gracias
bio:
For many years now, I have been a strong advocate for the development and promotion of free and open-source software. My passion for this cause has led me to actively participate in various initiatives, such as organizing the Cloud Native Luxembourg meetups and being part of the French localization team of CNCF Glossary. I'm dedicated to promoting the benefits of open-source software, believing it to be more secure, reliable, and conducive to innovation. Additionally, I leverage my expertise to help teams harness cloud-native technologies, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Drawing from my passion for open-source, I will strive to promote the ethos of collaboration, emphasizing the merits of open-source projects within the CNCF landscape and encouraging more entities to contribute and participate. I am committed to guiding the next generation of cloud native enthusiasts. Through mentorship programs and hands-on training sessions, I aim to reduce the learning curve for newcomers and ensure they have the necessary tools and knowledge to thrive within the ecosystem. In essence, as a CNCF Ambassador, my overarching goal is to be a catalyst for growth, learning, and innovation within the Cloud Native community, ensuring that it remains at the forefront of technological progress while upholding the values of collaboration, inclusivity, and open-source spirit.

name: Subbarao Turlapati
bio: I'm an application architect building and leading teams that build highly scalable distributed applications. Currently spearheading migrating on-prem applications that process millions of transactions per day to public cloud using Cloud Native technologies. I'm very passionate about technology and I'm very excited to keep learning new things everyday about Kubernetes and the eco system surrounding it.

name: Subham Saha
bio: I am a skilled Azure Container Services Support Engineer at Microsoft, specializing in Kubernetes and container-related services, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Container Registry (ACR), Azure Container Instance (ACI) , Istio . With extensive experience in cloud technologies and services , monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana, I also has a strong background in Linux system administration and enterprise infrastructure support from previous roles at Dassault Systèmes and Mphasis. I am actively engaged in the tech community, holding certifications such as CKA, CKAD, CKS, PCA,ICA, AZ-104 . You can connect with me on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/subham-saha-77786515?utm_source=share&utm_campaign=share_via&utm_content=profile&utm_medium=ios_app

name: Subhash Chandra Budde
bio: Started as a Java/J2EE developer involving in the product development across various organizations. After a long tenure of 15 years in product development, transitioned in to cloud-native space covering Containers, Kubernetes, DevOps, Serverless and other related technologies/frameworks. Currently working as Principal Cloud Architect to help the customers deploy their enterprise scale cloud-native applications on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Active member of CNCF Hyderabad community for the past 2 years. https://medium.com/@subhashchandra.b

name: Sudha Koushik Bodla
bio: SudhaKoushik is a seasoned cloud Engineer with over a decade of expertise in the IT industry. He is driven by a strong passion for continuous learning, knowledge sharing and collaborative innovation. His technical expertise lies in cloud-native technologies particularly Kubernetes/Openshift, Openstack, Helm, Docker, Grafana, Ansible and Vault.

name: Sudha Raghavan
bio:
Sudha is the VP for all the services in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Developer Platform. OCI’s developer services aim to improve productivity for all roles performed by Developer Security Operations engineers. Enabling a secure, fast, and connected developer platform across all Oracle internal and external cloud engineers is her team’s goal. She prides herself in running numerous large cloud scale distributed services developed in house using open-source technologies.

She is also a founding committee member of the Oracle Women’s Leadership (OWL), Seattle chapter and runs several mentoring rings. She has a Masters in Computer Science and has previously worked at Microsoft Bing. She is a goal-driven technology leader with a passion to attract more women into leadership positions.

name: Suhel Multani
bio: I am a skilled DevOps professional with deep expertise in Kubernetes and a passion for building scalable, cloud-native infrastructure. I thrive on automating processes, optimizing CI/CD pipelines, and delivering robust, containerized solutions. With a commitment to continuous learning and innovation, I excel in creating efficient workflows that bridge development and operations, ensuring high reliability and seamless deployments.

name: Sujay Kumar J
bio: Experienced software engineer

name: Suman Chakraborty
bio: Suman Chakraborty is a Senior Cloud Native Architect with VMware by Broadcom. Suman helps customers in their application modernization journey using Cloud Native technologies and DevOps best practises. He has been a strong advocate of Open Source technology and a community person where he speaks on Kubernetes, Containers, Serverless and other topics within the CNCF ecosystem. Suman has been a seasoned International Speaker in Open Source Summit (EU), Devops India Summit, AWS User Group, Docker Community Event, HashiTalks, KCD Pune over past few years. AWS UserGroup - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0uBIvzydL1c&t=8s Knative event - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k0NXFr5iEFE Hasitalks - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qr_f85EuslQ&t=1s

name: Suneesh Kumar
bio: As the Vice President of Technology at Urolime Technologies, I drive innovation and excellence in technology with a focus on cloud solutions, containerization, and strategic IT management. With a diverse skill set and a passion for emerging technologies, I leverage my certifications—AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Kubestronaut, and Red Hat Certified Architect (RHCA)—to lead transformative initiatives and optimize our technological landscape. My expertise spans across multiple domains including Kubernetes, Docker, Serverless Technologies, Function-as-a-Service (FaaS), Cloud Architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP), DevOps, DevSecOps, FinOps, DataOps, and AI/ML. I thrive on navigating complex technical challenges and turning them into opportunities for growth and efficiency. By aligning technology with business objectives, I ensure that our solutions are both innovative and strategically sound. I am deeply committed to fostering a culture of continuous learning and collaboration within my teams. Outside of my professional role, I enjoy mentoring emerging tech professionals and staying engaged with the latest industry trends and advancements.

name: Sunghun Son
bio: Sunghun Son is a DevOps engineer with more than six years of experience in the industry and academia. He specializes in software development using TypeScript and Python, as well as GitLab, application modernization, DevSecOps, and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) implementations. Sunghun is currently focused on solving real-world problems through IT, such as publishing AI-translated GitLab documentation with ChatGPT and developing chatbots for technical content review.

name: Sunil Hari
bio: I am a passionate Cloud Architect and DevSecOps Engineer with 15 years of expertise in designing scalable and secure cloud solutions. With a strong foundation in Cloud Native Technologies, I specialize in integrating security into DevOps practices to ensure robust, efficient, and compliant systems. My journey is driven by continuous learning, and I take pride in combining technical skills with a collaborative approach to solve complex challenges and deliver impactful results.

name: Suryateja Ganta
bio: I work as a Principal SRE at Fidelity Investments. My expertise lies in DevOps, GitOps, MLOps and Production Engineering solutions. I primarily use CNCF open source technologies to develop and design robust platforms and solutions for production. I’m part of Container Platform Management team, primarily working on Kubernetes clusters deployed in public (AWS, Azure) and private (on-prem) clouds. Handling around ~650+ cluster including all the Environments. As an active member of many cloud communities and conferences, I love to discuss technical ideas and news.

name: Sven Pfennig
bio: Hi, I'm Sven 👋. A cloud native developer, open source contributor and Wasm enthusiast. I'm running the WebAssembly meetup in Munich and serving as tech lead in the TAG Runtime - Wasm working group. You can find me at cloud-native meetups in Hannover and northern Germany.

name: Sven Pimmer
bio: I am a System Engineer with a deep passion for Kubernetes, containerization, and cloud-native technologies. With extensive experience in installing and maintaining Kubernetes clusters, including in on-premise environments, I thrive on optimizing and bringing cloud-native applications everywhere.

name: Sverre Marvik Rutledal
bio: I am a Senior Infrastructure Engineer with a love for Automation, IaC and Kubernetes.

name: Swastik Gour
bio: Hi My name is Swastik I am an undergrad B.Tech student who is interested in cloud native domain . I have been an GSoC mentee at CNCF and also have been an LFX mentee at kyverno . I am also an lead organizer at CNCF jaipur chapter and sometimes write blog on cloud native topics

name: Swe Zin Myint
bio: I am a DevOps specialist with extensive hands-on experience in Kubernetes, which plays an integral role in my day-to-day work. I have developed a comprehensive understanding of Cloud Native tools and best practices, enabling me to design, deploy, and secure scalable infrastructure effectively. I am deeply passionate about troubleshooting complex issues, particularly with Istio, where I enjoy resolving challenges in service mesh configurations and microservice communication. I have a strong interest in cloud security and continuously explore strategies to implement Zero-Trust architectures, enhance container security, and ensure robust governance for modern cloud-native environments.

name: Syed Asad Raza
bio:
Hi Team, I am DevOps and MultiCloud Engineer and happy to become a CNCF member to add some input to this journey.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It provides a platform to connect with other professionals in the industry, share knowledge and expertise, and contribute to the growth of the community. As an ambassador, one can learn about the latest developments and trends in the cloud-native ecosystem and play a role in shaping the future of the industry.

name: Sylvain Pierrot
bio: Curious by nature, I thrive at the intersection of software and hardware, exploring innovative ways to optimize, automate, and secure modern infrastructures. I’m drawn to the deeper layers of computing, from kernel development to hardware interactions and networking protocols. Beyond problem-solving, I value adaptability, resilience, and collaboration, believing that complex systems are best built through knowledge-sharing and open dialogue. I enjoy contributing to open-source projects, mentoring peers, and speaking at industry events. For me, technology is about understanding how things work, from transistors to distributed systems, and finding ways to bridge the gaps. I always approach challenges with curiosity, pragmatism, and a desire to push boundaries.

name: Szymon Kodrebski
bio: Engineer, System Administrator, Cloud Platform, and DevOps Expert with over 15 years of experience in designing, implementing, and optimizing cloud-based solutions. Specializing in Kubernetes, AWS, GCP, and infrastructure automation, with a focus on creating resilient, scalable systems that empower organizations to achieve operational excellence. A proponent of automating everything and ensuring infrastructure is entirely written as code, enabling consistency, scalability, and efficiency. Strongly supports practices such as Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD, and GitOps, with a focus to simplifying complex challenges and driving innovation in cloud environments. Actively mentors team members and fosters a culture of continuous learning and improvement. "Currently, I'm deeply engaged in DevOps and Cloud Solutions, leveraging my experience to design and build cutting-edge cloud infrastructure. I'm deep diving into AWS, GCP and Kubernetes and I love this direction!"

name: Sébastien Davoult
bio:
Passionate about Virtualization, Containerization and Observability technologies, I have made it my job. Today, I accompany our customers in their #MoveToCloud transformation mainly on OnPremise environments by maximizing the use of OpenSource products. Much more than just products, OpenSource is for me a philosophy. I love to share and transmit on the subjects which impassion me, I do it with students, conferences, and also by publishing specialized blogs posts.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am very happy and excited to have joined this program. It will allow me to promote the Cloud Native more widely in France. It's a subject that is still unknown in some companies and the specialized content is often not translated from English. My goal is to promote the power of the Cloud Native through French articles, Meetups, and conferences.

name: Süleyman Kütükoğlu
bio: I am Süleyman from Türkiye, deeply involved in DevOps with a strong focus on Kubernetes. As a Co-Founder at RNG Technology GmbH, we facilitate comprehensive infrastructure solutions for businesses across Türkiye, Germany and Europe.

name: Tabish Athar
bio: I'm working as a DevOps and SRE Professional with 8 years of experience and with a passion for exploring new technologies and taking on challenges. I bring a wealth of expertise in cloud infrastructure, especially focused on GCP, as well as AWS and Azure. I have expertise in Kubernetes, OpenShift, Cloud Native Development, Microservices, Operators, CI/CD, Observability, Infrastructure, Security, Data. When I’m not optimizing cloud infrastructures, you can find me doing research and investment in the Stock Market and collecting Sneakers. Let’s connect and explore how we can collaborate on exciting projects!

name: Tada Kim
bio: I am a Site Reliability Engineer who is passionate about learning new things and has a keen interest in cloud-native solutions and open source technologies.

name: Taehun Kim
bio: Machine Learning Engineer with a strong background in embedded systems development. Currently focused on DevOps, DataOps, and MLOps, with an emphasis on solution architecture. (https://blog.taehun.dev/)

name: Taira Aoki
bio: I joined AP Communications Co., Ltd. in April 2024 and currently work as an engineer in the cloud native domain with a focus on Microsoft Azure. In my work, I mainly deal with AKS, Terraform, GitHub, ArgoCD, etc. Recently, I have been interested in Platform Engineering and have been speaking at conferences and verifying Backstage Software Template.

name: Taisuke Koroku
bio: I am a Cloud Architect passionate about SRE and Platform Engineering. I specialize in designing and implementing multi-tenant platforms on Kubernetes. Proficient in Kubernetes, GitOps and Azure, I am currently exploring Service Mesh and OpenTelemetry to enhance system reliability and observability. I am committed to building scalable, resilient, and cloud-native infrastructure while staying engaged with the community.

name: Taivo Pikkmets
bio: Infinitely curious about all things technology, with a special interest in DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering. Passionate about developing my skills and staying current with industry trends and technologies. I love sharing my knowledge and discussing challenging topics to support others in their development and success.

name: Takahiro Fukushima
bio: I'm a software engineer specializing in cloud architecture, infrastructure construction, and DevOps. I'm passionate about platform engineering and have expertise in building development platforms using containers. I'm always keeping up with the latest trends in Kubernetes.

name: Takao Indoh
bio: Takao is a Senior Professional Engineer of the Linux development division at Fujitsu. He has contributed to several open source communities more than 20 years. He has worked for Linux kernel RAS feature, especially crash dump feature like netdump, diskdump and kdump. He has also joined QEMU, OpenStack, Kubernetes, and more OSS projects and contributed to them. Now he is leading a support team of Linux-based products for Fujitsu's customers.

name: Takashi Sato
bio: I'm working for system engineering as developer and consultant. I'm following Kubernetes as Cloud Native Technology and trying Knative, CI/CD (with concourse and ArgoCD) and more. I'm aiming kubernetes specialist.

name: Takuto Tsugawa
bio: i love Kubernetes! i am working as cloud engineer, but i wont to work as frontend , backend, and so on engineer. this is my website https://kisama2000.cloud/ please visit my site! and contact to me!

name: Tal Yitzhak
bio: I'm a passionate DevOps Engineer and Solutions Architect with expertise in cloud-native technologies and a strong focus on CNCF projects like ArgoCD, Argo Rollouts, OpenTelemetry, and Jaeger. Through my blog posts on Medium, active participation in the CNCF community, and contributions to various projects such as ArgoCD and Argo Rollouts, I aim to promote and educate others about the benefits of cloud-native technologies. As a CNCF member, I continue to support the community through my work with CNCF Projects i'm passionate about like Argo, OpenTelemetry and Jaeger. Connect with me on Medium (https://medium.com/@talyitzhak) to explore real-world production use cases and insights into CNCF technologies.

name: Tamas Radvanszki
bio: Results-driven cloud-native engineer with expertise in Kubernetes, distributed systems, cloud-native technologies and NoSQL solutions. Skilled in designing and implementing scalable architectures with a strong focus on workload security, traffic and policy management to enhance system security, reliability, and performance. Experienced in optimizing service mesh solutions, automating infrastructure, and ensuring high availability in large-scale environments. Passionate about driving innovation and operational efficiency in modern cloud ecosystems.

name: Tamilmozhi Gunasekar
bio: I am a Software Engineering Architect working at Ribbon Communications. I enjoy learning new things. I continuously strive to expand my knowledge in this ever-evolving field of Software development. I specialize in Kubernetes, Angular, AWS, Cloud Native Architecture and Microservices.

name: Tan Tong Peng
bio:
Tong Peng is a curious and enthusiastic individual with a passion for continuous learning and acquiring new skills.

As a Senior Engineer, he has extensive expertise in software development, DevSecOps, and cloud-native technologies. With a strong background in leading software development projects, Tong Peng also has hands-on experience in containerizing workloads, migrating to Kubernetes, and implementing automation within the organization.

He is passionate about improving the developer experience for his fellow peers, and through automation and cloud-native technologies, he is dedicated to enhancing their quality of life.

Tong Peng remains dedicated to staying up-to-date with industry trends and advancements, continuously expanding his skill set to drive innovation and excellence in his work.

name: Tanguy Nicolas
bio: DevOps engineer, specializing in Cloud Computing. Enthused by Linux and Cloud Native technologies. Regular user of Helm, Terraform, Argo CD, Cilium, ...

name: Tao Wang
bio: I started getting in touch with Kubernetes (k8s) in early 2023. I took the lead in the cloud-native transformation of our company. I built the company's public and private cloud k8s clusters from scratch. My interests focus on areas such as k8s, service mesh, DevOps, and cloud-native security. As an architect, I also have extensive experience in microservices architecture and performance optimization.

name: Tarlan Huseynov
bio: Principal DevOps Engineer with a rich background in designing and implementing scalable, cloud-native infrastructure solutions. Known for a strategic approach in optimizing workflows and enhancing system reliability. Passionate about leveraging cloud technologies with IaC and coding expertise to drive innovation and efficiency.

name: Taskin Nehir Dogan
bio: I’m into Linux, Kubernetes, and AI. I like messing with infrastructure, building things, and seeing what I can push to the limit. When I’m not doing that, I’m probably tweaking my Linux setup or breaking something just to fix it again.

name: Taylor Christie
bio: I'm a platform engineer that focuses on cloud efficiency and operational excellence. I specialize in open source technologies, cloud cost optimization, and improving operational success in the cloud - specifically for companies that need to scale aggressively. I work heavily with kubernetes, FluxCD and Istio but have a lot of experience with many other open source technologies as well.

name: Taylor Thomas
bio:
Taylor Thomas is an Engineering Director working on WebAssembly platforms at Cosmonic. He actively participates in the open source community and is one of the creators of Krustlet and Bindle. He is an org maintainer for the wasmCloud project and a participant in the CNCF Wasm Working Group. His work at Intel, Nike, and Microsoft spanned various containers and Kubernetes platforms as well as WebAssembly platforms.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am extremely excited to help the Cloud Native community grow, especially with Wasm. I have been involved in the CNCF for years and am happy to be giving back to a community that got me deeply involved in open source.

name: Taylor Waggoner
bio:
Taylor is a Program Manager for CNCF. She is responsible for membership operations and program management.

With more than 10 years of operations experience, she comes to CNCF from Jive Software, where she managed the professional services partner program and various internal projects. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Journalism from the University of Oregon.

name: Thaddeus Zambellis
bio: Thaddeus Zambellis is an innovative IT entrepreneur and the driving force behind Outcept, a forward-thinking tech company. Specializing in Kubernetes, Thaddeus excels in orchestrating containerized applications to enhance scalability and performance. With a deep passion for Python and a keen interest in UI development using Vue, Thaddeus consistently pushes the boundaries of modern software solutions. Their expertise and dedication position Outcept at the forefront of the technology industry.

name: Tharanath G Prabhu
bio: I am a tech enthusiast with a passion for Linux and Kubernetes. I am deeply interested in using and contributing to open source projects. In my free time, I enjoy writing articles on various technologies and sharing my knowledge with others.

name: Thiago Sinji Shimada Ramos
bio: I'm Thiago Ramos, a BizDevOps professional passionate about cloud. I co-host Kubernetes User Groups (K8SUG) and run Cloud Native Melbourne, I am also part of CNCF Security Technical Advisory Group APAC. My international background—from Brazil to Japan and now Australia—has shaped my collaborative and innovative approach to technology. Outside of tech, I enjoy playing Go and solving magic cubes, hobbies that sharpen my strategic thinking.

name: Thibaut Champenois
bio: I am passionate about computers since I exist. Ex real-estate employee. Then a global pandemic happened. I am now working in Toulouse as a Cloud Native IT Operations & Secure Infrastructure Specialist in the space industry

name: Thiha Min Thant
bio: Thiha Min Thant is a Senior Site Reliability Engineer specializing in Kubernetes, cloud-native technologies, and observability. Actively contributing to CNCF projects like LitmusChaos, he focuses on enhancing system reliability and advancing chaos engineering practices. Passionate about fostering innovation, Thiha is committed to empowering teams to build scalable and resilient infrastructure.

name: Thisura Wijesekera
bio: I began my career as a system engineer with a strong passion for Linux, which laid the foundation for my journey into the DevOps world. With around 5 years of experience, I’ve developed a deep interest in the CNCF landscape, particularly about kubernetes and tools like ArgoCD, Helm, Kyverno, and Keda. I’m eager to further my skills and make impactful contributions to cloud-native infrastructure and platform engineering efforts.

name: Thiyagarajan Elangovan
bio: I am an open-source enthusiast and cloud-native architect who loves kubernetes with a strong passion for CNCF technologies. I work as a Principal Cloud Engineer at Verizon, focusing on designing and building scalable, reliable, and resilient Kubernetes platforms for enterprise cloud-native application development, aimed at enhancing developer experience and operational efficiency. My experience includes Database, DevOps, AWS and architecting cloud-native platforms, bridging business needs with technological solutions to drive efficiency and innovation. I remain actively engaged with the cloud-native community, aws user groups and helping people to learn and grow with it. Currently I'm learning golang, AI/ML and eager to contribute to open-source initiatives in the near future.

name: Thomas Di Giacomo
bio:
Thomas Di Giacomo is Chief Technology and Product Officer for SUSE, where he leads our global Office of the CTO and Product and Solution Management. His team covers SUSE’s entire portfolio of products as well as innovation priorities. He is also responsible for driving and guiding SUSE’s current and future technology and solutions, and for sharing SUSE’s vision with customers, partners, and key industry stakeholders.

Prior to his role, Thomas was SUSE’s President of Engineering & Innovation and was responsible for the rapid growth of SUSE’s expanding portfolio. He has over 20 years of experience in the IT industry, serving in various global leadership and executive roles in engineering and product innovation.

Thomas holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Geneva, and lives in France.

name: Thomas Labarussias
bio:
I'm OSS/Ecosystem Advocate at Sysdig, the company which created and open-sourced Falco, the Security Runtime Engine for Kubernetes and Cloud-Native technologies. I worked for Qonto, a modern banking for SMEs and freelancers, where I managed their Kubernetes clusters and the enthusiastic tools around, like ArgoCD, Traefik, Prometheus. I also assisted for many years pure-players and e-business companies for a large managed service provider, as an AWS expert and FinOps. I'm one of the longest tenured members of the Falco community, and the creator of Falcosidekick and Falcosidekick-UI, two major components of the Falco ecosystem.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As an SRE for several years, I've been able to use a number of CNCF projects in production. I'm also one of the maintainers of the most advanced OSS security project in the landscape. I would like to help even more architects and users to integrate these projects into their infrastructures. Moreover, in 2024, the KubeCon EU will be in Paris, France, it's important for me to do my best to help the organizers and show the vitality of French tech.

name: Thomas P Connolly
bio: Senior architect and engineer with over twenty years of experience designing and architecting systems across multiple domains. I’m currently working as the Platform Engineering architect at NAB.

name: Thomas Rotsaert
bio: As a Run Cloud Engineer, Kubernetes is a mandatory step in our wonderful Cloud world. Obtaining certifications, attending Kubecons, and using Kubernetes in my daily life are some important milestones that I enjoyed understanding.

name: Thomas Schuetz
bio:
Thomas is a Enterprise Architect, Advocate and Educator enthusiastic about making cloud-native more comfortable. As a CNCF/CDF Ambassador and Open Source Contributor, he is always eager to find ways to deliver software and troubleshoot issues more efficiently.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am very passionate about cloud-native technologies and working with them is cool. In the last few years, I got more and more involved in the cloud-native community and learned that it's not only about technical things, it's also about the people and the community. I am excited to be an ambassador because I like to bring people into the cloud-native world but also educate and teach them how to use products and technologies.

name: Thomas Vitale
bio:
Thomas Vitale is a software engineer with a focus on building cloud native solutions, currently working at Systematic in Denmark. He is the author of the "Cloud Native Spring in Action" book and plays an active role in the cloud native ecosystem as a CNCF Ambassador, Co-Chair of the CNCF Application Development Working Group, Oracle ACE Pro, and Testcontainers Community Champion.

A strong advocate of open source collaboration, Thomas contributes to various projects in the Java and cloud-native space, including Spring AI, Testcontainers, Carvel, Dapr, and Buildpacks. He is also passionate about sharing his expertise with the community through talks, workshops, and writing on technical topics.

name: Thorben Von Hacht
bio: Thorben von Hacht is a DevOps Engineer at Apple, where he specializes in developing and expanding the capabilities of the Apple Online Store. He's actively engaging with multiple CNCF communities, demonstrating his enthusiasm for working alongside the open-source community to address complex infrastructure challenges on a large scale.

name: Thuan Le
bio: I am working as an SRE and maintain the infrastructure on public cloud. My main expertise focuses on public cloud, Linux, automation.

name: Tianyi Yang
bio: I am a seasoned full-stack software engineer with over 17 years of experience in developing and architecting web framework platform solutions across diverse industries. Specializing in Kubernetes and CNCF technologies, I have led significant projects, focusing on cloud system testing and monitoring platforms using Kubernetes, Helm, and Terraform. I am a Kubestronaut and highly proficient in system design, automation, and DevOps practices.

name: Tibo Beijen
bio:
I am an IT professional with over 20 years of experience in software engineering, architecture, and DevOps.

My Kubernetes journey started in 2017. Always having leaned towards open source, I have developed a deep appreciation of the CNCF ecosystem. Ultimately my masters in Industrial Design Engineering shines through: The tech and the focus on stakeholders and end-users, resulting in innovation and the crafting of products that offer a great experience.

name: Tiexin Guo
bio:
Founder and PMC chair of DevStream@CNCF, ex-AWS senior DevOps, ex-Huawei tech expert, cloud architect for Daimler, Tesco, Credit Suisse, and other Fortune 500 corps. Writer at DevOps.com, guest expert at GitGuardian (DevSecOps), blog@Medium: https://medium.com/4th-coffee. Key speaker at the 1st Lisbon K8s meetup. Keynote speaker of BuildStuff 2022. I specialize in DevOps and cloud-related technologies, like CI/CD, developer tools, Terraform, AWS, etc., and I blog on DevOps/DevSecOps.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am truly excited and honored to be an ambassador for the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF). This opportunity allows me to contribute to the promotion and adoption of cutting-edge cloud-native technologies, which play a crucial role in shaping the future of software development and infrastructure. Being an ambassador also connects me with a vibrant, passionate community of professionals who share insights and experiences, fostering collaboration and innovation. I am genuinely grateful for this chance to learn from others and help drive the industry forward, making a meaningful impact on the cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Tiffany Jernigan
bio: Tiffany is a CNCF Ambassador, seasoned technologist and content creator in the Cloud Native space. She most recently was a senior developer advocate at VMware. She also formerly worked as a software developer and developer advocate at Amazon, Docker, and Intel. Prior to that, she graduated from Georgia Tech with a degree in electrical engineering. You can find her at tiffanyfay.dev (and for Bluesky).

name: Tihomir Nikolov
bio: I am a Cloud Engineer passionate about all things related to Kubernetes. I love as well Google Cloud and AWS. Furthermore, I like GitOps, IaC, Argo project and all CNCF content.

name: Tim Berry
bio: I've been working in tech for over 25 years as an engineer, consultant and leader. I'm old enough to remember what we had to put up with before Kubernetes, so I'm a huge fan! These days I help organisations to be successful with technical training and enablement, and I write about cloud engineering, python and occasionally game development at https://timberry.dev

name: Timo Ribbers
bio: I'm a experienced DevOps and Cloud Engineer with a background in software development, specializing in Kubernetes and CNCF technologies. My expertise lies in integrating GitOps principles to enhance and automate operations. I focus on helping organizations streamline their DevOps processes and optimize their infrastructure for greater efficiency and reliability.

name: Timothy Gouskov
bio: DevOps Engineer & System Administrator/Architect

name: Timur Ishkayev
bio: I'm an experienced DevOps Engineer with deep expertise in the fintech industry. My specialty lies in streamlining processes across both cloud-based and on-premises infrastructures. I strongly advocate for a comprehensive code-driven approach, which I use to create durable and adaptable environments. I'm enthusiastic about enhancing operational workflows and love adopting innovative technologies.

name: Tin Matienzo
bio: Tin is a Senior Meeting and Event Coordinator at The Linux Foundation, and manages the Project Pavilion at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon events. Prior to joining The Linux Foundation, Tin brings over seven years in the event industry and has planned and executed over one hundred corporate events, ranging from large scale meetings to intimate educational seminars.

name: Tina Krauss
bio:
As a Senior Event Manager at The Linux Foundation, Tina works closely with event sponsors and manages the sponsorship fulfillment team. She has over 9 years of work experience in the events industry producing conferences and tradeshows for non-profit organizations. Prior to joining The Linux Foundation, Tina worked for the Drupal Association and helped produce events for the project’s global open source community.

Tina holds an MA degree in Cultural Management and Cultural Tourism Management and a BA degree in Social and Cultural Sciences from the European University Viadrina.

name: Ting Seng Lik
bio: As a DevOps engineer with expertise in programming and cloud-native technologies, particularly Kubernetes, I specialize in container orchestration, cloud-native applications, and infrastructure automation. Driven by a deep enthusiasm for continuous learning, I actively explore emerging technologies to refine my craft. My current mission is to contribute to the development of scalable, resilient systems at GXBank, the first digital bank in Malaysia, while staying at the cutting edge of industry innovations.

name: Tobias Aanstad
bio: Tobias Aanstad is a platform engineer specializing in Kubernetes, Azure, and cloud-native operations, with a focus on cost management, uptime, and security.

name: Tobias Goerke
bio: Hello, I'm Tobias. My focus lies in bridging the gap between cloud and AI technologies. Actively engaged in the Kubeflow project, I contribute and advise on crafting robust cloud MLOps environments for clients, empowering their data science endeavors. We're hosting multiple Kubeflow and Kubernetes Meetups in Münster, Dortmund and Cologne, Germany to which I would love to welcome you!

name: Tobias Hannaske
bio: Self-taught Kubernetes practitioner with a focus on running PHP applications in a cloud-native way

name: Tobias Korf
bio: I am a passionate system administrator and programmer specializing in Kubernetes and modern container orchestration technologies. With deep technical expertise and hands-on experience, I support the operation and optimization of cloud-native applications. My enthusiasm for technology and automation drives me to develop innovative solutions and build reliable infrastructures.

name: Tobias Lahrmann Hansen
bio: Tobias is a seasoned Linux and Cloud Native enthusiast with hands-on experience running Kubernetes clusters on-premise and in the cloud. His practical knowledge and adaptability in these environments make him a valuable asset to any tech team. While enjoying his advanced Linux computer janitor role, he slowly got tired of the toil involved with hand-rolling new servers and juggling shared libraries. Seeking a better way to bin-pack applications, he began advocating the use of containers; however, this didn't remove the need to hand-roll servers, so his journey led him to explore Kubernetes, where he quickly gained a taste for monitoring workloads with Prometheus and empowering his colleagues to make metrics-driven decisions. Having worked with Kubernetes and its abstractions, Tobias still prefers his simple command line for most tasks. He firmly believes in the UNIX philosophy and KISS principles, even if daily driving Emacs might go against these principles.

name: Tobias Polley
bio: Trainer, Coach and Architect at predic8 GmbH (Bonn, Germany). Co-Host of the Bonner Microservices Meetup.

name: Tolotra Randrianjohany
bio: DevOps Engineer with a strong passion for Kubernetes.

name: Toluwanimi E. Banji-Idowu
bio: Hi, I'm Tolu—a DevSecOps Engineer passionate about building secure, scalable cloud-native architectures. With expertise in CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and container orchestration, I specialize in implementing security-first practices across multi-cloud environments. I'm actively expanding my knowledge in CNCF technologies, particularly Kubernetes and cloud-native security patterns, and looking forward to contributing to CNCF projects while sharing my journey and technical insights.

name: Tom Hauschke
bio: DevOps Engineer, Open Source Enthusiast & Kubernetes Fan

name: Tom Trapp
bio: Tom's IT journey began in 2010 at the age of 14 with a short internship in a hospital's IT department. In 2012, he joined Novartis in Basel for a successful and enriching apprenticeship to become an IT specialist. After completing his training, Tom embarked on a professional career in IT consulting, initially focusing on Adobe AEM and SAP Hybris/Commerce consulting and development. He later transitioned into the cloud, Kubernetes, and DevSecOps domains, gaining expertise through various courses, certifications, projects, and milestones. Today, Tom is deeply committed to the principles of DevSecOps and the power of open-source technologies. With an unyielding passion for growth and innovation, he excels at solving complex IT challenges and continuously pushing the boundaries of technical excellence.

name: Tom Van Dinther
bio: I moved from the tiny bit on the edge of the map (New Zealand) to The Netherlands to reconnect with my heritage and to pursue bigger opportunities in platform engineering. I love to push the envelope on how we bring applications to users and contribute to communities that bring this innovation. You'll mainly find me in the Crossplane, CUE and KCL communities looking for answers in the pursuit of excellence in developer experience and platform engineering. Keep up to date with my discoveries on my blog at https://mioi.io/blog/

name: Tom Van Humbeeck
bio: Started as a System Administrator with a strong focus on Linux and Open Source tools. During the time rolled into the DevOps culture and started learning about Containers, Kubernetes. At my current role my learning path is still growing. Ready to explore some new tools...

name: Tomas Rivera
bio: Technology Operations @ AiFi Inc. Enthusiast for solving complex challenges. Leading the adoption of Cloud Native technologies in the dynamic field of Spatial Intelligence.

name: Tomasz Cholewa
bio: Tomasz is a DevOps Expert and a Cloud Native architect of environments based on cloud, containers, Kubernetes or OpenShift and his personal passion for smart automation. He strives to share his knowledge with others by providing presentations, workshops, and training. He creates a variety of content starting, from articles, ebooks, courses published on his website (https://cloudowski.com), to videos on his YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/@Cloudowski) and the “Rozchmurzony” Podcast (in Polish). He despises raw onions and dishonesty. Loves authenticity and relationships based on it, and a good cheesecake.

name: Tomasz Szymański
bio: I'm helping my customer build stable and resilient infrastructures based on Cloud Native solutions. I'm trying to grow Cloud Native awareness through internal meetings and workshops. In my work I'm focused on automation, high-ability configuration, and security aspects of Cloud Native solutions.

name: Tommy Duc Luu
bio: I am a fullstack developer and consultant at Sopra Steria. I have a passion for DevOps and automation, and have worked mainly with Kubernetes and Cloud platforms. My goal is to become a skilled technician within the computer science field.

name: Tomohiro Katsumura
bio: Tomohiro Katsumura is a system architect and software engineer at NRI. He is passionate about cloud-native technologies such as container technologies (Linux, Kubernetes, Istio, Cilium, Linkerd), observability (OpenTelemetry, Grafana stacks), SRE, platform engineering, and many more. As a software engineer, he has developed an open-source API Gateway using Golang. He is therefore familiar with API technologies including GraphQL, gRPC, and API security. He has been passionate about advancing cloud-native technologies by leaning and contributing to open-source software.

name: Tony Norlin

At my employer I am involved in organising in-person as well as online events, focused on Cloud Native and Kubernetes. I currently have a member seat in the CNCF Marketing Committee representing Conoa. My specialty is anything Cilium, but I work with technologies throughout the landscape. Currently blogging at https://medium.com/@norlin.t and https://kubernaut.eu/

name: Tony Prawiro Hadimulyono
bio: Tony is a tech enthusiast who loves cloud computing, containers, DevOps, and open-source technologies. He works as a cybersecurity engineer, focusing on making cloud and DevOps platforms secure. In his job, Tony collaborates with others to create threat models, suggest security controls, and develop security monitoring use cases for SIEM systems. Tony enjoys learning new things and has earned certifications from AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, ISC2 CSSLP, and CNCF/Linux Foundation Kubernetes. He is now learning about Machine Learning and Generative AI, with the goal of using AI to enhance the security of cloud and DevOps platforms.

name: Tore Sæterdal
bio: Senior Platform Developer. Loves working with Kubernetes and the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Torjus Jåstad Knudsen
bio: Torjus is a developer with a passion for Kubernetes and cloud technology.

name: Toru Komatsu
bio:
Toru contributes to OSS as an individual contributor. He is the author and lead developer of youki, an OCI Runtime in Rust, and I am also a maintainer of the OCI Runtime Specification. Additionally, he serves as a reviewer for runwasi and is involved in developing a world that utilizes containers and Wasm. Lately, he has developed an interest in Kubernetes schedulers. Furthermore, he has given presentations at KubeDay Japan and has spoken at various community events in Japan.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The area of container runtime is the unsung hero of the Cloud Native space, where the intricacies of the technology and new features often don't get the spotlight they deserve. As a developer in this field, I want to help more people become aware of the exciting features it has to offer. I aim to encourage them to take the leap into this fascinating domain! I am also looking forward to assisting the Japanese Cloud Native community in becoming more vibrant on an international level.

name: Tran Kien
bio: Hey there! I’m Kien, an SRE by day and a Kubernetes explorer by night. I thrive on solving production puzzles, crafting slick CI/CD pipelines, and diving into new tech - all while keeping it fun.

name: Trevor Muchenje

I excel in implementing DevOps and MLOps practices, streamlining the development and deployment of software and AI solutions through automated CI/CD pipelines. I specialize in technologies including Kubernetes, Prometheus, Argo and Terraform. Hold several AI certifications from AWS and Azure as well as Enterprise Architecture and Agile Project Management certs. I am highly commitment to excellence and continuous improvement.

When I'm not diving into the latest tech innovations, you'll find me traveling, meeting new people, and making friends along the way. Looking forward to connecting with you!

He is really passionate about creating a safe space for newbie contributors to contribute, learn, and collaborate within the CNCF community.

I enjoy automation, infrastructure as code, and software delivery process enhancements.

I believe that continuous learning and sharing knowledge is essential in the technology field. In addition to my technical expertise, I strongly advocate for the principles of open-source, collaboration, and shared responsibility. Blog link: https://iamunnip.hashnode.dev/

My expertise encompasses both public cloud platforms and on-premises environments, with a strong focus on the core infrastructure components of Identity, Compute, Storage, and Networking. My experience spans diverse industries, including Utilities, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Banking, Finance, and Insurance, where I've been involved in numerous large-scale cloud migration and digital transformation initiatives. Currently, I'm deeply focused on Azure's containerization offerings, particularly Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), in solution areas.

name: Valentin Hristev
bio: I'm a Cloud Native consultant and trainer with over two decades of experience. I specialize in keeping cloud environments clear and storm-free, helping companies implement cutting-edge solutions. Passionate about innovation and embracing challenges, I dedicate myself to empowering individuals through continuous learning. I also actively participate in non-profit organizations and community events. Outside of work, I enjoy spending time with my dog and exploring my passion for cars. My dedication to technology and personal growth is complemented by my drive to master life's bumpy and uncertain courses.

name: Vander Nunes

I enjoy sharing my expertise through Meetups, where I discuss Kubernetes, cloud automation, and best practices in the industry. With a growing emphasis on KSPM, I am also committed to helping organizations strengthen their security in Kubernetes environments. To learn more about my work, you can reach out to me at vander@linux.com

name: Vanessa Heric
bio: Vanessa is the Director of CNCF Events, managing global events for The Linux Foundation’s Collaborative Projects. She has 20+ years experience producing conferences, corporate meetings, trade shows and consumer events for Fortune 500 Companies in both the IT and golf industries. Vanessa holds a BS in Political Science from the University of California, Santa Barbara.

name: Vasu Chandrasekhara
bio: Vasu is Vice President and Chief Architect on topics concerning the Cloud Native Strategy at SAP. Having always been accused of having his head in the clouds, he went on to make it his career. In his current role, he works with several cross-product initiatives to foster the cloud native mindset across engineering teams. In spite of having a very brown thumb, he went green by reaching into the bountiful cloud native and open source ecosystem and was instrumental in establishing Kubernetes (with Project Gardener) as the modern foundation at SAP. As a champion of cloud native development, advocating both inner and open source technologies, he aims to make innovation simpler for both SAP and its customers. Vasu holds a degree in Physics and Computer Science from the University of Osnabrück but refuses to be tied down to any geography. He prefers it in the cloud.

name: Vasu Madaan
bio: I'm Vasu Madaan, a passionate tech enthusiast with a deep love for Cloud Computing, DevOps, and Artificial Intelligence. Every day, I strive to explore and push the boundaries of what's possible in the tech world. I thrive at the intersection of these dynamic fields, constantly seeking new challenges and opportunities to innovate.

name: Veacheslav Stasiuc
bio: Hey there! I’m a DevOps and Kubernetes enthusiast who truly enjoys his work—whether it's diving into new tech, solving challenges, or sharing what I’ve learned with others. If you’re up for chatting about Kubernetes or exploring the ever-changing world of DevOps, let’s connect and make the complicated things a bit more fun together!

name: Venkata Satish Kumar Reddy Pichipati

Passionate about cloud-native technologies, particularly those under the CNCF, I continuously strive to expand my knowledge in this fast-paced, ever-evolving field. In my free time, I enjoy walking, learning new things, and spending quality time with my family.

Proficient in Kubernetes, leveraging my technical skills to optimize cloud deployments. Dedicated to delivering robust, scalable solutions for enterprise clients. Passionate about driving innovation and efficiency in cloud environments.

I specialize in designing and implementing scalable, secure systems that optimize performance and resilience while driving infrastructure efficiency through automation. I am also passionate about sharing knowledge and engaging with the Cloud-Native community through Meetups and blogging.

bio: As a Senior DevOps/Cloud Engineer, I bring extensive experience in managing and securing infrastructure from development to production environments. Initially starting my career as a software developer, I transitioned my focus to cloud infrastructure, expanding my skills in Kubernetes, OpenShift, Azure and microservices. My expertise encompasses building automation and complex systems for configuration management, enhancing server monitoring and implementing robust security concepts. My goal is to leverage my skills to drive efficient, secure, and reliable infrastructure solutions.

name: Victor Aguilera Fuentes
bio:
My career has revolved around containerization and infrastructure, ranging from DevOps engineering to offering GKE support to Google Cloud's top premium customers.

Currently, I'm part of the operations team at Red Hat's demo platform, where we provision environments for our technical sales teams. Our platform's logic is built on OpenShift. A deep understanding of container orchestration and infrastructure automation tools is essential to ensure the correct functionality and resilience of our platform.

name: Victor Durojaiye
bio: I am a Cloud Engineer who has a passion for anything cloud. I also have a passion for learning new cloud technologies

name: Victor S. Recio
bio: I am Victor S. Recio (vsroot_), an accomplished professional with extensive experience in Linux, Open Source, Containers, Cloud and DevOps tools. As the founder of OpenSaturday.org and a leader in open source communities in the Dominican Republic, I am dedicated to fostering technological innovation and collaboration. Currently, I work as a Senior Cloud Engineer/DevOps, focusing on modernization, migration, and deployment of container technologies for clients in the USA and the Caribbean. My role involves leveraging cloud solutions to drive efficiency and scalability. My previous experience includes serving as a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) at Microsoft for the Dominican Republic, where I developed a deep understanding of cloud architecture and solutions. Over the past seven years, I have provided consultancy on DevOps methodologies and cloud architecture, ensuring alignment with agile practices. I have also been a design consultant for Microservices architectures, particularly for banks in the Dominican Republic. As a passionate advocate for continuous learning and self-improvement, I have spoken at international forums on Cloud Governance, Container Security, and Linux Administration. I have conducted numerous workshops on Linux, DevOps, Docker, and Kubernetes, benefiting organizations both nationally and internationally.

name: Victor Varza

My expertise lies in designing and implementing excellent software systems, with over 15 years of experience in the development of large-scale platforms based on Linux and Kubernetes. When I am not coding, I enjoy helping the community by co-organizing OpenSource Bucharest Meetup and KCD Romania.

name: Victoria Norton
bio: Senior Cloud Engineer for Hastings Direct, specialising in Kubernetes deployments, configuration and support.

name: Vidar Anima Normann

Kubernetes felt like a natural next step. The Kubernetes ecosystem and the CNCF are very friendly environments and participating at a KubeCon is one of the most inspiring and educational experiences I've had - looking forward to my next possibility to interact with the community.

I have contributed to the Rails framework and KubeArmor as part of the Linux Foundation mentorship program and created a couple of Ruby Gems.

SRE , AWS solution architect , FinOps consultant

,DevOps , AWS Community Builder , Open-source

name: Viktor Farcic

Viktor Farcic is a lead rapscallion at Upbound and a published author. He is a host of the YouTube channel DevOps Toolkit and a co-host of DevOps Paradox.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Viktor Farcic is excited to join the CNCF Ambassadors program because he believes in the power of open source software to transform the world. He is passionate about helping others learn about and adopt CNCF technologies, and he is eager to contribute to the CNCF community in new and innovative ways. Viktor is also excited to be part of a team of dedicated and talented individuals who are working to make the world a better place through open source software.
