Currently working as a Data Engineer Intern, Vinay excels in designing and implementing data-driven solutions, leveraging a robust tech stack that includes Python, AWS, Apache Spark, Docker, and Kubernetes. He has expertise in designing and implementing REST as well as GraphQL APIs, working with cloud-based technologies and container orchestration to ensure scalable and efficient data pipelines. Vinay’s journey in technology began during his college years, where he completed projects involving Node.js, Redis, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB. His strong problem-solving abilities and passion for technology have led him to explore and transition into Scala, further expanding his skill set in data engineering. Vinay is committed to continuous learning and staying at the forefront of technology, with a keen interest in cloud-native solutions and modern data architectures.

You may find some of my passionate ramblings at https://vinothecloudone.medium.com/

Eager to tackle complex challenges and innovate in dynamic tech environments.

name: Wei Wang
bio:
I am the organizer of CNCF Community China, ShenZhen, and the author of , , and , specializing in Kubernetes, Docker, cloud-native architecture, and microservices.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm very happy to be part of the new CNCF Ambassador program once again, and to finally be able to bring more technical evangelism to the community and organize community events again!

name: Wendi West
bio: Wendi has been working as an Event Planner for The Linux Foundation since 2014 with her primary focus being CNCF’s KubeCon+CloudNativeCon events (since late 2016) where she manages the scholarship program and DEI activities, and acts as a liaison between the PR and Events team for Media + Analyst engagement at events. Wendi has produced corporate and non-profit events for over 15 years. She holds a BA from California State University, Fullerton and a certification in grant writing from the Center of NonProfit Management.

name: Whitney Lee
bio: Whitney is a kind and welcoming human who enjoys understanding and using tools in the cloud native landscape. Creative and driven, Whitney has created and delivered two KubeCon keynotes, a VMware Explore keynote, and countless fun, funny, and informative community conference keynotes. You can catch her lightboard streaming show ⚡️ Enlightning on her YouTube channel, she co-hosts the streaming show You Choose! - a 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure'-style journey through the CNCF landscape alongside Viktor Farcic, she is one of the hosts of Cloud Native Live on the CNCF YouTube channel, and she co-hosts the podcast Software Defined Interviews with Michael Coté.

name: Will Musgrave
bio: Will is a data architect that uses cloud native technologies to create secure, highly available and resilient systems that deliver great customer experiences while minimizing cloud costs wherever possible. He has industry experience developing software in a variety of disciplines, including medical physics, sports analytics, e-mental health and supply chain/logistics. He has a keen interest in CNCF technologies (including Kubernetes, Istio, Cilium and Flux) and strives to stay on top of the latest technological trends and contribute to the CNCF community. In his spare time, Will enjoys soccer, running, cooking and coffee.

name: Willem Berroubache
bio: As a Security Architect at a leading telecom company in Europe, I oversee an essential project aimed at strengthening the security framework of 5G networks, with a focus on Telco Cloud infrastructure. My role is to actively promote cloud-native technologies within the company, advocating for their strategic implementation to enhance our services. In addition to my project management duties, I am committed to regularly training my colleagues on Kubernetes, Linux, Prometheus, cloud-native ecosystems, and observability practices, ensuring that our team remains at the cutting edge of industry developments. As a cloud technology enthusiast, I am constantly seeking ways to improve my skills and deepen my knowledge in these technologies, as well as other rapidly evolving fields.

name: William Conway
bio: I specialize in performance testing for Dell VxRail and ACP for Azure platforms, we ensuring optimal system efficiency and reliability. Day to day we develop Kubernetes-based tools to streamline and enhance testing processes. Our work focuses on integrating cutting-edge technology for robust infrastructure and automation.

name: William Rizzo
bio:
I'm focused in helping customers designing, building, and running their Kubernetes and Internal Developer Platforms. I wore many hats in the IT world, Engineering, Pre-Post sales, Product Owner and Consulting. from HPC, Storage and Distributed Systems. I also enjoy volunteering at the Dutch Cloud Native/Kubernetes Meetup and the NL KCD. I have lived in many European countries and now Netherlands is the place I call home.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a CNCF Ambassador is the confirmation that my efforts towards the Open Source community are heading in the right direction. I'm excited to help the community and being supported and by the CNCF while doing it

name: Willian Marchan Aranda
bio: I am a cloud-native technology enthusiast with a strong passion for Kubernetes, service meshes, observability, and combining all of this with programming.

name: Wing Tsui
bio: I began my IT career as a backend developer by learning to build and run containerized apps on cloud platforms. This sparked my fascination with cloud-native technologies, and I have continued to explore them ever since. Stay hungry, stay foolish, stay curious, and stay humble to tech.

name: Wiriyang Pipatsakulroj
bio: Wiriyang is Senior Cloud Architect at a consulting company. He used to work at a big cloud service provider. His passions are about performance computing and cloud technology especially scheduling, observability and service mesh projects in CNCF.

name: Wojciech Guzik
bio: Works as Cloud Engineer, focuses on stable and resilient solutions. Has tendency to enable platforms for developers.

name: Wojciech Kocjan
bio: Experienced Software Engineer / SRE and CNCF Ambassador, Wojciech has 20 years of experience in IT and over a decade with public clouds. Passionate about building local communities, he's been co-organizing a local meetup in Krakow, Poland, which is part of CNCF Community. Passionate about automating all the things, building scalable and cloud native solutions, Kubernetes. Experienced with startups as well as large, enterprise companies. In free time, passionate about flying drones, solving puzzles and reading.

name: Wojtek Świeboda
bio: Fueled by curiosity, chasing insight. Data Scientist in Cybersecurity Department at Orange Poland.

name: Woojin Na

name: Xiaohui Zhang
bio:
Senior cloud native architect and evangelist at Flomesh. I am a seasoned programmer, LF APAC open source evangelist, CNCF Ambassador, member of the cloud native community committee(China local) and Microsoft Azure MVP. With many years of microservice and infrastructure practice experience, mainly involving microservices, containers, Kubernetes, DevOps, etc. In the past there years, I organize two meetups in Guangzhou and Service Mesh Conference in Shanghai together with community members. In the coming April 15, I will organize KCD in Dalian with other community members. I own a Chinese blog https://atbug.com and start writing on Medium https://addozhang.medium.com.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a CNCF ambassador is a recognition of my involvement in open source and cloud-native technology promotion over the past few years. After becoming a CNCF ambassador, I can better promote CNCF technology and organize more in-person and virtual events. At the same time, I can also receive more support from CNCF.

name: Xin Zhang
bio: Xin is the VP of Volcano Engine, previously CEO & co-founder of Caicloud and an ex-Googler. Xin has been actively involved in cloud native technology innovation, helping Chinese enterprises to achieve enterprise digital transformation and intelligence.

name: Xu Jin'An

Your deployments span big data systems at Petabyte scale, enterprise storage, and Azure Cloud environments. With expertise in cloud solutions, containerized applications, and AI/ML workloads on NVIDIA AI Enterprise, you specialize in leveraging Terraform and Kubernetes to modernize workloads and streamline cloud-native infrastructure deployments.

name: Yahya Alshamrani
bio: Driven, dedicated, and proactive, I approach every challenge with innovative and resourceful solutions, always eager to learn and experiment with new technologies.

name: Yanick Egli

Constantly evolving and deepening my expertise, I thrive in exploring and leveraging new CNCF projects. Passionate about staying ahead in the cloud-native space and giving back to the community.

name: Yannick Englert
bio: After completing my apprenticeship in 2016, I spent seven years working full-time for a telecommunications company as a DevOps engineer. In that role, I provided and maintained a container platform (PaaS) utilising CloudFoundry and Kubernetes. Currently, I work as a DevOps/Platform Engineer at an SME, where my responsibilities include supporting and developing our Kubernetes-based container platform, as well as education and enabling colleques and customers on their Cloud Native journey.

name: Yao-Siang Su
bio: Yao-Siang Su, a software architect with experience in the Kubernetes ecosystem and distributed systems. In recent years, he and his team have helped Taiwan's largest job bank website on its journey toward cloud-native. In addition to using CNCF projects such as Kubernetes, Prometheus, Argo CD, Helm, and Istio, he also enjoys using HashiCorp Vault to accomplish various tasks. In addition to cloud-native technologies, he also enjoys reading and learning the fundamentals of distributed systems and finds great joy in it.

name: Yash Gandhi

I've also been a speaker at KubeDay Singapore 2023. My technical experience include plethora of technologies like Kubernetes, Gitops, Service Mesh, Golang, Terraform and many more.

name: Yash Pimple

Serving as a co-organizer of the Cloud-native Thane community, Yash regularly hosts meetups and workshops to foster learning and growth within the community. With active contributions to the Keptn organization, Yash is dedicated to advancing the CNCF mission through leadership, advocacy, and technical expertise.

My experience also includes working as a DevOps Engineer, enhancing my ability to build and maintain resilient systems. Passionate about CNCF technologies, I hold numerous certifications. In my free time, I enjoy playing cricket, video games, and reading books.

bio: I am a software engineer turned dev-ops engineer. I found Kubernetes fascinating so i started mastering it. I am currently learning go so that i can contribute to it.

He helps organisations in their Digital transformation journey majorly on micro-services and cloud. He incessantly masters emerging technologies and diligently endeavours to remain fully apprised of the latest industry developments.

I am passionate about harnessing advanced technologies to achieve business objectives, and I thrive on tackling new challenges and contributing to significant projects.

I am focused on writing efficient, scalable, cloud native applications which leverages CNCF projects such as Kubernetes.I am focused on writing efficient, scalable, cloud native applications which leverages CNCF projects such as Kubernetes. I have a passion for building scalable infrastructures on hybrid cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure and GCP automating cloud infrastructure with tools like Chef and Ansible. Currently, managing large-scale microservices deployments while leading the COE-DevOps team to drive innovation and efficiency. I actively contribute to the DevOps community through Kubernetes meetups, open-source projects, and my blog on cloud-native technologies. Let’s connect and explore the exciting world of cloud-native solutions together

name: Yonathan Cedillos
bio: Senior DevOps Engineer with expertise configuring Flux and Argo and managing Cloud Infrastructure and Kubernetes cluster on AWS, GCP and Azure and recently Rancher for on-premise clusters. I also have experience configuring Prometheus and Grafana Stack for monitoring and observability.

name: Yong Gu
bio: As an experienced cloud architect, I specialize in transforming visionary concepts into scalable, high-impact solutions that drive enterprise success. With a proven track record of evolving proof-of-concept initiatives into fully optimized, production-ready systems, I excel at addressing complex architectural challenges with precision and innovation. My work is driven by a passion for emerging technologies and a commitment to continuous learning, enabling me to deliver cutting-edge, future-proof solutions in dynamic and rapidly evolving cloud ecosystems.

name: Yongkang He
bio:
Yongkang is a Principal Containers Specialist based in Singapore supporting Asia Pacific. He shifted the focus on Cloud Native technologies few years ago. He is now fully certified on Kubernetes (KCNA, CKA, CKAD and CKS). He embraces Open Source and dedicated to help the community. He is organizing the largest Kubernetes Meetup in Singapore. http://k8sug.com He created the automation scripts which can be found from GitHub to allow people to spin up a new Kubernetes Cluster in minutes. http://g.k8sug.com In addition, he created his YouTube channel to focus on Kubernetes Day 1 and Day 2 Data Management and Security. http://y.k8sug.com

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm super excited to be part of the Cloud Native Ambassadors program. I am pretty sure I will enjoy being able to work with other peers globally to learn and share.

name: Yosef Arbiv
bio:
I am married to Adi, father of three, and OpenTelemetry Group Leader at Cisco. My group and I are promoting OpenTelemetry adoption via contributions to the project, publishing blog posts on OpenTelemetry Blog (https://opentelemetry.io/blog/) & Cisco Tech Blog (https://techblog.cisco.com/tags/opentelemetry), and running OpenTelemetry talks & workshops at public events.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I want to promote OpenTelemetry and enable more people to use and contribute to it. I aim to improve the development processes in OpenTelemetry and to make the OpenTelemetry community more welcoming and supportive of new developers. I want to continue advocating for OpenTelemetry by promoting it at global events and helping others do so.

name: Yoshiaki Sakota
bio: I work as an SRE at TOKYO GAS Co., Ltd. Over the past several years, I've been involved in system development using a variety of CNCF technologies, particularly focusing on Kubernetes and Argo CD. I'm passionate about leveraging these technologies to deliver agile and valuable services to our customers.

name: Yoshitaka Fujii
bio: I am working as a Platform Engineer. I am committed to building platforms that leverage Cloud Native technologies to provide a better development experience. In particular, I have a deep interest in tools such as Terraform, etcd, Grafana and Argo CD.

name: Yoshiya Maki
bio: I work as an IT infrastructure engineer at NTT Communications Corporation. I have expertise in Azure, Google Cloud, ServiceNow, Container, CI/CD, and Infrastructure as Code. I am contributing to kubernetes/website.

name: Yoshiyuki Tabata
bio:
Yoshiyuki Tabata is a Senior OSS Consultant at Hitachi, Ltd. As an expert in Identity and Access Management (IAM) and APIs, he has provided numerous consultations over the past decade, including designing API and Authentication/Authorization platforms. He has actively contributed to CNCF TAG Security by facilitating APAC region community calls and leading the IAM white paper project, and he has added significant functionalities to OSS projects such as Keycloak. As a CNCF Ambassador, he has delivered talks at events like KubeCon, Apidays, and Open Source Summit focusing on secure solutions for the CNCF ecosystem. Additionally, as a Cloud Native Community Japan organizer and a Cloud Native Security Japan founder, he has organized several CNCF meetups in Japan.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I aim to improve the adoption and security of CNCF technologies in Japan by sharing my expertise from numerous projects. As a CNCF ambassador, I want to disseminate solutions and best practices for a more secure CNCF ecosystem.

name: Youngho Jung
bio: I am working as a Security Engineer:)

My work includes creating CI/CD pipelines, managing containerized environments, and configuring robust infrastructure.

name: Yuanpeng Liang
bio: Yuanpeng is a kubernetes & cloudnative enthusiast, also is a contributor of kubernetes and karmada, enjoys understanding and using the projects of cncf and enjoy technology advocacy.

name: Yuichi Nakamura

He is one of the first Japan evangelists of The Linux Foundation and launched Cloud Native Community Japan as CNCF Japan Chapter with community colleagues. He is also on the board of the Linux Foundation.

Dedicated to continuous learning and professional development, I effectively tackle evolving challenges in the field of cloud computing.

I am passionate about building Cloud Native Applications, with a particular fondness for AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform.

He is passionate about designing and implementing robust, scalable, highly available, maintainable and resilient systems upon Cloud Native technologies and Software Architecture principles. He has expertise in multi-cloud skills (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and Cloud Native technologies like Orchestrator (Kubernetes, Helm, KEDA), Service Proxy (NGINX, HAProxy), Security (OPA, Keycloak, Vault), Automation (Ansible, Terraform), Observability (Fluentbit, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana) as well as Java based application development with Object-Oriented-Design and Domain-Driven-Development.

With a deep passion for Kubernetes and Azure Arc, Zaid also serves as a Core Maintainer of the Azure Arc Jumpstart project (https://azurearcjumpstart.com/), where he contributes to advancing cloud-native technologies and practices.

Specialising in designing and implementing security architectures for cloud platforms, services, and workloads which mitigate security risks and align organisations with internal security standards and external compliance regulations. Combining deep technical knowledge with strategic leadership to build, inspire, and lead geographically diverse teams to drive technology and security maturity across global enterprises.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm honored to be an ambassador as I can help with spreading knowledge about fantastic cloud native technologies and connecting people with the same interest. It can help them to solve their issues instead of reinventing the wheel over and over again.

My expertise includes managing Kubernetes clusters, automating deployments, and optimizing application performance. You can explore my contributions and read my articles at https://acegik.medium.com/

name: Zou Nengren
bio:
I have spent the last seven years honing my expertise in the cloud-native ecosystem, with a particular focus on maintaining various communities like Kubernetes, CoreDNS, KNative, and Containerd. While my experience in these areas has been invaluable, my current focus lies in the Cloud OS System. As a seasoned professional, I regularly share my knowledge and insights on cloud-native technologies through my blog, which can be found at ustack.io. Whether you are a novice or a seasoned pro, my blog posts offer practical tips and in-depth analysis that can help you stay ahead of the curve in this rapidly evolving field. So whether you are looking to dive deeper into Kubernetes or explore the latest trends in cloud-native ecosystem, be sure to check out my blog.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: being an CNCF ambassador provides me with the opportunity to share my knowledge and expertise in cloud-native technologies with a wider audience, and allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest developments and trends in cloud-native technologies

name: Zouhair Amazzal

My expertise lies in creating scalable, automated solutions that enhance application delivery and infrastructure reliability.

I love exploring new ideas, learning from others, and sharing my knowledge through meetups, community events, and collaborations. It’s all about growing and helping others do the same!
